diBwugEeAhUiMZ_CkEfB2w.text: ABSOLUTLY AMAZING!!! I try to come here before every home game I attend. The food is great and so is the staff. They are incredibly accommodating and the best part is we can sit on the patio with our dog.

ur2GiUDr6ZwgZRf5OVQkqA.text: Man, it was a busy Saturday, lol. I had to give this place a try since I heard so many good things about it. I walked in with a few friends and you actually order first at the back and they bring you the food later. I thought it was going to be where we sat down first then someone takes our order, but that wasn't the case. There was four of us and we got an order of a sandwich, omelet, and two eggs benedict. I got the eggs benedict and it was something new for me. I got to say it was really delicious. I loved it. The problem was that I had an appetite that day so I was still hungry, lol.   The staff were professional and the food came out in a timely manner. I took a sip of someone's orange juice at our table and well, lets just say they serve alcohol and it was quite tasty. The vibe of the place was nice and relaxed. Every one there seemed they were having a good time and it also looked very clean and organized. If the weather was nice or whatever you feel is nice there is an outdoor patio if you like eating outdoors. All in all, place was nice, staff was good, and food was awesome. I will definitely be back here again and if you love breakfast/brunch then I'd say give this place a try!

DvKJgS4jzYUUDzWWyN72Gg.text: Loved the eating environment, very laid back, food is tasty!  We would definitely return.

6IXJ7CIffmgHPIUNmmSdcA.text: While the food here was good, I am just not a fan of the long line, the packed atmosphere, and the tight quarters. Just don't feel like I had any personal space, and made me feel a bit stressed out, and rushed. I would suggest coming here for breakfast, however I highly recommend to avoid the busy hours.

FOjSZDN27M4EjJdDnmcNeA.text: Great little spot in Tempe with great patio views of the Hill and hot ASU girls walking by. I had the chorizo breakfast and it was really good and not as oily as most. Also the price is really good and under $8 for most plates. It is great concept even with the extreme busyness they had on a Sunday morning. I wish for breakfast spots were a hybrid sit down fast food spot. My friend says I need to come back for the farmers benedict so I will return.

gyA8rCF7gM0qY6HkLN8V1w.text: We thought it was a joke when my Banana Foster French Toast was covered with a film of brown slime coming out from the mouth of the possessed girl from "Exorcist." After a few stirs, the revolting concoction would coagulate into an amorphous blob metastasizing and multiplying to devour its prey in a science horror film.   Panicky and nauseous, we summoned our young waitress to attend to our distress. "This is the banana foster sauce. It is not supposed to be syrupy and this is how it's always been made like this," she answered with such composure and disinterest in our seemingly futile concern.   Curiosity dared us to ask how the sauce was made. Returned with the precarious object still on the plate, our waitress proclaimed it was cooked with butter, reduced sugar, triple sac [and cornstarch, alien DNA...].  Lightning struck us as we exited the restaurant in trepidation into the scorching 109 degree heat under the Phoenix sun: we were in Tempe, Arizona.

NeGO6f7_C_9mKq2Fl6AAIA.text: I went here on recommendation from a friend.  I saw the reviews it had already picked up and figured it couldn't be too bad.  Well, its not too good either.  My first issue is that they don't offer Egg Beaters as a substitute.  Not a big deal, but I had assumed a trendy place and trendy spot might.  Next, the potatoes that were served to me were absolutely from the day before.  We have all had leftover potatoes and know the difference.  Finally, the restrooms and the soap "squeeze" bottle were incredibly filthy.    Unless you simply can not make scrambled eggs on your own, avoid the hype of this place.

sBxho3gHfgOWvZERW9MONQ.text: Love this lil spot...  Great salads and sandwiches and recently met a friend for breakfast and it was delicious.  The French toast was amazing and omelets are tasty.  They have great coffees, even espresso, and   Fresh squeezed juice.  Their bakery items are great for a treat later as well.  I usually bring friends from out of town here and then walk around mill ave afterwards or walk near the lake.  Great location and cute patio area if it's not too hot.    Great spot... Great food!

trkqP3dnCMMY4GPEKI2roA.text: Great place to get a top quality breakfast.. Pear omelet is awesome! Great coffee too.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pear omelet

j5OCeRL0-yPefxcNKrDbIQ.text: Since the place is crowded, it takes a long time to get your order. I came here with my coworkers for lunch and we had to wait 30 minutes for food.   It is also hard to find any empty table to sit; so one of us had to wait for the table while the rest of us ordered our food. This is not a place where you sit down and the waiter takes your order.   Food was okay overall; it was not the best meal I ever had and it wasn't the worst either.  I would probably go back when it is less busy. If we didn't have to wait, I would have given a rating of 3 or 4.

PZJdA7u9zgOE6pxHllDyQw.text: Plain n Simple Breakfast is the way to go.  Plenty of food and great presentation.  Enjoy the breakfast with a cup of their coffee which is very good.  Place is bustling around 9 on a Saturday am.  Grab a table in the back corner if you want some quiet.

rXFg8ihl2RATBDqGVO4AMw.text: The place was busy.  Still had plenty of seating outside on their patio.  Good vibe in the place, reminds me of liberty market in Gilbert.    I had a egg sandwich called killer. This sandwich had some cheese (forgot what kind of cheese) that was really strong.  It over powered the sandwich so I didn't care for it.    My wife had the pancakes.  Banana fosters pancakes I think.  These were really good.  I had half of her order since she never eats all of her food (lucky me;).    We also had a body Mary.  It was a little spicy, the way I like it.   It was not to strong, which to me is good if your having one with breakfast.     Next time we hike A-mountain,  we will stop in there to share the French toast.

EROVg4ILMkx4VtapGB7KBQ.text: Love, love, love Ncounter! We eat here regularly when we're out taking our walk. Normally we order the spiced oatmeal...best EVER! But I do love their Killer egg sandwich with gorgonzola. It's always cooked perfectly! I also love their Focaccia Roma Chicken sandwich. Oh, and don't forget the pecan cinnamon roll, it is nothing short of amazing. Even my stepson, who lives in SF (the home of fantastic food) comes here every time he's home visiting, just for the oatmeal and cinnamon roll.  Aside from the food, the best thing about this place is the manager, Daniel! He always smiles and says hello when we walk in, stops by our table to check on us (if he has time). Most of the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful if you need something else, e.g. extra milk, condiments, etc. There's a reason they are always busy...because of the great food and the friendly staff.

-GpbALRlDciiO6v4qkdonw.text: NCounter is located on the North end of Mill Ave, near the PHX Metro Light Rail track.  As much as I hate going out to eat on Mill Ave, due to the stressful moments I have trying to find parking, this place is definitely worth it.  The restaurant has a modern industrial feel to it, as the color scheme is black, white, and gray with orange accents. It's very trendy and has a "underground hipster" feel to it.  Very appropriate for its college town location.  They have a large patio section surrounded by trees which makes brunch on a February afternoon seem like you're relaxing in paradise.   Service there is very laid back.  You place your order at the front counter, you're given a letter (N.C.O.U.N.T.E.R. which I thought was pretty clever) to bring to your table as you wait for a server to deliver your food.  You serve your own drinks and retrieve any extra napkins or utensils you may need for your meal.  Seating is all first come first serve based, and the restaurant is even dog friendly.  I was really excited to see a cute Shitzu getting tangled up under a neighboring table.   The only thing that I didn't like was the line formation when ordering.  Tables and chairs are set up down the center of the restaurant in an angular position and you are forced to maneuver your way around other guests as you walk to the back counter to place your order.  Even there, space is limited; which results in you waiting in line- standing a foot away from customers trying to enjoy their meal.   Once in line, I was struggling with deciding on an meal.  There is so much variety to choose from.  I got to the counter expecting to see only breakfast items (waffles, pancakes, omelettes, etc) but they also offer a selection of soups, salads, and sandwiches.  For the most part, NCounter is a great spot to visit for brunch if you're in the Tempe area.  I really enjoyed the ambiance and the quick service.  It's probably not something that I would necessarily make the trip for if I wasn't living in the area- but that also comes hand in hand with the fact that I hate parking on Mill. :)

nf-onUT4eP1bwgAiIoc5Zw.text: Well not much on the lunch menu here really appeals to me so I don't think it will be in my regular rotation even though it is pretty close to my new job. However, I certainly don't mind having breakfast for lunch every once in a while. I had the French Toast today and it was awesome! As the other reviewers have said this place does get pretty crowded, though. Even though it was past noon and it is the summer so ASU is not in session, I still had no choice but to eat at the bar. Well, I guess I did have a choice, I could have sat outside but come on, its over 100 degrees out there!

t0095rKD3LAh7plc7Do6QQ.text: HUGE let down! The food was nothing special, and the eggs on my eggs benedict were way over cooked. The people that think this place is great are the same people I say there wearing skull caps, and bennies as it was 106 degrees out.  Even the set up of this place was horrible! It was way to crowded with table, and it was hard to even walk around. The tables outside are bolted down and so are the seats, so unless you are the size of 6th grader prepare to be uncomfortable.   I get that the metal seats and table look trendy and cool, but it is Arizona and when I can't even touch the table and it is hard to sit....you have made a mistake!  The menu is nothing special and if it wasn't for the drinks they offer this would be a one star place.  If you want to be go some place that looks fancy but fails to deliver then go check it out.

RYUL-hjjNqY_eq3oxCZ4jQ.text: We were here for a Sunday brunch and oh lord it was packed. It took some time to get seated as it is all open seating. Food was delicious and the wait was quite a worth. I simply love the interiors and will definitely visit this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Ncounter

acOOM-JU9492C1DTFLIt8Q.text: I really enjoy this place. So far I've had their blueberry muffin, coffee, french toast and chipotle breakfast burrito. They all did not disappoint. The breakfast burrito is very large, good enough to share with someone. I don't want to rehash what everyone else says. Come for the food and coffee - its worth it.

Q4fQzo7fb9SYQeN6KG_9IQ.text: Mother's Day was a bad day to take friends. But everyone enjoyed their food. The wait wasn't as long for a table (considering like vultures we scoped out any where there was a family finishing up).  Everyone is always helpful and friendly. I can only say that this time my meal was slightly cold. I won't hold it against them, and not come back because previous visits have always been exceptional.

f5Ux8uKiQmA8y75EfavLIg.text: Place was totally crowded everybody having fun food is great, came fast even with the crowd and it's expensive. Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sorry, it went fast

aaUH_6oAdJkd0tXZaVRrLg.text: Phenomenal!  Get the grilled cheese.  Breathtaking.  And might I recommend a mimosa?

Lly25iJBvk6X93PdKon0mg.text: Ncounter features fresh food and an expansive menu.  The ingredients are local when available and the location and feel of the restaurant is top notch. More spicy food needed tho, even tho the hot sause collection is nice...  High three star rating. I recommend...

oG6boWeiiR_LTlj6ewS2Fg.text: Trendy, noisy, bright place, with lots of energy.  Came on a Saturday morning, and the place was hopping.  Good service crew, that gets the job done, cleans up and turns over the tables quickly.  You order at the counter, and they bring your food to you.  My wife had the Farm Market with only veggies.  She enjoyed the hollandaise sauce.  I had the Huevos and Chorizo, which was very good.  Not spectacular, but very good.  Portions are not huge, but reasonable size.  Our friend had the Bananas Foster, that looked really good.

pC8WrpW0_XQvpiRh_KpEjw.text: Place was busy on a Saturday morning but luckily there is tons of seating. Line moved quick and food came in a decent amount of time. Employees were friendly and cleaned plates quickly after we finished. Good prices and the only breakfast joint on mill so I was happy it wasn't disappointing. I would definitely go back. Plenty of interesting food options to try.

dFjwmQ37ULhHYYdr3RyB4Q.text: Just like their counterparts-I believe the potatoes are frozen from the bag.  Gross.  Also the whole setup is a little confusing-being that it's counter service-it doesn't seem that it's laid out very well.

FkbFGkoutYIcyAumUC9SuQ.text: AWESOME place - The Chocolate Chip pancakes with Strawberries and whipped cream are ridiculous. Add a mimosa and you're in business. Love the atmosphere!

2ozhnyosMr43KllWe0AmhQ.text: Chopped salad is amazing but bananas foster French toast is excessively drenched in syrup and butter, and served with syrup and butter on the side!! Environment is great.

_j3sTOqifnA0OurakkSCaw.text: Very nice. Food was great, and they had an extensive menu. The food was presented beautifully, and you can order your choice of sides with everything (fresh fruit, salad, fries, etc).

pfAZgP3VvwopJcaUNi9acw.text: We have been lost without Palette in Downtown Phx, but this place may be our new spot.  The atmosphere is great, clean modern lines and very trendy setup.  The staff very friendly the owner? walking around checking on guests to make sure everyone is pleased with their orders.  The food DELISH!  I had the plain and simple (eggs, potatoes, toast $5.50) simple and great tasting.  My husband  had the  Croquet Monsieur and loved it and for $7.50 you cannot beat it.  Great for families or meeting up with a friend.  This place is amazing and we will be back!

BieqvYuH591IvX9nUU5Fmg.text: The food is amazing. Loved every bite of my fusion chicken salad and all my other lunch dates were more than pleased with their meals. Just dont be fooled by the "brunch" title. This isn't a cute little sit down where you can loyter for hours with girl friends. It's located right near ASU and so is pact with college students, super crowded-a bit like an upscale cafeteria. Nonetheless, very dainty and chill. Food is worth it I guess

YxNCAGi06IH-GjpOw9S4OQ.text: This place is freggin AWESOME!!! So far I've only had an omelette, but it was so wonderfully stuffed with spinach, toms, and feta that I haven't been able to order anything else! Today's omelette isn't as GLORIOUS as last week's but I'm still crush it!

1EDVKcmRbtdYY3DMPpqVsA.text: First time here, great food, open seating and good service.  Recommend breakfast, I'll be back to try some of the sandwiches.  One person in our party had the grilled cheese and said it was best she's ever had!

Ji1zuqdJYLw0IeNTA-2qrA.text: Never again! Car towed after a 45 minute wait!!! The food is very good. Great menu mix...its just that you really need to devote an hour and a half of your life to enjoy it. Not very conducive in a fast paced place like ASU/ Tempe.

jNUkqWfi_48SP9aBXDy_Vw.text: Continue to come here for breakfast, been 8 or 9 times now and it still has yet to fail me. Today I had the santa fe sautee and it was delicioso!! There are so many options on the menu that it is hard to choose from, but I have definitely found 3 favorites on here. The turkey and avocado sandwich was not a fav.. but I'm not much of an avocado fan anyway. I definitely recommend this place to people looking for a good breakfast joint.

LkG0N0uYdrh5Ym7R7BW85Q.text: Good food for a good price! Everything was presented well, and all of the food was fresh. They seem quite popular! The service was friendly and quick.

D15EoV7nYI_KjcidRaE4VQ.text: NCounter is hands down the best place on Mill Ave and in the Tempe area for breakfast and lunch. Although it can get quite busy/crowded at times the wait for food is never too long and always worth the wait. The staff is always friendly and the atmoshpere is great. Some of my favorites include the chipotle egg burrito and the urban caesar salad but the portebellini sandwich is by far the best thing on the menu! No matter what you order it will be delicious and made with fresh ingredients.

R6J7qQnPtX9znq7zmanMmA.text: My advice is go for specialty items or make it at home  and this is why. Unfortunately, I can't give many stars for my experience today at this restaurant. I ordered the plain and simple. I just wanted basic breakfast. I was very disappointed. The bacon was cold and chewy. The Bagel was hard and cold. I gave them the benefit of the doubt and requested another bagel it was obviously black and still they served it. The poached eggs were perfect. The fresh squeezed orange juice was sitting in a cooler you have to stir it and it was okay just wonder how long it was there. The coffee was okay from the Roasterie down the street so it was stated. Yelp followers  gave so many stars I had to try this but unfortunately my experience wasn't great.  It seems like the specialty items if you're going to try this restaurant are the ones to try.  Well service is lackluster. The servers act like you're an inconvenience. The initial cashier who was training someone never made any suggestions when I told them this was my first experience there and just kind of stood there waiting for me to figure out the menu as opposed to just good customer service and selling it was as if they were just in a cryo freeze until I saw them out with verbiage. I offered to pay for my juice coffee and eggs yet the manager said no it's on us and we hope you come back and try it again. If they place the same type of emphasis on customer service with the wait staff as they do the manager it might have been a positive experience.

VXXEoj6bgmGnILb_jkprSA.text: I'm staying in Tempe for the first time, visiting from Chicago and I love this spot for breakfast. I had the veggie omelette and it was delicious. They had plenty of healthful choices along with other breakfast specials to splurge on. I went back the next day and split the French toast with my mom and it was amazing. They use fresh challah bread with cinnamon and it's thick cut. Opted for the strawberries on the side. Fresh berries! The coffee's good too.

NRbW0ZuDLFic-UbPuQcs-g.text: Mill Ave has been missing a good breakfast nook, and it has made me very sad. Until now! The atmosphere is very modern. The color scheme is gray, orange, and black and boy do they stick to it, down to the orange frosted cupcakes. Impressive. I had the best french toast I have ever had in my life right here at NCounter. I have only eaten here once, and usually I don't give five stars out after the first visit, but this place is THAT good. So happy to have such a fabulous breakfast restaurant so close to home.

VTLjdcrG9K509IXInlj3Bg.text: This is my favorite breakfast restaurant in Tempe especially on the weekends! I've been here over ten times last year with 0 complaints. My favorite breakfast is the chipotle egg burrito, which includes avocado, bacon, cheese, potatoes, and more! My only complaint is that too many people like NCounter, and thus, it is always super filled. But who cares... When the food is good, I'm always there.

OcfyTI9a1j9rS5TWDnMtew.text: The Food was good. the environment is lively. the one thing that really annoyed me is that me and my friend I was having brunch with ordered at the same exact time but they brought our dishes out at different times. so by the time my food arrived he had already finished eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

y3NOEbpxhPyymnZ1MrtmLQ.text: Place was pretty much self serve service, no one greets you when you walk in, today was my first time there so you kind of don't know where to go also where to sit. It was very packed packed house. They do have a patio area to sit with misters as well but it was way to hot to wanna sit outside today. This lace reminded me of a school cafeteria. They also have a juice bar, smoothies, mimosas and bloody mary's. Customer service was great, everyone's very helpful and happy! I would go here again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tasty eggs and potatoes ! The tortillas not so much!
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Very soggy tortillas and drenched in cheddar cheese to the point it was kind of nasty. The eggs with cheese were very tasty.

Gyeyu6zOIIw83-vk4PaGEA.text: You don't know unless you try right? I mean it's a cool new breakfast place and all but the food is SUPER bland, not worth the price.. I'd rather go to iHOP. 1 Star for food 5 for customer service.

EveL3JoRIc6tB5iWHJZs9w.text: I came here with my friend around ~10 or 11 am on a Saturday, and the place was packed. The line was nearly out the door. You order at the counter, get a number, and then find a table at which a waiter will come find you with your meal.   I ordered the Original Chop Salad [$10] because the pictures that I had seen of it online were gorgeous. My friend had the Classic Eggs Benedict [$9].  The chop salad is as beautiful as it looks in pictures. It's delicious too. The salad dressing is a light pesto sauce that coats your salad just enough. I hate when the dressing is so overpowering or when the salad is drenched in sauce.   There were some spots on the street available (you have to pay by the hour), so it wasn't too much of an issue.

dMZoqHTlUpDRF6GO_lOQUw.text: Love this spot! It's always a battle between choosing here or First Watch, and Ncounter always conquers! It's a busy place, but can you blame them?! The red velvet waffles kill the waffle game. Ncounter will always be a top breakfast option for me.

WRAeAPaRqXQqUmxDyK2dBg.text: Great breakfast options and the help yourself coffee keeps you wide awake as you wait for your food.  This is not a quick Panera or Corner Bakery stop.  The food is very good, but it takes a while to make.  My standard benedict was pretty good and my daughter loved the HUGE fluffy choc chip pancakes. My only issue is the lack of free parking and for that matter available parking on busy mornings.  Aside from those issues, the food is excellent and worth a visit!

8TDRXOpC_mcw3_kTTnkKDg.text: Delicious! The breakfast menu has the perfect range of a classic breakfast to fun items!! Highly recommend the eggs any style and pancakes. Wonderful atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

vxA9KYX_MCW8j8lzvAbvUg.text: This establishment is everything I thought it was going to be and some. You walk in and order your food then find your own table in or outside. They also have amazing bloody Mary's.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cucumber Bloody Mary.

QaK-7Seh_rC-743fWrG-4w.text: Cute concept, fast-casual breakfast place...sort of like Panera where you order and they bring your food to your table. Seating was tricky since the place was PACKED late Saturday morning. My breakfast burrito was good, and my husbands eggs benedict was great as well.

QYWSMR11GSPFT9OAZrfP6w.text: I used to come here all the time. Great lunch and very decent breakfast although the one thing they need to offer is Almond and or coconut milk for coffee drinkers! If I wasn't such a coffee snob I would Probably offer a 4 or even a 5 star on this place but based on there limited milk alternatives I was super sad this AM. Big disappointment guys! Milk and Soy is not healthy!

G77V2vIcT4nSBkrrhQBSHA.text: We have been enjoying Ncounter for years and we've recommended it to many. Today's breakfast and the last couple visits have prompted us to submit this review. First Ncounter is owned by members of the family that owns TC Eggington's in Mesa and the French toast is fantastic. Ncounter is the same recipe. Today the French toast was served cold, cold enough that the room temp butter just sat on top, and when spread the butter still just sat on top. Same with the prior two visits. My wife has scrambled eggs with toast and potatoes, the toast and potatoes were as cold as my French toast.   I see they have another location, maybe management is spread too thing.  Hoping they fix things as we have loved it for years.

x4rynCSD4rxzsCdea2U2Mw.text: How is this place allowed to serve food outside with all of the pigeons? The birds kept pooping near everyones food. There were tons of them and every time they would fly around above us debris would fall onto us and our food.

dNKP_0HNI3F0pvNq9cWJFA.text: Seriously my favorite breakfast place in Tempe! Awesome red velvet waffles and amazing eggs Benedict! Great smoothies! Can take awhile if it is busy but definitely worth it!

ZT-nl_HWmBJwTaUvTV3Y3w.text: Dont let long line to order intimidate. Very efficient kitchen and friendly staff. Food arrived hot and our omelettes were delicious. Prices very reasonable especially for quality and quantity. We loved sitting on patio, too. No surprise it is so busy!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Loaded omelette with cottage cheese side. Hit the spot!
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Omelettes, the Ncounter and Loaded, with cottage cheese and the other tomato sides.

_iATrqCfFddMDDeTc-kI_w.text: Waiting 45 minutes + for order.  Think they need a bigger kitchen.     Still waiting...  Still waiting............

QlzjWSWYITHr9z9A_EBD5w.text: Have gone to this restaurant many times always enjoyed myself and food today the music was very inappropriate dropping F bombs in the N-word said something to cashier about music. There was a group of at least 20 of us there two of the people at our table did not get their food till 20-30 minutes later and all they ordered was avocado toast one of the waitresses who brought our food was very snobby this is to bad won't be back for a while.

ZyztXa8B22AVVS7ZVJKXDA.text: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day!!    I normally always order the same meal, eggs benedict & the potatoes are my favorite. Yes the restaurant is usually busy inside and outside seating, I normally try to order my food-to-go. So if you decide to come in, be there early or be ready to wait a few moments till a table clears up. I think another location is needed near Chandler, Az area-- just sayin.....

6drifCMafF7ilGQVdqSCIQ.text: The food was absolutely delicious! The venue was a bit crowded/claustrophobic and the hours make it hard to get in when it is busy. Definitely worth it though!

_bSReKcBLAy3C_J9OJXXFA.text: Love this place! It's finally the right season to sit on the patio with my dog and enjoy some breakfast!

BF2CoMJVCJ3G_6XvuVvOxQ.text: Drove from Scottsdale to eat here on my lunch today for their amazing wraps. I ordered the same one I always get (Parmesan Chicken Salad) and it wasn't quite the same as it normally is.   I let them know and there was no hesitation. They remade it and brought it out to me promptly. I am pretty particular, but they were very accommodating during their busy lunch hour.   The service and food quality here are always on point. Definitely my favorite Brunch place in Tempe.

5LGOsA9yCfOR_aKXEf8x3g.text: A friend and I went here for breakfast the other day. She got chocolate chip pancakes and hers looked delicious and she said it tasted just as good as it looked. I ordered a breakfast burrito and it was cheesy and delicious. Great place to get some food!

5jlPc4uR66fAtRMhBSrtjw.text: *****Great breakfast spot on Mill!! :)  I had one of their hot sandwiches the FOCACCIA ROMA-CHICKEN, cut up grilled chicken breast pieces, tomato, gooey melted provolone cheese, light mayo on a cheesy Focaccia bread with added minced jalapenos and lettuce to mine!!  It was delicious!! I also ordered my favorite drink the Caramel Macchiato, but instead they mistakenly made me a caramel latte which was still as good as a Caramel Macchiato. Overall, the service was great and so was my sandwich and drink!!     *I will surely be back!! :)

84n3v8oZkbf_sKWCD7HLfA.text: I've been going to NCounter for over a year now, and use it primarily for quick breakfasts that get to include my dog on their patio!    It has become a very popular breakfast spot for weekday mornings, especially for vegetarians and secret drinkers.   I love it as a neighborhood spot, but don't necessarily think one should go out of their way to go here.  It has a great location diagonal from the A mountain and literally across the street from the 3rd/Mill LightRail stop. There is decent parking around and plenty of bike racks outside.   The patio is nice, with misters that are hit or miss, sometimes not on, sometimes too wet and you end up in a wet t-shirt contest, and totally kid and dog friendly.   It is counter service, but they do have runners that bring out their drinks and food, so have a person stake out a prime table while everyone places their orders inside.  I've never had much of a wait for for food, and they always bring out cocktails fast.  Their food is solid, the Farmhouse Benedict is perfect, they have some great bfest sandwiches, their french toast is super sweet, they don't have waffles which is a bummer, but their portions are generous.  Their b-fest cocktails are around $5 and actually a better deal than just buying juice- honestly!  I would say their downfall is coffee- it is terrible. Really terrible. I have to bring my own coffee when I come here, it is really that undrinkable. They don't have any bfest specials so if you come here often enough (and don't eat meat) you tend to get stuck in ruts, so that would be rad to see. Their misters situation can be really unpleasant. Their pastries never really look that appealing- I'm not sure if it is presentation, or what.  Their coffee/tea station is super annoying- you are supposed to grab your own silverware, napkins, drinks, ketchup, hot sauce, sugar, etc.  It is super annoying and a lot of the goods are high up!  While the food comes fast, don't expect clean up to be fast at all.  The runners really slack on cleaning up the tables and so I often have to move my dirty plate to another table to get it out of my face.  Despite these annoyances, I love their friendliness to dogs as my MaltiPoo Chloe likes hanging out here and they always offer fresh, cold water to her. The restaurant is super sclean and they have hosted the Bike to Work free b-fest, which was super awesome and supportive.  This is a solid joint appropriate for a wide range of b-festers.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. They are always friendly to doggies on their patio! Chloe gets iced water.

QfBcn8SbPRZpONnKg-j3_Q.text: Came in today for breakfast with my family.  Arrived at 10:15.  Line wasn't very long and we were able to order within a few minutes.  However, we did not receive our food until 35 mins later - way too long.  My eggs and turkey sausage were cold.  Not happy - this place is not worth the wait.  Might have been okay if my food wasn't cold -yuk.

A9CA7pzWHdXm-iu3WkEdhg.text: This was such a pleasant experience. I had the special. It was a sandwich on 12 grain bread...uh yeah, its good...with turkey and chilies and strawberry cream cheese, lets see there were field greens and melted jack on there too. Nothing but a slice of heaven!  I asked for a recommend between the special and some other good sounding salad and the staff was friendly and smart about his tip. He said he tried the special, it was really good and not a lot of folks had ordered it. He recommended I get that since I could have the salad next time. Lucky thing it was great and yes, there will be a next time!

2MelFkIz1JEXWFir3IfBtQ.text: The quality of food is good and the price is fair but watch your receipt or you may find hidden charges. Gabbie J was my cashier and added an additional tip to my purchase. I was appalled by this theft! When I go to a restaurant I expect good service, food, and honesty. I work hard for my money and when someone tries to rob me I take it personally. That woman deserves to be fired and I may report you to the better business bureau because that is wrong to rob your patrons. I came here in earnest but what you did was unacceptable Gabbie. While I appreciate Lex for his help reversing the transaction it should never have happened. Please ensure your employees are quality next time. Low paid employees and in no short supply by ASU so please find ones with integrity. I will never return here and urge all other patrons to reconsider before stopping here. At the very least wait for your receipt and ensure you were charged properly.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. This is a picture of the employee who attempted to steal money from me.

9imUZJlJdIvTiyTOb_IfEg.text: Messed up the order, skipped a menu item, and the chicken cilantro soup was absolute trash. Honestly, it is hard to mess up a simple order or a soup. The soup had too much tomato base, and the chicken fasted funky. After they messed up the omelette, I asked them to correct it, and even though the omelette plate had bread with it, she brought "repaired" omelette without bread. Seriously?!! First you mess up the order, and then you don't even have decency to bring full order again. After I asked her to bring the bread, it was COLD!. Extremely disappointed.   The only extra star, they got, was for good tasting omlette.

SpMRChL7aQXK2eCWPDm_lA.text: This is a cool little breakfast place on Mill. I'm really surprised this is like the only one. They have done it right. Great breakfast combo's, little bar if you want bloody mary's or mimosa's. Lots of college kids coming in to nurse their hangover. Totally dug this place, awesome place for college town. I'll TOTALLY be back.

zLx7e6qYswcVxM1mWM1TRA.text: I love this place! I've visited Phoenix twice and I've made it a must to come here for breakfast. They have a great selection of food for everyone. It's gets very busy in the mornings, but the wait is worth the service and the food. Their French toast is not soggy at all and their waffles are fluffy like pancakes. Their eggs are not over cooked, and their bacon is a little on the greasy side, but they are delicious. There is sully alway room on the patio if it's packed inside. I wish the coffee was better , but their niche is breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. French toast and eggs.

T_RzDv_TsubxVABCRyZTJA.text: Used to come here a lot. Ordered to-go order and took over 45 minutes. I actually believe they may have re made my order. Seemed like a lot of workers standing around and chatting opposed to working but food was pretty good when we got home.

uwW8TYSWSf3Fwox7kOZJzQ.text: Seems like a typical breakfast place just with more hipness and cool sheep artwork. I got the pear omelette which was a nice sweet and savory taste and my husband got the chipotle burrito. They came with a side of not so fresh potatoes but they had nice flavor. The bathrooms are cool and so was the music. Overall, it was slightly unique breakfast food but didn't go the extra mile to make it healthy or less sugar less saturated fatty breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Orange water and tic tac toe to wait for delicious food!
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great selection of hot sauce!!

BvJxJdQY_LJbb-6l8SunVg.text: Great breakfast/brunch spot with a nice pet-friendly outdoor patio.    I went on a Sunday afternoon and the place was PACKED.  You order at the counter, they give you a  "letter" to place on your table and someone will bring you the food (a bit like corner bakery). I ordered the breakfast burrito and it was really good...not too heavy. Great location and ambiance.

PO6BOsGHHhAec-7iGDBZsg.text: First time there. Very crowed good thing weather was good outside. My husband loved his mushroom and ham omelet. I had the cheese omelette with sausage and bacon , very tasty but the cheese was not melted enough. You can still see the shredded cheese. But over all good, we may come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Basted eggs are just like a under cooked egg. But it&#39;s cooked.

XgHBTQS-IkqihGYzYikh-w.text: This place is the TRUTH! This was my second time visiting the Phoenix area, though this time I was in Tempe at the Marriott Courtyard by Mill Avenue. I was concerned if the breakfast spots here were as good as those in Scottsdale, where I had stayed on my first visit to this area.  Over there, I enjoyed one of my all-time favorite brunches at the Daily Dos.  I was impressed that the PHX area did brunch/breakfast as well as some of my favorite stomping grounds in San Francisco.  So, on Saturday morning, after a night of partying and having multiple vodka club sodas in Old Town Scottsdale, I walked from my Marriott hotel in Tempe over to NCounter which I had looked up on Yelp.  I rolled up and, boy, was there a line! But, at 9am on a Saturday that says a lot about the reputation of this place.  After waiting for some time, I finally made it up to the counter.  As always, I was conflicted about whether to go for pancakes or the omelet. I like to load up on protein and go light on carbs/sugar, especially when I travel, so I went with the omelet.  Now at other brunch spots like Daily Dos, and my favorite places in Scottsdale, you could order a single pancake or French Toast as a side.  I didn't see either of those listed on the menu as sides, though I'm not sure if they would have made that accommodation upon request, so I won't dock a star for that.  So, I went with the "loaded" omelet, which loaded up on the meats (sausage, bacon, etc), and I had a side of cottage cheese and a cup of coffee.  Service was FAST.  The strong coffee was just what I needed as it lifted up my energy and morale which set me on a path to recovery from the night before :)  It was tough to find seating but I walked out to the patio and waited for a couple minutes and soon found some space.  It was a win because it was comfortably shaded which is critical in Arizona. Unlike DC, where I live, AZ heat is dry so as long as you're in the shade you're good to go, unlike humid heat.  At any rate, this is a SOLID brunch choice with quality food on deck.  This should be your main go-to spot for breakfast if you're in the Tempe area.

LCq0yaVmEZJt__YHGnGknA.text: NCounter is one of those places that I'm very surprised it's not a yelp 5 star.   I bring my girlfriend here, my boss, my parents, my friends, clients, etc. Every single time (30+) everything has been fantastic.   Great environment, great food and nice people.

hzOW1rxEMC7Pvnpnt6lLVQ.text: Love the environment of this place and there are many options to chose from. I went with the morning glory omelette and a side of fruit. The tomatoes were marinated to perfection and the omelette was super delicious. Only complaint is the weak coffee!

ZwhtvJBWx1t849gVG_6z4g.text: After two hours of sleep and a flight from Chicago back to Arizona, I was very hungry and wanted breakfast within a 5 miles radius of the airport. I found this place off of Mill St, right by a Valley Metro stop.   The interior is a mix of IKEA and Chipotle. You order at the counter, get a metal letter placard for your table so the staff can bring out your food, and you fill your own drinks. I don't mind that at all; but it seemed like 75% of the college students coming in were confused about the concept. They would huddle around the registers looking at the menu brochures, look up bewildered at the menu on the upper wall, and then look down at their brochures again. The workers would get frustrated by this and ask over and over, "I can take someone's order here when they are ready" to get these kids moving.   Anyway, that's not a point against the restaurant at all--just warning you what to expect.  I ordered the strawberry pancakes and grilled potatoes. I wolfed down as much as I could--everything tasted fresh, and you can tell the potatoes weren't frozen. I didn't find anything bland--the pancakes didn't need any zest to them.The prices are a little on the higher end compared to a diner, but you are getting really good, really fresh food; not frozen, unpredictable crud from a Denny's.

xbnJ3CVOGdmiiGw6v1K0Qg.text: Came here on a recommendation for a fresh breakfast. I ordered the chipotle breakfast burrito and a flourless peanut butter muffin. Really good burrito! The chipotle sauce was really good and they were generous with the avocado. I often opt for egg whites which sometimes makes my food soggy, this didn't happen here. I'll definitely be coming back here soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chipotle burrito missing a bite

W_Z8w71s61AnZVbgOnV4oA.text: First time here and had lunch with my parents. Dad ordered their tuna melt and asked for it without apples, avocado and nuts and he still received it that way and 3 mintes after we received our lunch. Mom had egg salad and their was only a half dollar size amount. I had the portabello 1/2 sandwich. It was ok. We ordered iced green tea and waited 15 minutes to have someone bring us hot tea and then another 5 for the right teas. We waited almost 25 minutes for 3 sandwiches. Food taste fine but service was bad. I mentioned it to a supervisor and he said well their bringing it now. I would not recommend this place.

vgtjP13ufFFYj25HLOtJGA.text: My first review for Ncounter was regarding a lunch dish, and I was not impressed.    I have since been back several times for breakfast and had much better experiences.  Their breakfast dishes are on point!  The Chipotle Egg Burrito and Classic Eggs Benedict are my favs.  The grilled potatoes they serve with most breakfast dishes are perfect.  Every time.

Vx61_GjVP8TdcMTI86aQ5w.text: Went on a late Saturday morning and found it to be a pretty big disappointment, especially after hearing this is the same people that run TC Eggingtons, which has never disappointed.  Their second week being open so I can understand the long ticket times (20 minutes for breakfast), but not the poorly cooked food.  English muffin on the Eggs Benedict was not even toasted, the potatoes were undercooked and lacked any seasoning.  They looked like they came out of a bag.  The bananas on the Banana Foster French Toast were uncooked and not caramelized with any brown sugar.  The French Toast itself was OK, but for $7 and no side it was pretty bad.  The bacon was cool and seemed to have been cooked off earlier and held in a steam pan like at a buffet.  The biggest nightmare was the setup.  I had no idea where to go as there are 3 entrances, none of which access the counter where you order.  You enter and walk through a maze of tables and people to order your food.  I thought I was in the right line and then realized it was people waiting for espresso.  Then when I got in the right line there were people all over the place and nobody knew who was next.  Was there no thought or planning involved in this style of service to handle busy times?  Sauce & Pei Wei seem to have it nailed, maybe they should take a lesson or two from them.  Second star because they offer breakfast cocktails, unfortunately we will not be back anytime soon to try them.

hobu4MzPzTK6KSTEZhQhdQ.text: Awesome! Had breakfest there on a Sunday morning.  Place was a little busy but the food was really good.  I had the banana/walnut pacakes, my wife had the french toast and my 3 year old sun had the mickey mouse pancakes off the kids menu.  Everything was delicuous! We'll be back soon.

nR4GJbZXw0adV-l5H42-2g.text: The best sandwich shop in the city.  Wonderful, creative combinations of ingredients.  Great salads.  Fantastic breakfast items served all day.  Cool, hip atmosphere.  Three days in a row now.  My new favorite lunch spot.

I0QYfhhX-lmBx6jnbQU71Q.text: Visited a college town breakfast joint.  What a great experience.  Outstanding food and service.

LCnU8VXAkNpZ3FMrHREvLg.text: We rode our bikes down to NCounter on Saturday for lunch. I now have a new favorite breakfast/lunch spot! The menu was great ( breakfast, salads, sandwiches) and the ambiance was fun.  I had a delicious sandwich and my wife had an omelet. Both were very tasty and well prepared.  Next time I plan to try some of the delicious pastries at the counter. Cinnamon Pecan roll looks great. Definitely headed back.

_l0cMEPaJOvQQjwhrS2Dpg.text: I had a friend in town this week, and we went a little overboard on the brats and schnitzels at a German restaurant the previous evening. Hoping for something healthy and light I decided to try NCounter. It was just what we were looking for. Good simple sandwiches (I had a tuna melt, she had a portabella sandwich) with a nice fresh side salad. The bloody mary was spot on, and the Americano was pretty solid as well. Other customers were tearing into some good looking French toast and eggs Benedict, so now I'm super psyched to come back for breakfast.

dA5tvAzC2NMOydBopCrfxw.text: Yummy pancakes.  Lunch for two for less than $20. Quick service, nice atmosphere.  No complaints :)

-7A-NNowc1y9wrObfcL6Bw.text: I personally would have given this place three stars but the yelp scale seems to say that means "okay", and when I give three stars I mean "edible."  The people at the cash register were really nice, it's got a good vibe, they've got delicious passion iced tea, the food came out quickly, it's right by the light rail, it's got big windows which was great for people watching (and keeping an eye on my bike outside), and the set up was nice. I found their service concept a little weird (you order at the counter, they give you a red thing with a letter on it, you stick it on the table, get your own drink, sit down, the food is delivered [fine] but it gets weird when it's almost like service starts then - someone asked if I wanted my drink refilled. Not BAD, I just found the concept...strange.)  But the reason I'm only giving it two stars is the food. "Fresh" is in their slogan but the food wasn't. I got the Natibomb (I think that's what it was called) at the recommendation of the guy at the counter (that's another thing - everyone there was uncommonly attractive. Again, not a bad thing, but it was noticeable that they want their servicepeople to essentially be eyecandy... just without the skimpy clothes.) Anyway. The natibomb. It has apple and turkey and bacon and cheese, all things I like, all things that can be done in a way that is both indulgent (mmm bacon, turkey, cheese) but refreshing (fresh, crispy toasted bread, nice big bites of apple.) Instead the bread was soggy with butter, the cheese was bright orange (come on, real cheddar is DELICIOUS! Don't give me bright orange!), the turkey didn't stand out, the bacon tasted pretty cheap, and the whole thing was really greasy. Like, had to drink my (very delicious) passion tea to wash the grease down greasy. The apple seemed really out of place and didn't cut down on the grease at all. My salad was kind of overdressed, too, but not horrible.   Which is fine. If you like that kind of food, I think you'll like it there. But greasy food just isn't my taste. If you want a non-greasy yummy sandwich, try Essence Bakery on University & Hardy (they also have fantastic macarons) or The Center Bistro just up the street from Ncounter on 6th & Mill behind the brickyard. Both have local ingredients, too, which is a niche Ncounter isn't going for.   (As an aside, another thing that was strange was how many customer service people were there. There had to be at least 7 FOH staff walking around and while the restaurant isn't small, for something that isn't even full service dining, it seemed really overstaffed. But whatever works for them!)

zTAfK1usRgRs894ZOJtBKg.text: This place is a joke. Another overpriced fake establishment going for trendiness over quality. My muffin had no flavor other than the undercooked bits of apple that still had the peel on. The coffee was ruined by the non-dairy creamer that was NOT labeled as non-dairy. For a place to have only two pitchers, one of which is 2% milk and the other non-dairy creamer not labeled as such, is unforgiveable. I ordered regular coffee; I knew upon seeing their super-auto poseur espresso machine to avoid any espresso drinks. I also haven't tried their cooked food, but judging by the prices, I don't think I will.  $8 or more for a sandwich is more expensive than Romancing the Bean and most items at Essence Bakery, and it's unlikely to be as good as either. If you want a muffin, walk across the street to Romancing the Bean (located at the base of the KPMG building), if you want good coffee or a croissant, get one of the best ones in the state at Essence (Hardy & University), and if you want an awesome breakfast or lunch, try either. For espresso you'll have to go Cartel Coffee. It's the only good place within a mile of Mill Ave. Whatever you do, don't waste your time or money on NCounter.

IHGAyVNhJH9zziAtYXlk3g.text: Busy & cute little place further down mill ave. In Tempe! Walk up style ordering with seat yourself tables there after (though if you have a big party, you might want to send someone to save a table, both indoor and outdoor filled up quickly). Our food was all around very good; seemed to be homemade apple jelly that came with the toast that was excellent. We asked for an extra plate when the food was delivered & they were out of side plates, we also needed a fork as one of ours fell, they were running low on both since it was so busy but they made up for it with quick alternatives/solutions. The big downside and what brought us from 5 stars to 4 were our drinks from the bar. Screwdriver was very watery, and the mimosa didn't have muddled fruit, which was surprising since it appeared to be a full breakfast bar (there was also no garnish for the drinks) & for the price ($16 for both not including tip), we expected a little more. Due to the style of the restaurant, nobody comes to check on you or we would have said something, didn't seem worth it to get back in the line just to speak to someone. If you're going to spend the money on a drink, I'd try the coffee on the menu or highly recommend a smoothie; I tried "the hulk" and it was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. &#34;The hulk&#34; smoothie (green), strawberry ginger mimosa (red), screwdriver (back, orange)
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Plain &amp; simple breakfast - eggs over medium (and perfectly done) with sourdough, breakfast potatoes and added side of ham

J4tBN1znMveouW915xFjXg.text: Love this place for breakfast or lunch!!! Great vibe and staff!! It was perfect after a hike at A mountain as it is right there. Love the outside or inside seating as well as dog friendly restaurant!!! Ordered the steel cut oatmeal with fresh berries! So yummy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

JsCMWYyOEX6yii2soIRpZg.text: The worst experience I have ever had. I was here with my colleagues for a lunch. My order was delayed to the point where everyone else was done with their food. I tried to get to the cashier wait staff for my order was asked to wait a couple of minutes which went for over half an hour. I had to rush back for my meetings so I asked them to just change it to a To-go order as anyways there was no point keeping everyone waiting for my food. And to my horror this what I got " A burnt Sandwich ".  You should choose some other place and avoid NCounter on mill ave. There are better ones in and around the downtown area.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

BnKYr1D0w9zjIFXG3b9tZA.text: I am obsessed with this place!! I ordered the chipotle egg burrito and it was absolutely delicious!! I also strongly recommend the french toast-so yummy!!

wgLbf8HLNg6e0m-pacWYmQ.text: Not a fan. The food didn't seem fresh, my mimosa was mostly puree processed fruit juice and a splash of champagne. Waffles were ok, but not any better than what I could've made at home. Not impressed. Customer service was a big ok. Maybe it was due to the holiday madness but I went in later to avoid the rush. My girlfriend loved her smoothie (strawberry banana) so I may be back to get one of those - to go. Overall, won't be back there are way too many delicious, fresh, healthy brunch places in Tempe and the Phoenix area.

VjnaS5gXB3q-4ndaQbZmOw.text: This is a lovely breakfast/brunch joint with good food and a relatively good atmosphere. It's easy here to chill, study, socialize, etc. all while having a nice meal. I'm a huge fan of their omelettes, and I usually dislike omelettes, so that's saying something!  I'm taking a star off mainly because of their pastries. I'm not sure if it's because I tend to go in the afternoon (like an hour or so before closing), but all the ones I've had have been cold, hard, stale, etc., which is a shame since they're so pleasing visually.

K7ZnkVMgj08pVUFAS8M1Yw.text: Delicious breakfast! Their waffles were seriously delicious and my latte was very yummy. I don't love the layout of the downtown Tempe location but if you go during a non peak time it's not so bad. The staff is always super nice and it's a really lovely experience in general.

Kb1SpabHqnRX5vvDnVGFWw.text: 1st time here.  I was disappointed with the choice, the Chilaqulles.  The corn tortillas were soggy, & the crisp was only on the edges.   I will be back but won't ever order any Mexican dish.   The sandwiches do look good, I will try one of those next time.

uI8bYsqsRtLjReJ_MMcO8Q.text: The breakfast here in Tempe was my Saturday spot but unfortunately I am now living in Cali but if your ever in the area try their French toast, desserts and their coffee.

3G-59fCaqI75dXO-1sjSOA.text: The ambiance was refreshing.  Mimosas were perfect and very tasty.  The food was so good and tasty.  Loved having a mimosa with my brunch after a small hike! I'm visiting from out of town and would definitely want to come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

rd0al2f2tm-oCXjSgO4jIw.text: Came to this place after finishing the 5k ! The food was excellent but what I like also was the fact that they allow everyone to order together so that you food comes out together yet you pay separately.  The staff offered excellent customer service as well. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

TIaiAKdQ3PH7Q-n-Lrd7_w.text: Came here for brunch with friends for the Downtown Tempe Brunch Crawl, and it was very crowded. I don't think the food was anything too special.  SERVICE: SLOW. In their defense the place was pretty packed but all the dishes came out at separate times :(   AMBIENCE: indoor and outdoor seating though be careful with outdoors because it is HOT in the summer and very few shaded areas   FOOD: for the brunch crawl there were $3 bloody Mary's, $3 bloody Maria's, and $3 breakfast tacos. We got an assortment. The food was good but nothing huge to write home over and the tacos were tasty but nothing too special.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast taco

y8RCejqRxlzvbgDrGpFoNg.text: Tried for the first time for a late breakfast and it was AWESOME! It was within walking distance of our hotel (AC Marriot) and right on the end of Mill Street. It is a walk-up counter to order and you can choose to sit inside or out. We got the chiliquilles and the chipotle breakfast burrito and both were beyond delicious. The cold brew coffee was also incredible and fresh! The only thing was the wait time for food- we sat for about 25 minutes after ordering without any food. But, it was very busy so I don't think it was only us.   Will for sure be returning for breakfast possibly a few more times before the end of the trip!

p85-DTnHNcnEhUiDYBaF9w.text: Customer service was ass! Was sitting outside and no one CLEANED the tables. The table I was sitting on was disgusting 3 people walked by and just looked and went right back inside... also didn't get our drinks or food till 20 min later. FDA would not approve of this!

M8eiEWoCuBjwkq5COrPiig.text: Great place for brunch. You order at the counter and they deliver it to your table. The place looks small from the outside, but it opens up once you walk in the door. There are many different options to satisfy any craving. It can get pretty packed on weekends, but once you're through the line, there is usually a table that becomes available.

EZ6RvzMrznoZJQ0p7y-GlA.text: Honestly, I'm really disappointed about my experience here. I've heard nothing but great things about this place and after wanting to come here for a couple months, it did not live up to expectations.  I ordered the loaded omelette, which I recognize has a lot of meat and cheese, however my first bite was pure grease. The potatoes that it came with were undercooked and not seasoned. Then, halfway through my meal I discovered a hair on my plate, which made my appetite completely dissipate.   This meal in total (omelette, sandwich, and coffee) cost was above average. I don't believe this place was worth the money.

zaxmXvfI2wFC0mxi_J-4DQ.text: First time at Ncounter and seemed super popular if the line indicated anything! You stan walk up and order your good, get a letter, and they bring it out to you. The restaurant was clean and they ran it smoothly.   The food was super tasty and all I had was a salad and a cup of soup!! Definitely recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Waldorf salad with a cup of Chicken Tortilla soup

VXksEQ6uUsCuuoWtNimAkw.text: I came across Ncounter because it was one of the only open restaurants in the area I was traveling through that was open before 10 o'clock-- and I'm happy I found it!  I ordered the Portobellini hot sandwich that was filled with artichoke, spinach, portobellini mushrooms and roasted red peppers on ciabatta bread. I was pleasantly surprised at the flavor that wasn't lost due to eliminating the provolone cheese and balsamic mayo to make the item vegan. The sandwich came with chips and was easily shareable, but I was hungry and ate it all! If ever in the area I would recommend trying this restaurant, and their Bloody Mary's (great variety).

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. The delicious Portobellini hot sandwich.

nM8_pC20eST4XgHdhQBvJA.text: Really like this place. Freshly squeezed orange juice. Big slices of bacon. Moist waffles with syrup. No table service. Park on Mill street, metered parking. Two locations available. Tempe has side yard you can bring your dog, as long as on a leach.

k59PjydV5vt4vpi8S6cAmQ.text: Ncounter was a great introduction to my weekend trip to Arizona! I flew into Phoenix the night prior without an itinerary but it all worked out!  I'm an early bird and they open at 7 which was perfect!   I ordered their House Request in addition to their Banana Walnut Pancakes. Their portions are very generous! There was so much walnuts cooked into the pancakes and placed on top! The bananas weren't too sweet and it went well with the maple syrup. The House Request has cream cheese and a fried egg inside, tomatoes and onions. I don't eat red meat or poultry so it was nice they had options! The sandwich was so hardy and it wasn't too heavy. They also have a separate espresso bar.  The decor of the place was very modern. There was plenty of natural lighting and wood grain table tops. It is a self serve hybrid kind of restaurant.    There are plenty of metered street parking. I did notice a parking structure that also may provide parking.    Ncounter is located right on the corner. It was easy to find and there was plenty of other businesses around. Given that I had limited time to explore, I only scoped out a fraction of the area.   There is a cool chalk board right outside that I've never seen before that allows anyone to leave a positive message for the entire day. Messages are washed away the next morning.   Overall, I had a great experience. The food was delicious, the facilities were clean and the service was good. I would come back again on my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

IFMufoIjJqdHh0Kne77MUQ.text: Seriously not impressed.  3 of us went all ordered different items and it was mediocre at best. I was the only one who liked the flavor of  my meal and everyone's food was cold and unimpressive.   It took at least 20 minutes to get our meals. And it a counter order joint so u expect a bit of a speedier delivery epically  for breakfast. Idk how servers make tips or money here but that could be why it was slow idk.   The coffee bar only had milk to offer no cream and I have a hard time with pump pots being used for dairy products....those inside parts don't come apart and there is no way they are ever 100% clean of dairy residue. Coming from a veteran of food and beverage....I would steer clear of that and ask for milk or cream on the side.  My chai tea was fantastic but it took almost 10 mins to get. I was also impressed that when I told them I didn't like melon they brought me out pineapple and strawberries  with no hesitation.    Items ordered: Morning  glory - the enjoyed meal  Keep it simple - all items were cold and the potatoes were mushy. French toast- huge portion but lacked flavor and creativity   It's a cute spot and I'd stop in for a coffee but would probably skip the food.

t8vBKKor1_b4n4aVNR5zig.text: Wasn't terrible, but by no means memorable. I was in town with my family for the Cardinals game and we decided to go here for breakfast. Not a bad choice but very underwhelming. We all preferred Snooze.

d4CKXHq4hledyl8Ts_fgQQ.text: Excellent choices for breakfast or brunch.  The pear omelette is a hidden gem with an unlikely combination of pear, havarti cheese, and slivered almonds.  The coffee drinks are great and were brought to our table quickly after we placed our ordered.  The timing of breakfast service was perfect, and being able to sit outside is such a treat.

TpPEF0XmP2lPIWJEzmqIZg.text: I worked here, and the food is amazing. Everything on the menu is a good choice!

RJzh7pU72epHdwVtcfPzEw.text: It was ok. I personally like table served breakfast rather than ordering and getting it yourself. I did like the location, Mill ave will always be one of my favorite spots in Tempe. I was just not impressed with the food it was only OK.

V7p7ZnyB36598w_n-_CV9A.text: I'm always looking for breakfast/brunch options around town, so when I heard that NCounter had recently opened, I checked out their menu online and I was sold; I knew I had to go try it out.  It looks like 16 or so others beat me to the FTR and they've only been open for a week, so I guess there were plenty of other people excited about this new restaurant opening as well.  I'm being very honest in giving a three star "A-OK" review, but I'm optimistic that after another visit or two, I'll be bumping it up.  The first thing I noticed is that NCounter is located in a very convenient corner location off of Mill and 3rd St (right off the light rail).  Next off, their hours: 7am - 3:05pm daily.  Interesting!  Upon walking in, I was greeted by a bunch of friendly servers...  I love the fast-casual concept where you order at the counter (hence the name, I suppose) and then get your drink(s) on your own but then your food is brought to you... I was torn as I looked at the menu as there were a handful of items that sounded good to me.  My internal dialogue went something like this:  "Mmmmm... smoothies!"  "Oh wow - they serve espresso and amazing sounding coffee drinks too - very impressive but I'll skip those today since I'm avoiding caffeine while being prego."  "Bloody Marys, Mimosas, Screwdrivers, Greyhounds, and more..." I'm for sure coming back for one of those after this baby comes!"  "OK - back to the food menu... those wheat germ granola pancakes sound like they'd be right up my alley!"  "But maybe I should just go for an omelette?"  "That bakery case looks pretty damn appealing too with cake pops, muffins, pastries, and more..."  After much of the above debating, I decided to order a fresh squeezed OJ and a Greek Omelette with egg whites and no onions.  For my side, I went with whole grain toast.  I grabbed my OJ and an iced water and found a table... and despite the restaurant being packed, our food arrived within 10 minutes.    Here's where my constructive criticism comes in for NCounter:  -A couple of onions got thrown in there, but that's forgiveable.   -I suggest toasting the bread a bit more if you're going to call it toast; mine was not toasted! -The verbiage that is listed with the Omelettes on the menu says "with your choice of toast, potatoes, fruit, cottage cheese or tomatoes."  So I assumed my omelette would come with my choice of one of those things.  It actually came with potatoes as well as the toast I asked for, which was a bonus, but I would've prefered to order toast and fruit or toast and cottage cheese! -The artichokes on the omelette were cold but the rest of the omelette was hot - just kind of a weird combo with each bite.  Aside from the above complaints, my food was good and considering they've only been open a week, I had a very positive first experience here.  Overall, this place is awesome and a welcome addition to the hood!  I can't wait to go back soon and try those pancakes... or perhaps a smoothie?!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Greek omelette with egg whites and toast

0qFS2nI0H-lm5pDHlfnsHQ.text: This place is awesome and fast which is a big bonus for the Mill lunch crowd. I ordered at the counter and had my food within 10 minutes. The tropical Iced Tea was delicious and so was my salad. I ordered the Chop, it had arugula, cranberries, corn, feta, red pepper, chicken and couscous (loved the couscous) and a slightly sweet and creamy basil pesto dressing.  I felt so good about my healthy lunch I splurged and split a chocolate cupcake with Georgie. It was moist and not overly sweet, I detected a faint hint of coffee in the icing.   I will definately be back..

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chop Salad

olb5rIeGw3YJhcqlFO5l5w.text: You can't go wrong with the food here. It's always delicious. And you have to try the red velvet waffle.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. The food was great, and definitely loving the red velvet waffles!!

Ccjm_E5a4kkk6C0Sp9YehQ.text: Quick and easy breakfast place and easy location to slide into.  Not a huge menu and challenging seating, but its nice for what they offer.

fqrw1vHLJATPGPQIW-8iBg.text: Not everything on the menu is great (pancakes and burrito), but something are very tasty.  Best time to come is on the weekdays or when they first open, it's hard to find a seat on a weekend period.    They have issues with their food and coffee being consistent from day but over time I've been satisfied enough.  Again, come early!

r1EFEpRHCPXmHZ-ScTC4rQ.text: Normally I wouldn't like a place like this. Calculated atmosphere with a "Hip, Trendy, Urban Feel". It could easily come off as disingenuous, but it doesn't! The heart is here. The food is usually marvelous. The space is "modern" but not shallow and soulless.     If I had to complain... the success and location brings in hoards of the more obnoxious ASU greek life types on the weekends. After you make your way through hungover bro-dogs and sorority girls, you will have a great meal.

VWs2pln57q9cb_OgN6scwg.text: I should preface by saying that I have not been here in almost 2 years, so I will go back soon and update!   However, I would go there almost every Sunday when they first opened and I loved it. They always had a $5 drink special - mimosa, bloody mary, etc. and the pour was generous :) I have never had a meal that I did not like, and neither has the friends I've gone with. I love that I can get a breakfast sandwich with a salad instead of fruit or toast, and a bloody mary or 3 to top it off! Food portions are also generous! I would normally sit at the bar... if you're lucky enough to get a seat at the bar!

Pg9Hnzgj4f1VyKQjE3eV8w.text: My wife and I went for the delicious chilaquiles to celebrate her b-day. She encountered a small problem and let a server know. The manager on 6/3, Daniel, was so incredibly helpful. He was friendly and quickly solved the issue. His professional and welcoming manner made us feel both comfortable and special.  We love Ncounter for the food and now, we adore it for the service as well. Daniel is terrific! We'll be back and will for sure order the chilaquiles and lemon pound cake.

zJktwlIBl8SoIVu_h-4YMw.text: Visiting from out of town and enjoyed stellar service with Eric at the bar area. This is a really cool concept - the perfect mix of healthy, fresh meal options and adult beverages like a cucumber Bloody Mary or strawberry basil mimosa (yes please!). Only in town for a few days but will definitely be returning before the trip is over. Great prices and super friendly service.

TFXpLvixl2PF4CRLnwlglA.text: When the food comes out right it's great... but it rarely does. I order extra crispy potatoes and bacon every time, every time my potatoes are cold or very under cooked. I'ts like they go out of their way to do the opposite of what I request. One time I bit into my pancake and the mix was running out, they didn't even cook it through. so I would say it's worth a shot because when its good its great, but don't get your hopes up.

bFu2iRaaDX30_8SJjFw77w.text: I went in with high hopes. I've heard so many good things. I was kinda disappointed.  I was expecting a restaurant but there was no greeter, no real service. You place your order and scurry off to find a seat. We went at about 8:30 so were lucky there.   The food was mediocre at best. I got an eggwhite omelette that was quite bland. The coffee was like kerosene and they even messed up the bacon! Not crunchy, just kind of dry and lifeless. For the price I expected better, a lot better.   The potatoes and the toast were the best part of my meal. As far as the experience goes, good location in Tempe. Easy to find parking.  Not bad, but certainly nothing spectacular to make me want to go back.

JRb9HvGQ4bWifXXXfcW2rw.text: Second time here in two years. Really like the modern, clean style and the healthy menu. Love eggs and had my fair share there. Prepared on the mark along with my latte, can't complain about this busy place

lCTkOMUz2M0uznX84wZNOg.text: 10/15/2017 Yelp review Breakfast and Brunch Ncounter 310 S Mill Ave, Ste A101 Tempe, AZ 85281 (480) 968-9288  I went to Ncounter last Sunday morning with my boyfriend. Before we went, I checked reviews and pictures on the Yelp. By looking at postings, it is a traditional brunch restaurant. It serves omelets, pancakes, waffles. All foods look delicious, and we decided to go and check this highly-reviewed brunch place. When we arrived, we saw the restaurant was full. It provided indoor and outdoor seating. We were confused first when we went in because no one seated us. I think they should put a sign on the front door so people who come at the first time will not be confuses like us. We had to see what other people do, and follow them. Customers order at the counter and find seats by yourself. Probably because it was Sunday, there were no vacancy tables. We had to wait at the bar to see if any one left. So do not go there at weekends if you could. The environment of Ncounter was pretty clean and bright which gave us a great mood on the weekend morning. There were blackboards with hand writing and drawing on the wall. I think it is fun stuff. Also, it had a long black table inside which convenience group of people to talk and eat. It is pet friendly (patio only). I love to see sweet dogs when I eat. My boyfriend ordered a burrito and smoothie, I ordered loaded omelet and iced latte. My boyfriend loved his smoothie. It was blueberry smoothie with peanut butter. He said it was not too sweet for a drink and the flavor of blueberry was not covered by peanut butter. I am not a fun of peanut butter, so I will not comment on that smoothie. The latte I ordered was $4 or $4.5. I think it is not worth that. It was too bitter and I cannot taste the milk. I will buy Starbucks next time. The burrito and omelet were just ok. They putted too much cheese on it. We had to get rid of it before we ate. My omelet contained ham, sausage, and bacon with side of fried potato. The size was big for me, I had to take out the left. My boyfriend thought the size was not enough for man. He ate some my omelet at the end. One thing I have to complain is the waiting time. My boyfriend and I almost waited half hour for our food after we seated. Servers perhaps took so much time to find where we were seating.  Maybe they should hire more servers at weekends.  Moreover, Ncounter provides drink bar with coffee and different types of drinks. Besides the drinking bar, there was a table with hot sauces. It is cool that gives customers more choices and saves more time for both servers and customers.  The location is great as well. It is located on the Mill Ave, the center of Tempe Downtown.  Also, it is beside the rail train station, which is convenient for people who don't drive.

kLPNSK2JDUvBqAGHDAbkNg.text: SHADY EMPLOYEES! The food here is good, but the customer service I experienced was awful. I went this past Sunday and left my water bottle on the counter of the bar. I immediately called when I got home and realized I had left it, and the man that answered asked me to describe it and then confirmed that it was at the restaurant. He set it aside for me and asked me for my name and told me I could come pick it up. When I got there, I went to the counter and asked for the water bottle by name and someone went back to grab it, saying she had seen it there earlier. She returned saying that it wasn't there with no explanation, and was not willing to look any further. I like this place, and i'm bummed that one of their employees stole something that they said would be set aside safe.

piq5bioHl_FhlYg6LFW08g.text: I'm giving them 5 stars just because their smoothies are amazing. Mimosas too expensive for size, but the smoothies trump that.

6oZIIjSL45Q4syECXJK-BQ.text: I'm sorry I have to write this place a poor review . A year ago it would of been 5 stars . But now seems like they just don't put the same effort out there anymore . Service is great . Great atmosphere !! Well let me get straight to the point . Whoever is the cook at times just cooks poorly at times . Where I don't even want to eat the food . Omelette taste old and the potatoes taste like they was made a few days ago . Come on guys . Tighten up a lil bit .

1fns6xUNZ2gX4S9jr61FIw.text: I love this place. Food is always amazing and the staff is always very friendly! The French toast is one of my favorites.   There was one time when my pancakes come out undercooked. I told the busboy who promptly took them away and got a new short stack cooking for me. They brought me a cinnamon roll to snack on while I waited. This is the only "bad" experience I've ever had and it doesn't even qualify as bad, as they took care of me.   The patio is also dog friendly

lQfuQXvD-rpOuOqOuon9Xg.text: I was in town on business, stopped in 2pm on a Friday and the young guy at the counter was very unfriendly towards me as I tried to engage in general conversation regarding this being my first visit and I told him I was a vegan.  Waiting for any recommendations, I ended up just getting a salad to go. He did not smile nor did he say "thank you".  I pride myself on being a great tipper and for the first time ever I did not leave tip.  As I waited for my order, I watched him interact with other customers and he immediately came to life when a couple of young Caucasian women approached his counter... thanks, smiled, eye contact, etc. Next I saw a young Black gentleman approach the counter and his whole demeanor changed, in fact this young Black man appeared to be mentally disabled and was having some difficulty.  I watched and saw how the guy working humiliated and dehumanized the customer... laughing and joking with coworkers at the customers behalf. When in town I will not come back to this place, I'll spend my money at an establishment that treats everyone with dignity and kindness. In the end the food was just ok, nothing special.

wJxszrbhjCW9qJEE4DVrew.text: A really nice feel to the scenery. A very easy restaurant that was simple and cheap. Just walk up the counter, order, and wait. The only thing was how the food took a while to come out but that kind of thing happens in a busy restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious and a place I would go again.

4HlCDet7K3tDoWYfWR2GAg.text: Ncounter has the feel of an upscale urban diner. You can get all the breakfast classics but with a show of respect for quality and well-balanced flavor. The prices are reasonable and the environment is casual and inviting, if not a little cramped. Why the 4 star? It was great but it was nothing to write home about. They've taken a good, solid concept (i.e. diner fare) and delivered on it.

NJqMXAmS1GdKOmnQvo75kA.text: Bananas Foster French Toast is the bomb!  Split the plate with a friend today - it was great to share... but I really wanted my own in the end!  ;)  The sauce on the toast was sweet without being too sugary.   i love their iced coffee!  great spot for breakfast!  They have a walk up counter for ordering, makes it pretty quick!

C2BPNGV07eH-OoyE1giIpA.text: Went here for breakfast on a Thursday morning. Asked where our order was after waiting 30 minutes to be told it would be another 20-40 minutes b/c they were having a burrito special and were running behind. We were not informed of this when ordering. Ended up getting a refund and leaving.

CmUKwhW1RgU9XqTghnOD0Q.text: I was really excited about this place just based off of the yelp rating and ended up with a disappointment on my face on the way out. The layout reminds me of places I've gone to out in San Francisco. However, even though the ambience was nice on the inside and outside the food was definitely below average. The eggs were good; It's not too difficult to ruin eggs. But the pancakes, which is a signature component of the meal, were very bland. They didn't have any flavor whatsoever.
