It literally tasted as if the ingredients were the staple ingredients for basic pancakes. I was also unimpressed with the syrup; the thinner, the better and theirs was average. Overall, I may beating this place up and. It taking into consideration it's located in the middle of a college town. But I wasn't impressed. The staff was very friendly and helpful!

pqWqVJqibjKHhQZ9ft0VtA.text: Best Omelet i ever had. And may father said the same. Very good service. Ill be going there again soon.

hZ1m8t9ZGcl43pwyPfvHrw.text: I love coming into N-Counter for brunch on the weekends. The food is great and there are a lot of menu options to choose from. I have only tried the poached eggs dish and the scrabbled eggs with potatoes, toast, and bacon. Both dishes are great and simple. I am excited to go back and try something a little more adventurous on the menu the next time I am in town.   I have been to a couple other breakfast spots on Mill Ave and N-Counter is by far the best. They have a great menu to choose from, a bar with decent drinks, speedy service, and a beautiful interior. You walk in and place your order at the counter, so this is not a traditional sit down restaurant. I would suggest having someone in your dining party grab a table while someone else places the order.  Tip: I would highly recommend trying the Arizona Gunslinger hot sauce they have. It is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Screwdriver, Bellini, and the plan and simple eggs, potatoes, toast and bacon. The cinnamon jelly was a great surprise!

fMmfBOS1BNpF8WXh4iaotw.text: I've wanted to try this place out for a while since it's down the street from where I live. I finally came here this past weekend with my sisters and I must say I wasn't too disappointed.  I had the Farmer's Market, which was an Egg Benedict, topped with a poached egg, avocado, tomato, spinach and of course the hollandaise sauce, plus a side of potatoes. I thought that it was good the only thing I didn't like was that my meal was drenched in the hollandaise sauce. It was just too much for me.  My sister ordered the French Toast with Whipped Cream and Strawberries and BOYYYYYYY did it look & tasted AMAZING!   If anyone is around the Mill Ave area, you should definitely try this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Farmer&#39;s Market
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. French Toast w/ Whipped Cream &amp; Strawberries

lIXwgjfkMLbrXVTZ9Uq18Q.text: I ordered the crack 'o dawn, which came with two sunny side up eggs. The toast, which I normally ignore at breakfast, was good because of the compote they serve it with, maybe raspberry? I also ordered the greyhound, which was delicious and well sized. Everything here seemed reasonably priced for the portions, and I'd definitely try it again when I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Crack &#39;O Dawn!

Aif9FbuQ7NwRHKO-0CoVmQ.text: Great place for brunch. Sometimes the line gets long but usually not a huge wait for a table. Definitely check it out.

5I9fPUkyC94ui4EMCFf2kg.text: My husband and I ate here for the 1st time this morning and it will NOT be the last.  Ordering was easy and quick. Although the place was *packed* we were able to find a seat relatively quickly. Our food was out w/ in 10 mins after we sat down. And it was GOOD.  My husband had the cheese omelet, I had the pear omelet, yes pear. With havarti, bacon, and almonds. We both got their homefries and an english muffin on the side.  First, the muffins came w/ apple cinnamon jelly. It was So good. Their potatoes were the perfect mix of crunchy and soft, and the omelet, oh man. I knew I was taking a food risk by ordering a pear omelet but im so glad i did. Its something I never wouldve thought would taste as amazing as it did.   Go here, but be warned, theyre only open until 3:05 pm.

TnhLcUlmnhlVQEwmvbLP9g.text: We stopped by this restaurant to grab a sandwich to-go. I got the Pecos Grille which I enjoyed. The chicken was seasoned really well & tasted great with the cheese & jalapenos. The only thing that was kind of weird was that the bread was buttered & warmed but not really toasted. If I order this again, I'd ask them to grill it or something.  The service was disappointing. When I placed my order, the lady at the cash register was rude & didn't listen to my order completely. I had asked for extra chips but didn't receive them .. I didn't bother to go back to the same lady but rather asked someone else for them.  Just for the food, I'd definitely go back.

n_qsNpVf87oEceWxbCLQFQ.text: Last week was my fist time going to Ncounter. I was pleasantly surprised by how friendly and helpful the staff were. The food was ready very quickly and tasted fantastic! High-five to the cooks! Even went back to tip the staff more once we finished our food. After last week, I returned today with several friends. It was much busier, but again, had wonderful service and the food was outstanding. This place is definitely a weekly hitter for me! Recommending to all my friends!

DwZ70VO0IsjVlKNsEa5Gcg.text: We waited for so long for our food. They forgot about our order and didn't seem to care when we asked about it. People came in way after us and already ate there food before we got our order. When our order came, the banana foster French toast I ordered, we so drowned in maple syrup, it was disgusting. I love maple syrup but this had a half gallon of it. Then the chipotle burrito my friend order had no chiptole sauce and was tiny. What a waste of $25. I don't recommend this place. The service is awful.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

ZEuSMg8kJhlZBfM3cJpyKw.text: Found the place while on a bike ride. The breakfast was awesome for the price would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. All the other breakfasts looked amazing as well.

HDBcR0MURu0zBXVa5fgVIA.text: Great brunch food, very delicious. They have lots of hot sandwiches, which look a bit small, but they were still quite filling. They have a nice patio seating area. There was a really long line to order, and on top of that, there was a really long line to get our food.

5-me0AUPzI4r-jHnWVg6xA.text: The food here is pretty good but I don't like how it is set up here. You have to stand in line for your food and then go sit back down for about half an hour for them to bring it to you. Need a refill of OJ while youre eating or waiting for your food? Sorry. Gotta get back in line . Its just inconvenient. I think they weren't expecting their business to be as busy as it is when they came up with this concept. This would have worked much better for a place that isnt so packed. I will still go back nonetheless. I just wish they would change that.

QScOOaq-MMchQC42Cd_DWQ.text: Absolutely horrible.  Place was only about half full and no one on the patio, but my potatoes and burrito was cold. AND our food took 25 minutes to reach our table. Wife had the oatmeal,and I had breakfast burrito.  The burrito was so cold that the orange, gelatinous mass coming out of it - we think it was cheese- was like glue. Our two Americano coffees were lukewarm and watery. Never again. Ever.

8DjaL8tYbuIAMNEfzthqYw.text: I went here on a Sunday early afternoon which I knew going in would be the busiest time to be in there so I kind of braced myself for that. So I wasn't too shocked to show up and find it to be a madhouse, they definitely have put as many tables as possible in here. I feel at some point if a place gets this busy they need to find a way to better secure tables for people who are actually eating their food. I watched at least 4 tables be taken by people who just wandered in off the street and didn't order a thing.   Aside from the pure insanity, the food was pretty good. It was decently priced, they gave out fair portion sizes. The staff was as attentive as you can be with how busy they were. I had no negative Ncounters (get it?) with staff so that was a plus. Overall a good experience with good food.   I'm not one for big crowds generally so I don't see myself coming back in the future. But if you want a trendy Brunch spot on mill this is a good bet..

b6yBRqR-YZx-Ru_5HHSKzg.text: Always amazing. been going here for years even back when it was ncounter. i usually hat egg salad but their blt made me an eggsalad lover. its a popular place so expect a wait. worth it though.

5jPKdZHHo3-YZW8PKPwtMg.text: Daily Jam catered our engagement party and it was great! Allison was a pleasure to work with, and everyone at the party loved the sandwiches and salads!

829qTCP1ByBHKqJ3dq6bVA.text: Work in the area and been told about their great breakfasts that you can eat all day! Wandered in to friendly service staff and great eats! I got the veggie omlet and a passion tea. You order at the counter and they bring it out to you. Food came in a timely manner and the staff bends over backwords to make sure you are comfortable- know how things work (OK you push the ice dispenser for ice.. I am lame, thank you for not making fun of me) and make sure your spot is clean when you are finished. My next visit I need to try something else on this tasty menu!   Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Red velvet waffles, fried eggs and bacon!!!
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Dagwood. Lunch friend said one of the best he&#39;s had!
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mediterranean Salad has artichoke hearts!!!

jIuXZiBqwJo_Vl2aQZBQpQ.text: Good food, indoor and outdoor seating, Bellinis and Mimosas on the menu. Unfortunately, I was turned off by the claustrophobic feeling as soon as I walked in. This place had a line almost to the back of the cafe, & seating was limited so one of us had to swoop in on an empty table and sit down while the other stood in line to order.   Once we sat down, it took forever to get our food. When it finally arrived, it wasn't what I ordered. And we had no silverware. Or condiments. So I'm waiting on my meal, my mom is sitting there trying to be patient and not eat without me. The saving grace was that my food was yummy once I received it.   This was a Sunday morning/early afternoon, so I get that it's going to be busy. I'd like to come during the week when it isn't so crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

kMulDZ_LEQ_O0g0V2-Cx_Q.text: Have been coming here a couple of times a month since I started going to ASU but recently my experiences have not been so great.  The food is good but the establishment is WAY too hot.  They had the doors open when it was 113 outside and by the time I had taken a few bites of my breakfast I felt heat sick and felt icky for hours after

znQ-kIYDmQjENbRpjFFdzA.text: I wanted to like this place and gave it more than one shot, but the breakfast served on each occasion was disappointing. The croque monsieur and regular breakfast (eggs, toast, potato and bacon) were bland and the coffee from the self-serve dispenser was so watery it almost ran clear.  Other than missing part of an order, the staff are at least friendly and pleasant to interact with.

3JF2J2JgODD1Vnn1ORPY-g.text: Came here for breakfast on a weekday. Ordered the french toast with strawberries and the build your own breakfast sandwich. The french toast was fluffy, light, and very fulfilling! For the build your own sandwich, you have different options for types of meat, cheese, egg, bread, vegetables, and a side of your choice. I enjoyed my sandwich and loved being able to pick and choose from many options.  This place is self seating. When we got there at 9:30 am, there was no line and just a quick 10 min wait for the food. There's metered parking right in front of the restaurant. This was a good first experience and I'd definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. The French toast with strawberries and the build your own sandwich with a side.

Ea8Hq4-p8YJKTbS_XMJ08w.text: Dirty tables everywhere. Had to ask three times to clean the table. Once he came, cleared the dishes but left the table disgusting.  Had to borrow a towel to wipe ourselves. Poorly run, disorganized, food took forever. Once the food came, it was hot and tasted pretty good.   Unfortunately, it was overshadowed by the poor service and dirty restaurant.

4n1CeEMMgN7lDMB0Gqhp5A.text: great food!! I'm usually picky about eggs benedict's but the farmhouse one from here is super yummy!! also great prices

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Farmers Market Eggs Benedict

4ScHaxZcgRhFS1YkQFql_w.text: The decor is more of a fast casual however food was surprisingly good. I had the Huevos and Chorizo and it was very tasty. I tried my friends red velvet waffles was also especially good. Yummy! You order in the front and they take the food to the table.  The coffee was ok.

txjTlnhn4RPrHXWRBTarfw.text: This place has been overrun by PIGEONS. There are dozens of them and they are aggressive. I'm surprised the health department has not closed this place down. I used to look forward to coming here after a hike at the ASU butte, but I cannot go here anymore it's gross

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

EWphyRSmseQkTvOfjb9VlA.text: We liked it so much, we ate here every morning we woke up in Tempe. The potatoes were perfect every time. The eggs, omelette, and benedict  were all delicious. The coffee was excellent also. You wait in line, order at the counter, and they bring it to you. The service is very friendly, and the location is great. You can sit outside and people watch, or sit inside and catch up with friends.

YyaBDHHyU_AVH6GaQdlniA.text: Blown away by the food and atmosphere of the place. I hate finding parking on Mill, but will definitely make another trip back to this place. The potatoes were DELICIOUS. They looked sort of plain, but they made up in flavor and taste. I like these potatoes more then Snooze hash browns   Highly Recommend: -Chipotle Burrito  -Red velvet waffles

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Red Velvet Waffles $6.5

HUEw_iyHdZUlLW5dFa04TA.text: Cute little counter cafe. You order at the counter and they bring your food to your table. I got the eggs Benedict and it was delicious  I also had their strawberry mimosa which hit the spot. Ncounter was quick, easy and tasty. Definitely recommend if your in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

muDPaXEcvKPgPPW5dQWCYA.text: Mediocre food at best. Waited 30 mins for food. There were literally us and two other tables in the whole place. The red velvet waffles was good  which is why I gave two stars. Got the plain and simple. Eggs were supposed to be scrambled. Over cooked and not scrambled. More like an egg pancake that was chopped up. Potatoes cold,toast not toasted. My friend returned her chilaquiles. It was so cold the cheese had harden back up and had that oily look. She returned it.  Sadly I just ate mine real quick to get over with. I had to get to work and didn't have time to get food elsewhere.

wx0lFzKKUj3yHYkOsNt7Cg.text: Ncounter is one of my favorite quick / affordable breakfast spots to hit up when I'm near Tempe. I've obviously been a number of times, but I had to share what I got recently because I REALLY enjoyed it. The farmer's market bene *drooling*... I'm not a bene girl, mostly because I don't like ham... But how can you not like hollandaise? Which is why this veggie option is perfect for a gal like me! Spinach, tomato, avo, eggs, and hollandaise on a english muffin. It was delicious! Maybe a little less spinach next time as they piled it on there, but that's quite an easy fix. I also had a brilliant iced almond milk latte. I never have tried their coffee before, and I really enjoyed it! So glad it's finally patio szn! I can't wait to go back.

1WF5smOxL_Esp-XAN2wvZg.text: Loved this place, prices are super good and food is amazing!! I had the Banana Fosters french toast & it was better than expected. Highly recommend if you're in the area! Service was nice as well:)

iKWUdhwjdhvAiSoIIuXQKw.text: The line is long on the weekend, but it moves fast. They Will also take your order at the bar.  I had the pancakes and they were pretty good. It's too big for me to eat so I ended up taking some home. I also in the past tried the salad I believe it was had kale and chicken and it was very good.   It's a good place to stop if you're on Mill Avenue. It is quite loud though during its busy times.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

w2CVRKoVZZQZf9tAoXwwnA.text: I always passed this place and thought, Man! It seems like it's only a sit-down breakfast restaurant. Whoa, completely wrong.  NCounter is just a solid sandwich and salad cafe (correction: it does actually serve breakfast food like omelets and all that jazz) that brings your food to your table. The flavors are great and not too overdone. When I went I had a sandwich (forgot the name) and I was extremely impressed by how tasty it was. And the price? Honestly, I've paid about the same amount of money--if not more--on crappier restaurants down the street, but none of those dishes could ever compare to NCounter's sandwiches/salads!   If I had time to go back here, I would. Seems like this place is always busy, though, and with a limited amount of time for lunch, I can only enjoy this place once in a while. So sad!

UZo17KyReTflm8pGWuSEaQ.text: FINALLY.  It's about time something worthy of this location took over.  This place is perfect if I feel like being a jerk to my waistline or light and healthy.  Service is smart and efficient which is awesome since NO ONE likes lines.  I just wish they stayed open later :/

fxd20jR8xFWpMYUGVmbd6g.text: I was very excited to learn that the owners of TC Eggingtons in Mesa, AZ were opening another restaurant and this time in Tempe. I went to high school and college with the owner's daughter so I know the family and how great they are. The same love and passion that they put into their restaurant in Mesa, which has more of a country feel to it, they've put into this very modern and edgy spin on breakfast and lunch.   The first time I came was opening weekend for breakfast. After getting a feel for the restaurant we realized that you order up front and then take your order number and find a seat. We elected to sit at their coffee/booze bar and ordered Blood Marys while we waited for our food. The Bloody Marys were awesome with just enough spice to give them a kick, and the perfect amount of alcohol. When our food was ready, which literally only took 10 to 15 minutes to come out despite it being packed, they brought it out to us. I went with a chipoltle breakfast burrito and it was absolutely delicious. I felt it was a little on the small side because when I was finished I still wanted more. My girlfriend went with an omelet and it was just as delicious.  My next visit was to try their lunch and while good it didn't have the same wow factor that my breakfast did. I had ordered the Turkey and Avocado sandwich,  can't remember the exact name of it, and it was good. It tasted exactly like a sandwich I would make for myself at home. It was on regular 12 grain bread, had turkey, avocado, lettuce, and tomato on it. Very simple sandwich and it tasted that way. I was hoping to get an iced latte as well, however all they have is milk and soy milk. I've come to really love my iced latte's and mocha's with almond milk as a substitute. I don't take in dairy and as a male I try to avoid soy so my options are limited. Vanilla Almond milk really takes an iced latte/mocha to an all new level. I decided to go with the unsweetened jasmine green tea and it was some of the best tea I've ever had. Despite my disappointment in their lunch and lack of non-dairy options I will definitely be back to NCounter.

W7FosBR68QXD6DKqahXpEw.text: Great menu...lots of choices and excellent quality and tasty food. Long line went pretty quick but need to redesign the ordering area to accommodate that many people. We all enjoyed are meals and good vibe...will definitely return.

Y86fVsJra51aki0WetBwZA.text: Went for the first time this weekend. I was very excited for a new BREAKFAST place to be in Tempe since there are like NONE!~  I ordered the Farm Fresh eggs bene and my wife ordered some omelet, not sure which one and 2 OJ's. $26 later. We got our food fast. The Eggs were done almost perfect!! I was impressed! I am a big stickler for my Eggs being done properly on Eggs bene. They were almost right, just a bit too hard though but the yolk did run! The food was decent. It was not amazing. The potatoes were good but seemed like frozen type. Had a very garlic powder taste to them. I give them just an OK in my book. They should have put some fruit on the plate too. For $8 bene put some fruit along with the meal. Better presentation and well heck I wanted some fruit with my morning bene!  Wifes Omelet  was very good. Some spots were over done on omelet. Thats OK, hardly anyone gets Omelets right except for Zinc Bistro!  It was good.  Great place. I would give it some more time to weed out bad employees and get things really going with their new place. I would not write it off yet.I can see this place sticking around for awhile unless they screw it up and let it go downhill.  I am hoping for the best with this place. I will go back soon and hope for an improvement in their score.

N7bNvpu9IRx_3q8sFoSWyA.text: We live in the neighborhood and used to be here weekly. Lately the food taken a hit. Most of the things we used to order and love are underwhelming. Flavorless (and thereby overpriced). Still a fun place for breakfast with drinks on the patio on a weekend morning (if you can get a table).

_CL7N3KteiygTn4H30jSyQ.text: Most delicious and very quick even with a big Sunday brunch crowd!   My eggs were up by the time I got my coffee and a table!

15x45UqrpbAhLkdgPVl_7w.text: After eating at Ncounter for lunch and Breakfast, I think they have a winner. Staff is helpfull, eggs were cooked perfectly, and the decor is great. We love to support a new local business that is not a chain! Good work! We will be back.

GHiPZCi2it6z_t8GopKJ0A.text: ya not so much the lattes we ordered were probley the worst i have had to date tasted like warm milk . the breakfast was ok but served room temp . the employs all lacked personality.prices $$$

pAcf0I-YRGrPkIRaSuewug.text: Great breakfast and lunch spot. You would want to go here for dinner, too, but it closes at 3:05 p.m. I've wondered why it's 3:05, but I decided that maybe it's to give you 5 minutes to get in at the last minute. If not, oh well that's just my speculation. I have found it difficult to order because everything on the menu sounds good. I have eaten and loved the Banana's Foster French Toast, the Loaded Omelette and the Turkey Pesto on Focaccia. Yum Yum Yum. Oh I almost forgot I had the Blueberry Blast Smoothie and it was delicious- pretty much everything is good! They are also right next to the light rail. I like that A LOT! But beware, it's always busy, so it might not be a good place if you literally only have minutes. Another plus, is the patio is dog friendly. The patio is my favorite place to sit because of the great people watching opportunities on Mill Ave, but I wish it was a little bigger.

Y9O2NQ2PRK1Gn2AchQFPsg.text: I love this place!  I have not had one bad dish here.  This is finally a place on Mill Ave that will make it.  I highly recommend the Portobellini sandwich and the Banana Fosters French Toast.  They also serve Bellinis and Mimosas!

NN0tgDxSKT58FMdvRnER9w.text: WOW!  Awesome breakfast!  This place is a gem.  The breakfast Burrito- specialty of the house, was sensational; filled with eggs, bacon, potatoes, cheese, avocado & chipolte sauce. The baked goods are all made in house.  The Cinnamon buns are a must try!  The service and staff are very friendly and accommodating.  It is truly an all American breakfast spot; a place that you will want to go back to over & over again.  Will have to try lunch next time.  Menu looks fabulous!

jIr0h96YpVcxkes8oxp2EA.text: nice breakfast place on mill. stand in line, order at the counter and they bring your food to the table. omelette with pears, havarti, sliced almonds and bits of bacon was good and cheesy. it had a fresh fruit cup as accompaniment. weather perfect and nice to sit out side. fortunately no one was smoking.

uiYU1_dE5YFCz4NrMlhQPg.text: this pl just opened up this year with a bang .. they must be very proud of themselves .. you did it right my friends, food is great

XKlnmqHDupuDe-fWYfkHXA.text: This place is phenomenal! I think they have been open about a year and one half & I have probably been there 40 or 50 times. I believe I have had everything on the menu & I have to say it is ALL superb! The place is up beat, great staff & super food! Between the breakfast & lunch menu, you could go there every day & never get tired of it. I was there today for lunch with a friend & we sat out on the patio - just delightful all the way around. If you haven't been there you are missing the boat!

LR4hfsb4UB4H2aQH7i8sKw.text: NCounter has a lot going for it--great location, cool design/signage, nice layout and good service.  Its unfortunate that the follow through of food quality did not live up.  On a recent visit to NCounter, I ordered a simple breakfast of eggs and a side of fresh fruit.  What I got concerned me to the point of asking one of their employees--fruit tasted acrid, of preservatives and like no fruit I want to taste again.  I learned from a manager/owner that contrary to their constant use of the word "fresh" on their website and branding, their "fresh fruit" comes out of a can. I understand that this is the unfortunate reality in many restaurants...those, however, are restaurants that do not (and will not) receive my patronage.  NCounter can do better. Until then, I won't be returning. I have no respect for a branding message that is not upheld in their product.

r9opYmNW8BABBV4yJ18aZQ.text: My husband and I stopped in for a quick breakfast and were blown away by the quality of the food for the affordable price!  It was fast, delicious and the atmosphere was nice.  We loved the fact that they offer a seating area outside for people who have dogs.  We will definitely be coming back!

efLBhlLHElATy6isTrx7MQ.text: We ate here twice on a visit to Tempe, both times for lunch and both times ordered the cold turkey and avocado sandwich.  The bread is amazing.  The sandwich is stacked!  Ingredients were fresh.  Service was good & great - at the register a little less than enthusiastic, but we ate at the bar and both servers there were friendly and helpful.  A great switch from our typical pub lunches - we look forward to going back during our next visit to Tempe!

d9IdN3tiroizXYe-Ct2bLw.text: Their breakfast is awesome. It brought me back to life on several occasions.  A lot of the food on their menu is really tasty and different which is cool because theres not a lot of places around like that.

TGuqdiZwre-f1m5W21nmyQ.text: I've had this restaurant on my 'places to check out' list for quite a while now. I finally got there for lunch the other day, and was so disappointed that I decided to write a review. The ambiance was great, place was nice and clean...and there was plenty of cute ASU girls in there...but that wasn't enough to distract me from how awful the food was. I was under the impression that this was a good restaurant for light, healthy fare, but that really wasn't the case. For $12 I got a tuna melt and potato chips. The tuna was more like coleslaw, and there was so little of it that I probably could have stuffed the entire portion into a shot glass. The bread was soggy with grease and butter. There was so much liquid that I could have filled a cup and drank my lunch. Gross. I would have ordered something else, but the line was much too long and I had a limited amount of time. I actually ended up stopping at a place around the corner to pick up a 2nd meal that I could actually eat. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing. My friend got the cobb sandwich and wasn't thrilled with his either. Maybe I'll try again with the breakfast.

H5cY7WVB6x39-KftnKTXqw.text: I love this place. I love the concept, the food, the coffee, the atmosphere, the location. It all just works.   You go up the the counter at the back, you order and pay for your food, they give you a card, the food gets delivered to you, you eat and you leave. There's a person who even cleans up your mess. It's simple, it's easy, it's fast and the food is just as good if not better than other sit down restaurants.  I always get the chorizo scramble thing with eggs and potatos and tortilla on the side. It's ridiculously good. It's great hang over food. They have other healthy stuff too. And booze! They've got mimosas and bloody marys. It's great.

YqhpGOwM2oUpuxElCEELDg.text: Such a shame these guys don't focus on the coffee as much as they do the food.   Been there twice now cause the location was close to the hotel but being a real coffee lover,  sooooo disappointed to discover that they can't provide the usual gibraltars, flat whites, and machiatos we expect from cafes and restaurants now.  The first time my espresso came out in a 12 inch paper cup so virtually a dribble in a cup. The second time, when the waitress had no idea what a gibraltar was, I ordered a small Americano, only to have it taste like a weak french press. No crema, no strength,  no flavor.  Such a shame for the business to have invested in a commercial espresso machine only for them not to make the most of it.

_6daeiuoFmg13lpfU4Y6Gw.text: Yay! Love this place. Great basic breakfast and even better coffee. Cool vibe. Waiter remembered us from the day before.

ztFx-MufIrhr5fD3_FrDuw.text: Good food. Everything else about this place feels like work. If you like disorganized chaos & the excitement of not knowing what's going to happen at breakfast, you have got to try this place on a Sat/Sun morning

c0DzPnBaLqzFC8Ivc5duyw.text: This is a Palo Alto wannabe!  It is clean, and the food is consistent for breakfast, but very uninspired.  I would say it is probably the best full service diner, I had been to in Tempe, AZ during my Sandy extended layover.  When I do return to the Tempe, AZ area it is probably one place that I may return to.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

pWKEyTT2lFCbo5dUJUS6Dw.text: The hulk is delish and not too heavy like the PB&J smoothie. Got the Asian salad and everything was super fresh.. The cilantro made the salad. Can't wait to try there bfast.. The French toast looks enormous!

zr1DTkIxwAkE3z1-KiMezQ.text: I've been here several times for breakfast and lunch, and I love it. As a mushroom lover, I'd have to recommend the portobellini sandwich. Mushroom-vegetable goodness in a bun.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

7T1tr8qZ-H44qt273UdC8Q.text: The wait sucks. Waited over half an hour on our food and people up to three orders behind us recieved food before us.

3nG8OOlFiIz7F5lvl5AHDQ.text: I went to NCounter because of Yelp.  Waaay overrated in my opinion! After you order at the counter, you have to fight for a table if you have more than two people in your group. There was relatively fast turnover, but it's annoying having to cherry-pick someones table hoping they'll leave after their last bite. But, being a Saturday morning, being busy wasn't a deal breaker.  When I received my omelette, the cheese was partially melted and rather tasteless. The eggs were rubbery like something you'd get at a cheap buffet. The potatoes were OK, but didn't compensate for the rest. Overall, the portion sizes were small and the food was just mediocre. I'm not a picky breakfast person, but I would rather go to Denny's or IHOP than come back to NCounter.  If you're looking for good breakfast in Tempe (near Mill), you're not far from Harlow's, Essence Bakery, Cafe Boa or even U.S. Egg.

2l9D9cEoo09NGJcII4E-uw.text: So much potential but so unfulfilled. When a customer asks whether the strawberries that come with the French toast have anything on them or are just strawberries that does include sugar/ syrup. They were drowned in something.  Why, when I'm dining in, do I need a coffee served in a takeaway cup with a plastic lid on it? I do know how to drink coffee out of a washable cup, without spilling it. Sorry to say this was a really disappointing experience.

bVu2cp7A6OSXB5RZIwafow.text: Hip, happening cafe with lots of delicious choices. Seriously the best chop salad the world over. I am thoroughly enjoying this unique blend of flavors: Arugula, cranberries, couscous, corn, feta, pecans. Who knew the combo would be yummy, but, it is delish. The menu is exciting & fresh. Love the bustling atmosphere but chill patio. 2 thumbs up.

XdHiuwcmzJVpGxjwJTIptA.text: My second time here. Always been great. Was expecting it to be super crowded for a Sunday at noon, but I hardly had to wait.   Had the Chipotle breakfast burrito which was great, accompanied with a great cold brew coffee. Sat around and read a book for an hour in a lively environment. Definitely coming back. Turn up!

A132LEFMEc3iwCanhNBkrQ.text: Yeah, I could eat breakfast every day here! I love breakfast foods and this place knocked it outta the park for me on multiple visits.   Things I've tried:  *Bananas Foster French Toast: thick slices of french toast with banana caramelly goodness all over them. ((MY FAVORITE!))  *Waffles: the batter is fantastic, the strawberries were fresh and the whip cream topped it perfectly. (no syrup needed for these delicious waffles!)  *The Pear: this is an omelet with bosc pear, havarti cheese, almond slices and bacon. (You may be thinking, as I did.....pear, eggs and cheese? Don't miss out on this combo, it's outstanding!)  They do offer GF options too if you need/prefer. I have yet to try their lunch items because of all the breakfast options. I hear that the Smokehouse Avocado Stack is a must try item! No doubt, I will be back in very soon. Prices are great, happy employee's but the service is a little slow. I attribute the slow service to the fact every time I am in this restaurant it is crazy busy, so just be prepared to wait a little bit. You won't be disappointed once you have your meal though, I think it is worth the wait!

vQpTjgfJcEDRT-zfHD5DaA.text: Two stars cause the food is good. I have been here on a few occasions and the food is delicious but the service freaking sucks. The guy behind the bar was really rude. I asked if there was a smoothie for ashley, he sarcastically responded with "I dont know, IS there a smoothie for Ashley?" This is your job. You get paid to smile, be nice, and take food orders. I work at a very busy and local breakfast spot here in Tempe also so I get it. You guys are slammed. Believe me, I know the feeling.. but at least act like you care. The pretentious attitude from the young girl at the counter was enough for me to never return. I gave her a twenty and she didn't bother to give me my change. I had to ask for it... after I already put money in the tip jar. Are you kidding me? Take that shit to Scottsdale.

hFdJiEnqt9u0xBR6fASyYQ.text: My main thought: If you go here, get the french toast.  I run past this restaurant frequently and I always see people eating thick, decadent pieces of french toast, draped sugary toppings and topped with a mountain of whipped cream.  I love whipped cream, if socially acceptable, I would use it as salad dressing.  So, in retrospect, I should have ordered what I knew would come with whipped cream, and therefore, be fantastic.  But, I was an hour away from attending my daughter's preschool graduation, where I knew there would be cupcakes and cookies and ice cream (and maybe even whipped cream), so I wanted something semi-light and semi-healthy.    I was pleased to see an eggwhite omelet on the menu (it makes for easy ordering) and it sounded tasty - paired with avocado, tomato and cilantro, three foods that I adore.  We sat outside on a beautiful day.  As far as environment goes, I give this place 5 stars. It is great for people watching and you can SIT AT A BAR! for breakfast.  We opted for an outside table, right next to a girl who was eating breakfast with a baby pig sitting in her lap.  I must say, I have never ate my bacon while sitting next to a pig before - that scored a point for ambience.  Anyway, my omelette arrived  and it was very mediocre.  There was literally half an avocado embedded in my omelette, and while I do appreciate the fact that they are not stingy with the delightful green fruits, it was barely chopped and I like my avocados in manageable, bit size pieces or slices.  I ended up giving the massive chunk to my husband, who devoured it one bite.  I splurged and got potatoes (instead of fruit or cottage cheese) but they were sub par.  They were not browned and crispy, but rather yellow and soggy.    Don't get me wrong -- the food was not bad -- I just would not order that omelette again.  But really, shame on me for not ordering what I knew would be awesome: the french toast.

4RguJv8cT0A1d3toabmlTA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE I JUST CAN'T NOT GET ENOUGH OF NCOUNTER! the vibe is young clean and fresh.  the good is so delish.. I keep telling all my friends to go here for brunch (:

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Farmers

j0io5CAz5gg4y8MdgkgNVQ.text: love you for bringing me my breakfast and drinks.  eat at the bar, you can sit and order, instead of standing at the counter.  VIP  Moe Moe, I so so love,  I love your company today, thank you sista!  one love.  eat the pear omelet with out the bacon, you'll be happy.  get a salad instead of potatoes, it will make your brain even happier.  great greyhounds.  love vodka and grapefruit at places that can pull it off. thanks for being on mill.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yummy greyhound lunch.

cNID4Xcegitvi4bLFih-9Q.text: I had the pear omelette today and it was outstanding. Very different for an omelette but it works with just the right combo of ingredients. The staff was welcoming too. I took a star off for the lack of hash browns - maybe one day breakfast establishments will realize that breakfast potatoes aren't exciting. It's all about the hash browns well done.

XBuNrdY_HZsT-Z0mkA8dtg.text: I honestly have to say, the food is absolutely magnificent, really good and unique and the atmosphere is really pleasent... if you have an hour to spend. Every occasion I've eaten here has seen me wait 30+ minutes, even get close to an hour, even though, everytime, I was one of only five or six patrons in the establishment. I understand you food is great, and that takes time, but it doesn't take 45 min to make a grilled cheese. In fact, I'm writing this as I still wait for food, and can see employees just hanging around in the back. I've worked in a restaurant so I understand the importance of quick service and urgency and there isn't any. The servers are incredible nice and I do enjoy eating here, but it can be unbearably slow at times.

Zj818dPK20ycBlXzrpeC8w.text: O.M.G. I am definitely a breakfast food lover. I will choose breakfast food over any other sort of food anytime. My friend suggested this morning that we go get brunch at NCounter. I am always on board to try new things.  We pulled up, walked in and I am immediately impressed by the number of people in there enjoying their brunch. I look up at the menu and I am also really happy to see the wide range of things to try. After this trip I want to go back and try them all. This time, though, I decided on one of the "Almost Fried" sandwiches called House Request. It sounded so interesting with multiple types of veggies and with olive tapenade (WHICH IS MY FAVORITE) and cream cheese with an over easy egg. It was so good. I also got a side of the grilled potatoes. They were delicious. My friend and I decided brunch wasn't brunch without some morning cocktails, she got a bloody mary (and since she'd been here multiple times before, she already knew she loved them) and I got a mimosa and it was so good!   Needless to say, I will be back to NCounter to try all of the wonderful things on the menu. Especially that Pecan Cinnamon Roll. It looked so good!

xFeya7hgIj61ZIX1kef_-A.text: I absolutely love when I come to Phoenix for work because I have some of the best dining experiences in the world.  I found N Counter on Yelp and decided to stop in for a late breakfast. All I can say is WOW! My boyfriend had a veggie, egg breakfast sandwich. I tried the spinach eggs Benedict, breakfast potatoes and the red velvet waffles. Everything we ate was excellent. He actually said, "this is the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had! It has everything I love on it."  The waffles were magical! Like a desert or guilty pleasure. I love my eggs Benedict as it was perfect in every way.  The vibe was cool and laid back, good service, great location and perfect food. I've added this to my list of go to's when I'm in Tempe!  Pure perfection!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

ZGecNr4VXiSMEtISZfOZcQ.text: I've been wanting to try this breakfast place for months.  I finally was able to stop in and I expected it to be really good.  It was mediocre to me. The red velvet waffles were good, as well as the bacon.  The potatoes were over cooked.  I may have done better with the eggs Benedict.  The staff was very polite. The food came out at a reasonable wait time.  I'll try one more time and get something other the potatoes and scrambled eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

xo1SZo5St-k3TykIqvbezA.text: The food is actually pretty good here, but the service is terrible. No one is smiling or happy to serve. They forget your requests for condiments and make you work to realize even your smallest ask. They come across as arrogant and will most likely be abandoned by customers for the many other restaurants in the near vicinity.

V4XvYloFx6cHfwemOxxAAA.text: I came here for breakfast with my love & my Oreo aka my puppy. It was a Sunday so it was a bit packed.   I ordered the N counter omelette. This has all of my favorites in it. chicken, mushrooms, broccoli, cream cheese and hollandaise sauce. Everything was amazing, however I wish it came with more of the Hollandaise sauce. I also ordered the Melon Patch cocktail. This wasn't anything amazing to it.   I really like this place a lot. The food is good and I like their outdoor patio and the fact that it's dog friendly so I can take my puppy. They'll even bring out a bowl of water for her. The only negative is I wish it was more restaurant style instead of waiting in line to order at the counter. Great place for breakfast/brunch though.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. N counter omelette

cH7BeNkqYwRZ88nYulRWbQ.text: I have been going here since day one and it use to be the best breakfast spot on Mill Ave in Tempe. It's sad to see such thriving business decline. The food is now served cold. The prices have been raised to not such a good value anymore. The pigeons/birds ____ all over the patio. You order food only to sit and watch 5-6 people that were behind you get theirs before you. The icing on the cake today, their POS system is down so they were turning business away. You mean to tell me you don't have a back up plan when your registers go down !?!? I know why do I keep going back ? Well honestly My Co-worker was in the same frat as the owner and I thought if I mentioned the decline to him it might get better. Pfffft they don't care. Today was it for me. To many other breakfast spots in the area now seek other options

v6WxKNK1aS1b4PgLRPwxLw.text: I like stopping in for breakfast. Friendly service and decent omelet. I would recommend the hot Juan.

Lwnm8X9i00Iy3TpEWw2FCw.text: If I could give zero stars I absolutely would. I came in for breakfast on a Wednesday morning - around 8:45 am. The first thing that I noticed, upon walking in, was the smell. It smelled like rotten cabbage rolled up in a diaper, then smoked through a cigarette. Despite that, I was willing to give it a try, as they have been touted as the best waffles in Arizona!   I waited 173 minutes, during which I started to get bombarded with flies. During these 173 minutes, not a SINGLE person, not ONE, came to even offer me water. This is by far the worst dining experience I have had in my whole life.

xJStPK2Y8oDil06NJ9s7KQ.text: I love coming to NCounter! Truly one of the best places for breakfast in the area. I've dined here at various times with a large group, by myself, and with a few friends. So it appears that the place never settles down and is always busy no matter the time of day nor season.  Food is amazing! I never know what to order because it's an extensive list and everything sounds tasty. Then I have to ponder the drink menu- mimosa? smoothie? Cartel cold brew? Hair-pulling decisions to make! The last few times I've ordered an omelette plate with potatoes, just love the simplicity of it. Friends also have noted love for their breakfast burrito and smoothies! They have a fairly simple bar menu for those who need a drink with brunch. The mimosas I've had are nothing special, almost too much OJ and not enough champs.   Their people are great too. Anytime I walk up to order it's always been with a smile and a pleasant non-fake greeting. Recently the only free table was slightly dirty, but the manager came by to clean it up and apologized for not being quick enough.   Definitely worth the time and money to visit here!

oXYaoAUWDqT6UZgP6V9yhg.text: This place has made me a certified breakfast believer. SO and I were looking for some breakfast after a long morning of Pokehunting and stumbled upon this gem. The outside is underwhelming but once you go in, you're transported into this chic and very tastefully decorated breakfast bar with a great selection. I felt like I just left soul cycle in New York and came here for some coffee with my rich friends lol anyways, the selection was great and the simple breakfast (I think that's what it was called) really hit the spot. A new favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Oh lawd have mercy

5N0pwnp637IJhGUZlX5jkA.text: Not bad, but not great. The chilaquiles were sweet, and not traditional at all, but had a good texture despite the weird taste. The market benedict was also okay: ingredients were good and fresh, the hollandaise was unremarkable, and it came out lukewarm. At least the coffee was tasty, and the service was very good.

4mBH2Jh0Uq44GHRtEY2ONw.text: The blueberry muffin is to die for! Best ever. This is definitely a gem and a must to visit.

t9c0FtW2wBpWq3cm04JA6A.text: Awesome breakfast place! They're usually very busy so the wait can be longer than expected but it's worth it! Their strawberry waffles are delicious! Also, first come first serve so as soon as you walk in, start looking for a table, have someone in your party save the table while you're in line to order food!

7Cy5q_XEuaengT9W9D_Mag.text: This place is pretty unassuming and I wasn't looking forward to coming here for lunch on my last day in Phoenix, but I was pleasantly surprised.  I had the grilled cheese with bacon. It's made with a yummy cream cheese spread and grilled to perfection. It's served with a salad and the serving sizes were just right. My belly was full, my tastebuds were satisfied and I can't wait to try making that grilled sandwich at home!   Delicious. Perfect for lunch.

9i8KiESBtAq-uqYp5yzZ0Q.text: Excellent food and service. Friendly, spacious and delicious.

81wiaBKKSUgSlChnriUp_Q.text: Pancake Fail I have been here a few times and have always looked forward to eating here. I have recommended Ncounter to out of towners and friends. However, based on my most recent experience I will have to recommend a new place in Phoenix & Tempe. I placed an order to go for 3 separate breakfast/lunch items. 2 of the orders were quite disappointing.  The egg omelette request was for egg whites well that was ignored. I understand that mix-up. Now the pancake order was a JOKE. All 3 pancakes were ridiculously burned and were promptly thrown out. I have included a picture of the pancakes. Honestly the person who allowed this order should probably be looking for a new job. I am not sure if QUALITY is a top concern any longer.  I left a message for the manager and I hope to get a call soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

bsrJ-xgviJlko4J5pf2hRg.text: Great place to grab a healthy flavorful breakfast. Has the yogurt and granola with the morning glory. Absolutely perfect.

TtC6uIxnouSwch3JYOh3sw.text: Amazing place! Amazing food, amazing prices and great service. But god I hate that name

8XWJN2za18szv-KvYF6DJw.text: Pretty underwhelming.  It looked good from the website so as new-to-towners we thought we would check it out.   First - you place your order at a counter all the way in the back of the restaurant and then pick a seat and they bring your food to you.   The line situation is a little bit confusing because they have "order here" and "to go orders" right next to each other behind a  stanchion so you get the awkward "I was standing in line here" when people who are "regulars" zip up to the line and then try to cut the line of five or so who formed a line behind the register assuming that to stand horizontally along the counter would imply they were "to go" orders   When you order your food and drink you are told it will be brought to you but if you want cream or sugar in your coffee they tell you that it's at the beverage counter (so you have to go back inside after being seated to get the coffee the way you asked at the counter)  Our food came to us cold so that was disappointing. I ordered the vegetarian eggs Benedict (I think it's called a farmers Benedict on the menu) and literally nothing on the plate was warm.   It probably would have been good.

qbJgXeno54z_JQTGhCnTmw.text: Great brunch spot. Somewhat limited menu, but there is a good variety to choose from. Order at the register and seat yourself. It was pretty crowded here on a Sunday morning, but there was enough seating (especially on the outside patio), that there wasn't much issue finding a seat. My girlfriend and I both had the red velvet waffles here and they were great. Although, they were sweet enough with the frosting that we didn't use any of the maple syrup they came with. The turkey sausage was also a good side - although it was actually 3 patties, rather than a sausage link. Overall, it's a nice casual place for brunch right on Mill Ave; just make sure to get here outside of peak hours if it's hot outside and you want to find a seat indoors.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Red velvet waffles. A favorite, but keep in mind they are very sweet with the frosting, so they&#39;re good without maple syrup too

aKjiqRTQUQBByb7lhasE4A.text: This wasn't my first time coming here, but I was definitely impressed with the food this time. Ordered the Greek omelet, which I have gotten before but was so much better now, and the red velvet waffles. Everything was so good, nice outdoor seating, will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Red Velvet waffles! Yum!

O7_oEyDJwixKsMDwEjzokg.text: Nice cafe on Mill Ave in Tempe. The restaurant is nicely decorated and very clean. They have a fenced outdoor eating areas that is nice and it is per-friendly as long as your dog doesn't eat wait-staff...lol. The ordering system is efficient (counter service with a number on your table) but it can be tedious to wait in line on busy days. The food is very fresh looking and tastes great.

3itkrVltR85wHWfqjYEalg.text: I absolutely love everything I've ever gotten here. The food tastes fresh and like they use very high quality ingredients. Tends to get very a busy and rightfully so. Probably the best food on Mill Ave!

N5OhFoYSQwg5IDEXrBueCg.text: Our 1 hour drive to Tempe for NCounter was worth every penny.  Great value for the $$$.  Very inexpensive meals with friendly/helpful staff.

d4bPoinRJZ512TYc1-TFXw.text: Restaurant is always spotless outside and always leaves a bit to be desired on the patio. Food is excellent. It's obvious they use quality ingredients. For some items, portions are a little small for the price. For others, they're huge. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, though. Always cooked to order and always done quickly.

IRmKRIbhDVOv5OYV6kayCw.text: The one word I would choose to describe my breakfast was FRESH!  This restaurant was one we had heard about and decided to give it a try.  I ordered the Killer, which consisted of bacon, Gorgonzola, tomato and eggs, sandwich style.   It came with a delicious small mixed salad on the side.   Soooo good!   The Croque Monsieur  consisted of grilled artisan sour dough, tomato, black forest ham, mustard sauce, Gruyere, 2 eggs.  Another outlandishly flavorful breakfast dish!    I have two suggestions: 1) move the drink bar - it becomes crowded and loses its flow.; 2)  Install shades - all the customers facing towards the windows were experiencing the same issue - sun in their eyes.  Other than that, expect tasty food and great service!

0uWRUOgGKoLtO_8UblYxSA.text: This place got pretty good reviews So I picked it for Saturday brunch. I was a bit surprised by the set up which wasn't mentioned in any recent reviews so that's one of the reasons for my 4 stars. You go up to the counter to order your meal and drinks and then they're brought to you. While I understand this, I'm a little old fashioned in that I prefer a server. Regardless, the food and drinks were wonderful. I had a Screwdriver, biscuits and gravy and some kind of eggs Benedict. All was very good and filling. Honey got an omelette, a Bloody Mary and split my biscuits and gravy. We couldn't finish everything so planned on taking food home with us which leads me to the other reason for the 4 star rating. When it came time to get a to-go box, I waited for a runner to come by. 2 or 3 were back and forth while one was talking with his buddy. For 15 minutes or so, no one even looked our way. Finally, a young man came by. Overall great place though.

dVuwhAHTKD8ke7fZxJ7dpA.text: This Breakfast and Brunch place is really fresh and delicious. There is a really nice outdoor patio to enjoy Arizona's Spring weather.

qpDkl9E16WxarAul_Q66vQ.text: Delicious breakfast and smoothie. Nice and close to the marriott!

AwbxAL2-BQUnI6OyJoYGnw.text: This place is very diffrent for mill! Breakfast is great tast like home not like a fast meal! worth the $$$ the evern have green juices   but the parking SUCKS thats why we stopped going we had to pay to park then eat?  no thanks

KJ0QQI-rn4BEUxeCiWaamQ.text: Great service, lovely atmosphere and top class food. Try the vegetarian omelette... it's awesome!

hUVmnY1rSYVWWxx1hE8V9A.text: Perfect fit on Mill Ave. I'm surprised it took this long to get a cool little breakfast/coffee bar on Mill, considering the amount of hangover breakfast traffic the area gets with ASU right next door.   I've been a few times and have been rather pleased. The food has been great, and they do a nice job with their presentation which gives the experience that extra bonus. The atmosphere is engaging, artwork on the walls, some cool old architectural sketches, and some nice color highlights and tasteful touches. The coffee was fine, nothing amazing but by no means sub-par. I honestly opt for the smoothies when making my breakfast trips, I take care of the coffee at home before hand.   Only complaint: when it gets busy things tend to fall apart. I've been there a good handful of times now and they are definitely gaining momentum. The only problem is when it gets out of hand and the line is out the door, food takes a while and sometimes comes looking rushed or even cold. Honest mistake though, it gets pretty packed in there.   Overall: perfect breakfast spot for a late start on a Saturday. Conveniently located next to a light rail stop as well.

IrB9Dy3rPuk-0K36ilw9ug.text: GR8 place for breakfast. Location, menu choices, and taste of food were all good. Costs was a little high for time of day, other than that would go back for the french toast and turkey sausage.

etIMBm440DKuEjNMC-M2PQ.text: I won't go often, but if I want breakfast on Mill Ave this my first idea to go to. It's a great idea for a date here instead of meeting them at night too! (Tip)

lZk0SpdMAQu_cU1HOD5b5Q.text: A bit overpriced. Service was OK.  Food not good....and nothing to talk about. Eggs were very greasy, potatoes were not fresh (tasted as though they came from a frozen bags)....it all was just boring.  And, my guest got pancakes which tasted like rubber :(  I don't believe that I will be visiting NCounter again.

KkN85Oq2jYBb83wcnrb-qw.text: Great food, great atmosphere! If there is something on the menu you're in the mood for, you won't be disappointed. If you pick at random, you probably won't be disappointed. When you see what others are eating at thier table, you'll wish you ordered what they have. .  . until you get yours.

hVDk8uI-CHiny9VxPcItlg.text: Stopped in after morning jog at A mountain, seemed like the whole place was run by a bunch of block head frat boys. Omelette was pretty good, coffee pretty good, guy running the register was a  deutche. Probably won't be heading back but it was worth a try.

PkMwp2eggqDrPNzu0a9rBQ.text: Ordered the Chorizo and Eggs as a burrito. Food was fresh and tasted good. Portion was large but not shockingly so. Order taker seemed a bit pre-occupied, no smile. Prices seemed a bit high. $8.00 for a burrito.   Still though, the food was pretty tasty.

5RkGXZndQhvg39IRMA7riw.text: Everything looked so Good and everyone in my party of 12 liked their meals as well.  It was very busy, but that's a good thing so if you made it later in the morning it would be a little calmer

hnJA8-WCL5R0CpyXpZzgyw.text: Came down here to meet up with friends who were in town. My friend says her sons always go here. Definitely come early. We got here at 10 am which was good.  Busy but atill a few tables. By 10:30 it was a long line and packed.  Got the bananas foster French toast.  It was good but a bit too sweet for me. My friends got the huevos and chorizo and the other got eggs Benedict.  They liked it.  Like that the have homemade pastries. Will be back to try other things.

ECSzlIhgDRJN6EH4lUo0GQ.text: I decided to meet my friend for lunch in Tempe as her work is right off of Mill and 3rd street. However she gives me a funky address that I type into my iphone (instead of saying, "hey Tasia, I work on 3rd street, just off of mill) and it leads me on a wild goose chase. Alas, I finally get to the correct destination, park, and walk to meet her in the 113 degree heat (but weather.com says it *feels* like 106, ha!). She asks me where I want to go and I say "somewhere new," which is easy for me because I haven't been on Mill since 2004. She is naming off food joints as we are walking South on Mill, I pull out my Yelp app and quickly type in "lunch tempe" and NCounter pops up. I give this suggestion, we stop walking, turn around and look at how far the walk now is (it really wasn't that far, it was just the heat) since I didn't think about this sooner. Just then, she sees a coworker and asks for recommendations and his first choice in NCounter. We look back at each other and decide to go for it. This place is open Monday-Sunday 7am - 3pm and serves breakfast and brunch foods. The inside was very refreshing with the cold AC, open layout, and tons of tables and chairs, including one nice communal table. They also have a small patio with misters. My friend and I starred at the large menu and decided to split the Potobellini ($8) and the Peppered Italian Salad ($8.50). The Potobellini comes with portobellini mushrooms, roasted red peppers, artichoke, provolone cheese, spinach and a balsamic mayo that is piles on a delicious grilled ciabatta bread and you have a choice of a side salad or chips to accompany the sandwich. The Peppered Italian Salad comes with grilled chicken atop of sauteed cashews, red peppers, and garlic, over romaine lettuce with an Italian Parmesan dressing. The salad was tasty, but they went a little heavy on the dressing which is a total buzz kill for me. Next time I'll ask for the dressing on the side. For drinks they offer anything from alcoholic beverages (served at a smaller counter), coffee, tea, smoothies, and your traditional sodas ($2) and juices. I opted for iced tea ($2) and appreciate that they offer a freshly brewed Blackberry-Jasmine-Green Tea and a Passion Fruit iced tea. The service was great. The employee taking our order offered up the Peppered Italian Salad suggestion and the employee delivering our food noticed we were splitting our items and brought us out a separate plate use. We also had our table top cleared pretty soon after we finished eating so we were able to enjoy our space and drinks while finishing out conversation before my friend had to go back to work. We both agreed that the mild sunburn and heat stroke was worth it and that we both will be back!

NETj2Av4dXF8lCT4zrURIQ.text: I've been here twice and both times were AMAZING!  I got omelets both times, once with a side of waffles.  My husband got sandwiches both times (not a breakfast man).  We both have agreed that this is one of the best brunch joints around.  It's a little pricey but very worth the occasional visit!  Service was quick both times as well, even though we went during very busy Saturdays.  I think we maybe waited 10 minutes after ordering despite the place being packed.

CUxoSssIYiPGqu_FUgpvgQ.text: I am no expert on places around this area (right on Mill Avenue) but this is a really great breakfast/brunch place! My friend took me here when I was visiting and they have a varied menu so finding something that suits everyone should be pretty easy. I am a brunch lover so it really wasn't hard to fall in love with the place, it is a very causal ambiance and overall great experience (at least I had nothing to complain at as a visitor)!   As a New Yorker there is few places seat you outside, the outdoor seating might therefore be my favorite part. Over all it is an excellent place for breakfast/brunch, I wish I could just work my way though their menu.

N9UVVkOGYyBkdsbv77LDzQ.text: I've been waiting to try this place until ASU was out for the summer. It was still busy at 9:30 on Saturday but I'm sure less so than during the school year and we were even able to find free street parking nearby. Customers looked like mostly locals in a mix of ages.  After ordering at the counter it took about 15 minutes to receive our food. Service was brisk and efficient and we enjoyed watching the food orders come out.  I had "The Killer" breakfast sandwich (bacon, tomato, blue cheese and eggs on toasted ciabatta) with fruit on the side and my husband had chorizo and potatoes with toast instead of tortillas. Both were excellent.  I'm glad to see they're opening new locations because I'd hesitate going to this one during the school year unless it was pretty early in the day.

P1GaS0ikEZtEfUpG9a7AFA.text: If you ever need a bathroom in a pinch. Please. Go to encounter. The experience will change your life

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

L_vwpwZcgELwgEzfzZAMHw.text: Occasionally I go to brunch by myself; I have a toddler so this is no small thing. NCounter was recommended by a friend and the menu looked amazing so I went to check it out.  IThey had blueberry pancakes on the menu, something I often crave but rarely find (plain ones with blueberry pie filling don't count - blech), so that was my order, along with turkey sausage and a latte.  The latte away fine, nothing special (I like mine with a darker bean I think), the sausage was good, the pancakes were a disappointment. The blame is not entirely on NCounter - I like thinner pancakes. These were really thick, cakey even. Maybe some people love that, it's just not my thing. The biggest issue I had though was that the maple syrup was not only too small an amount for these crazy gigantic pancakes, but it was not real maple syrup. It was obvious from the texture, more like corn syrup than maple. To put fake syrup on such beautiful pancakes seemed a sacrilege.  I brought over half of them home simply so I could eat them with proper syrup.  Lastly, I had 3 bus boys / servers walk past me while I tried to make eye contact to ask for a to-go container. The 4th finally stopped and even though my plate was nearly full, asked if he could take it for me. When I asked for a container he seemed put out. I got my container, packed up my food and left.  I'll give it another try, there were definitely other things on the menu that appealed to me, but for now, 3 stars.

lHQQe_XVsH2gYbywAXF6dw.text: Great food, great customer service. Bad review though towards who appeared to be the manager talking loudly about how his employee is going to regret only "being with two women". Then he goes on to talk about screwing around with women and because you've been with them one night doesn't mean "you need to talk about their feelings". All in for free love here but your blatant disregard for women- disgusting.

j5UYZ6fwrG_pX4Cvo54vtQ.text: If your looking for a breakfast place with lots of choices, healthy and non healthy this is the place to go! I have been more times than i can count and I have never been disappointed. If you go early in the morning the lines aren't long, and you beat the brunch crowd! Highly recommend.

XLOi7SvyirPT6VuscQy-Xg.text: First time in, was pretty crowded, food was good. Great place to grab breakfast or brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. French toast and turkey avocado sandwich.

2Xr21Bp7FCZJChkAa6_cxA.text: The brunch place of Mill Ncounter is a cute place with exceptional food The menu is very healthy, which sort of makes it stick out from the other Mill Avenue breakfast/lunch options On my last visit I got the breakfast special which was biscuits & gravy I love biscuits & gravy and Ncounter made them pretty good I usually get the almost fried "Farmers Choice" which is pretty good for us carnivores The coffee and cappuccino's are yummy as well They also serve some adult brunch beverages which I like  The line can be long some days but it's worth the wait

L0VFDe0BQm-YTEaYvFFc7w.text: Great breakfast spot!  If you are dropping someone off at Sky Harbor Airport, stop by for breakfast or brunch.  We had about 9 people altogether.  So, instead of having to have everyone stand at a walk up order, my Mom and I ordered what we thought they would like instead.  Here is the list:  Breakfast chorizo burrito-Must have been that good, none left to try.  Croque monsieur actually a madame, with a couple of fried eggs topped a crusty bread.  (My meal)  Eggs Bennie-I had to have a bite of this perfect hollandaise topped creation.  Will be ordering that next time.  Banana foster french toast- the two little cutie pies finished off the sweet topping confection confection of caramelized bananas and whipped cream.  The toast had enough custardy texture inside.  Strawberry and cream french toast- Same French toast as above but covered with strawberries and whipped cream.  Farmer's breakfast-eggs, multi grain toast, bacon (or sausage) and breakfast potatoes.  The coffee, fresh squeezed OJ and choco milk were all good.  Of course, we're looking forward to dining here again!!!

9skC5oO-H3XacgQIdjBj8g.text: Did not care for how the food was prepared. Hot breakfast with a ice cold slice of tomato  :(  it was off putting. Could not taste any alcohol in the Bloody Mary's. It just was not what we expected.

FOE_83GTazWHETGL6WBPtw.text: My last few visits here are been sub-par.  I used to really love this place even though it's always crazy busy.  The last time two times I ordered the "Farmer's Market" the eggs were completely hard-boiled and it was served cold. With how busy they are, I am not sure how that happens. So I switched up to the "House Request" sandwich and there was about a 1/2 lb of cream cheese on it which is not very appetizing. After I scrapped most of it off it wasn't bad, but I had also obliterated the sandwich.  Maybe I have just had a run of bad luck so I'll stop by a few more times when I get time and see if it was just a run of bad luck.

MAlV4-Wooh9-2FW3e4XKVg.text: I really like this concept for a quick breakfast/brunch spot, but the execution wasn't too delicious. If you know me well enough, you'll know my first thought when we walked in was "is there booze???" The answer is yes. I recall seeing your typical breakfast bevies such as mimosas, bellinis, bloody mary's, etc.  So you go in, scope out the menu, order at the counter, and they bring you your meal and beverages. I ordered a simple eggs, potatoes, toast and sausage breakfast, and my friend had an omelette. We had just had brunch at Maizie's the day prior and our first impression was disappointment in the portions of the food, considering the prices were also comparable. Oddly, my sausage, potatoes and sunny side eggs had the same consistency, so that was off for me. They were all a bit soft and soggy. We, of course, enjoyed the mimosa and bellini, but $5 each is a bit high considering they're $3 @ at other places, and Cafe Boa down the block offers unlimited mimosas for a fixed fee with food.   I thought the location was great, and the Sunday brunch crowd was nice. I'm not sure what it will be like when the students come back, but I don't think I would be back to find out.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bellini &amp; Mimosa

83XLaXw8pNtF4I-69T55QA.text: Awesome little place on Mill Ave in Tempe! It was super busy but the line went quick. You go up and order and then seat yourself. Everyone is super attentive. I had the banana foster French toast! It was sweet but very good. I would definitely return!!

I8cHbB-cxfuSMkumxTGQJw.text: I love the service and atmosphere at NCounter, just not a huge fan of anything on the menu besides crazy sweet pancakes which I can't always eat in the morning. I prefer to go to smaller more quaint breakfast places but this is a fun place to go with friends in the morning and is close to campus.

nIVJOJJb0X9ydfLPz2ibMg.text: This is a great place on Mill for brunch.  I popped in in the middle of the week around 1130-12.  Surprisingly it wasn't too crowded with a busy lunch crowd. You walk in and order, they give you a number and bring your food to you.    I had a cup of coffee and a loaded omelet with fruit as the side.  The omelet was deliciously huge and jam packed with ingredients.  The coffee was just average, I mean..it was in one of those metal towers I'm sure it was just old considering it was lunch time.  The place was very open and bright which is always nice for lunch.    I'm looking forward to going back and trying their salad because they all looked great.  Service was fast and friendly, this is a great place to pop into for breakfast or lunch.

C3vgP1Y2bndau7_I4KG6Vw.text: The breakfasts here are pretty good. They have a great selection, and some vegetarian options. One time I came and the potatoes were a little dry, but other than that, all the food has been great.  I really like the cinnamony jam!   However, if you are real coffee lover, to be frank, they don't really know what they're doing. The other day, I asked if they had half-and-half for my coffee, and they said no, they only have (fake) creamer. When I looked surprised, the barista shrugged and said he'd look into it. Today, I ordered a cappuccino, thinking that would be a safe option. But it was like 10 ounces of milk, with no foam! I could hardly taste the espresso shot. Hello: That is a latte, people. I'm sure that they could do better with the coffee, especially if the customer gives them a little guidance... which I recommend.   Also, don't expect great table service, even if you give a normal tip. I was given an empty cup when I asked for water, and had to retrieve the water myself. Seems like it would have been easy to just fill that cup before bringing it all the way over to me, no?

hieQb4zjGbB04jnV_xjq4A.text: Breakfast was good. I came in for a place that sold turkey sausage. I have to say this was the most discussing turkey sausage. I'm wondering if it was actually park now. They said it was turkey. This jam doe the today is GREAT though. I asked for more. It must be apple and honey. Anyway it's great.
