I have to stop before I drool on my computer.

UshyScpnO_RBNGJsAVEsKg.text: This is my favorite breakfast place to go to and I've never had a bad experience till today. And it was 100% the worst food service experience i've ever had!! i came here on a Friday morning during winter break thinking since ASU isn't in session and everyone was home it'd be quick?- nope! It's usually pretty quick here anyway, I come all the time on Sundays when it's super crazy, sometimes I can't even find a table to sit at. Today it wasn't that busy at all but yet I waited for my food for an hour and a half!!!!!! When i noticed a few people who had ordered after me got their food already I went up and asked them to check on my order and explained how long we had been waiting and how people who ordered after us had their food they said "sorry 20 more minutes". 2 girls sitting next to us that had ordered before us didn't have their food either! Clearly someone messed up our orders. I decided to just get a refund and leave. So did the girls next to us! and of course that took like 15 minutes. 2 hours later I'm starving. I'm usually never a person who does something like this but that was horrible.

sF2kElf5fGbApVjAKXERYQ.text: Wow, my roomate took me here when I first moved to Arizona several months ago. I was impressed! The food was awesome, the decor really cute, and they have a cute bar that serves alcoholic beverages. I loved my eggs benedict and would love to return here again sometime soon!  Cheers

U7GDo5V5vVX_XGRtze-k9Q.text: Ate brunch around 11am, almost no wait in line. Food came prompt, we ordered coffee,the iced quad latte is pretty tasty by the way. Had the loaded omelet with tomatoes as the side, and it was easily the best omelet I've had in years. Girlfriend had the Chipotle burrito, minus the spicy sauce which they easily accomodated. TL;DR Short wait outside normal busy times, great food. Come here!

XwKCEk0vv1LFk1_9QdOwdw.text: I haven't even been served yet, in fact my boyfriend is still in line to order, but it is a very busy Sunday morning and yet an employee just brought out a big bowl of ice water for my dog as we wait on the patio. Automatically in love.

Lmccrj39XakK-puQAMSLIw.text: Um, this place is amazing. I mean whew. The cinnamon apple pecan pancakes. Chile. I almost died and went to carb heaven! The seating is first come first served so be sure to grab a table the minute you eye it. Have someone hold down the fort while you get in line to order. Everything on the menu looked scrumptious, and they even care about their presentation! That never happens. Check it out!

929o23TpU5nSO7G4L5I28A.text: The service here is far from good. It's often jam-packed with people so I opted for take-out on my last visit and it took over 30 minutes to get my food even though it was less hectic than usual. The order wasn't ready when I arrived. After about 15 minutes, I asked the girl at the counter if my order was ready yet and she said she wasn't sure. Another 10 minutes I inquired about the bag that had been sitting at the end of the counter the entire time. Turned out it was my order after all. She smirked at me before handing my food and walking away.   But, on my first visit here, I finally tried Croque Monsieur for the first time and it was everything I'd hoped it would be.  5/10 will be back.

LQsKtsNypiiydT0c_GL9-g.text: The croquet monsieur is divine! It's also portioned very well and the sour dough is to-die for! The pricing is a bit high, but the food quality absolutely matches that.  As for the seating: it's OK! You know, it's on Mill Ave (which is so mehhh) so they work with what they were given as far as the building/setup is concerned. It's always so packed BECAUSE the food is so great! If you can find a way to fix the way the seating goes (inside and out) to make it less cramped when it's hopping, you will get a 5 star rating from me. But other than that--kudos! For bringing a nice, divey breakfast joint to a trashy, bar street for ASU and young drunkards alike!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

fC41-sj0w7LEx23K4I3sAQ.text: I had the flu and just needed something in my stomach so I ordered delivery through Postmates, mainly because they had a strawberry smoothie that sounded good. But since it was delivery, I needed to hit the minimum order so I added the grilled cheese as an afterthought. Oh man, let me tell you! The smoothie was good and all but that grilled cheese just might be one of the best I've ever had! I did switch the 12-grain bread for sourdough but it was melty, cheesy, crispy, spicy and ooey gooey all at the same time. Very good and will certainly order from here again!

UCz-82bp5lxTRIXldIwsNg.text: A very good college town greasy diner restaurant.   Not great but very good.  I enjoyed trying some. Re things and was not disappointed.

Lqy8xe8gnQ6MTVEUqtrPiw.text: Do not go here if you are a minority. Two white customers that came in were served right away. I had a to go order, and four different employees were staring at me and refused to help me while I stood at the counter from 10:04 to 10:10. Very snooty, "you don't belong here" vibes. Thank you for the terrible service today.

rYQLPyRpJ5jjxqVJboeWwg.text: This place has fantastic food. Unfortunately, the service is lacking where the food succeeds. The last several times I've been there, the staff have seemed highly stressed and agitated and frankly, have pretty bad attitudes.   I think I'll try a new place for my Saturday and Sunday brunches.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Santa Fe

MMNLKYizIeEXb4K9t36jnA.text: This place is really really delicious. I love that it's so casual and you can order at the counter so everyone can get what ever they want without having to worry about the bill at the end. The ambiance is clean yet comforting, almost diner like but staying classy all the way. But, the highlight is all about the food. I got the farmers market benedict and oh man, it was as good as a lot of brunch benedicts I've had in other parts of the country. It was so very fresh and the potatoes are crisped so crispily and wonderfully. Definitely my favorite place in Tempe.

tFQuRLqr2eRWGYjSTC0MTg.text: Ordered pancakes for my daughter, they were just okay. My sister got a bagel with sausage, egg, and cheese. Equally  mediocre.

m-Hm2tNEEZz_2PlNxyc9ug.text: First visit for us, our order was taken quickly and brought to our table reasonable wait time. I had the hot Jaun; which was large and filling; with the potatoes. My partner has the third avenue tuna(less sprouts and more tuna please) with chips.  Staff is friendly and polite, atmosphere is lively as expected.

Z-bpyJJXrM19kbsFdhsvjw.text: My wife and I were in AZ visiting Tempe. We stopped in for breakfast. My wife ordered a veggie style omelet that came with hash browns. She liked the omelet but the potatoes were very blah. They were not crispy and were under seasoned. My dish was a ham, egg and cheese open faced dish. It was very tasty. Overall it was enjoyable.

IG2JrRMqY3nvyj62vSQyWA.text: A little pricey but great food and service. Thanks for the great time. My husband and I enjoyed it.

w13WXhkPFDsXqpXfaaOD8g.text: I'm get my breakfast to-go here about 2 times a week. The omelettes are fantastic, and they fill you up for hours. I'd recommend this place for sure, just beware, the lines are long for a reason so plan a head.

YV9Yzvnjm5-myHv08Qp1iw.text: This place was crazy busy the Sunday before ASU started classes.  Breakfast was awesome and the portions were decent.  Loaded Omlete was my choice.  My friend had the waffles.  Both were excellent.  The oatmeal looked good too, if you are looking to be healthy.    I will come back.

AiO7WlLGVHqhVn8JW4Nyzw.text: I ordered a salad, which was probably a mistake, as the other brunch options looked scrumptious. My salad was tasty except some of the greens were wilted and brown - a quick appetite killer for me (yay rotting greens!) stick with other options and you'll probably love it. The iced latte was good.

uaax1Ih8WQKz1kjT5Eb4NA.text: got here at 10:45, ordered by 10:50. it's 11:26 and my meter is about to expire. send prayers, i'm out of change, food is not here. update: food was life-changing, parking ticket was not. will eat here again though. it is tempe but i would still recommend walking or riding a bike.

LYDkw2LOSHqZ77GzO_I4EA.text: First visit here! I really enjoyed the iced cafe mocha and the vibe of the whole place. My best friend and I sat outside on the patio and enjoyed the relaxing environment and fun music. We both got their classic benedict, which wasn't too impressive in my opinion. It was just an average benedict. The potatoes were cooked well but lacked seasoning (as did the benedict). Nothing really stood out. 4 stars for the environment/vibe/coffee, plus it's my first visit so I've only tried one thing on the menu. I'd definitely like to come back and try more of their menu to see if other options are more flavorful! Overall, it's a cool little spot in Tempe perfect for sitting and enjoying the lovely morning weather we've been having lately.

LXxikwowj8k2h4k_AKpmqg.text: The loaded omelette and Pecos grill are what my husband and I ordered. Our friend ordered eggs Benedict. She gave her order a three star, we gave ours a four. Our potatoes were warm, not hot.   The flavor of our meals were really good, but it would have been nice to eat a hot meal.   Overall, I would come back, despite the temperature.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Loaded omelette
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pecos grill sandwich

l2Jtrp04ijE-_JW2yJXI8w.text: After my 5k on Saturday 2/13, I went into Ncounter with a friend to enjoy a post-run meal. We snagged a table by the door and after about 10 minutes of eating I watched a homeless man, that was struggling to even walk, slowly make his way to exit the door from using the restroom. Just by looking at him, I could tell he hadn't eaten a good meal in awhile, and sadness just emanated from his eyes. I physically could not sit there and not offer him some of my food, which I would have been throwing out anyways.  I invited him to our table to enjoy some of our leftovers.The manager came by immediately and hovered over our table, while very clearly disrespecting the guest which I had invited to our table. Even going out of his way to criticize the man for apparently "begging for our food." I made a point to ensure him that this was not the case. I then asked him, politely, to retrieve a to-go box and some disposable silverware. He found the smallest box possible, neglected to provide silverware, and basically threw it onto the table without saying a word. The manager of this establishment embarrassed me in front of our guest and I was not going to let that fly. After providing the man with food and finally obtaining silverware, the homeless man went on his way and thanked us profusely.  I then went to the back, near the kitchen, and decided to have a word with the manager in front of his employees. Once again, the manager was disrespectful to me, after I had just spent $30 that morning in his restaurant. He lied to my face - telling me that he is always coming in and begging, which I found hard to believe as he was frightened to even talk to us when I physically had to stop him. I told him that because he had embarrassed me in front of my guest and the entire restaurant, I would now be embarrassing him in front of all of his employees for his atrocious arrogance. I will no longer be stepping foot into this establishment, ever again. The manager is a pity excuse for what it means to run a business, and I feel bad for the employees that have to work under him. It is basic human decency to treat everyone with respect, and I hope this taught him a lesson on humility.  Snooze is a much better alternative, with fantastic staff, and is only about 3 minutes away!

6DX2xWDYItfERUgwsotwXw.text: Great breakfast and brunch options. I came around 11 AM on a Saturday and it was packed. The menu offered typical brunch options but everything that came out of the kitchen looked delicious. My eggs were flavorful and delivered to my table in about 10 minutes. They atmosphere was energetic and feels kind of hipster but not overly so.

joA7aJVRE4HAniaunVwpgA.text: My first visit and I already know I'll be back for more! Ncounter is on the corner of Mill and 3rd. Metered street parking is available, but I used the parking garage farther down 3rd- first hour is free. Large space packed with staggered tables to allow people to walk by, but I found it a little tight, and I'm petite! There's a partition wall/counter that held the soda fountain and other accoutrements, and beyond that, more two- and four-top tables. Lots of light shining through from so many glass windows- love it! Ceiling fans were going full-blast; I couldn't find a table that offered respite from the strong breezes. Ordering food entails lining up at the counter- not my favorite thing to do, but the process went quickly after I decided what to order. Staff was very helpful and took time to double-check ingredients info for me. I ordered the banana walnut pancakes and the Grilled cheese "Melt Down," with ciabatta bread instead of 12-grain (due to allergies). Also ordered an iced mocha. The banana walnut pancakes were delicious, and the pancakes had a nice texture! yelp.com/biz_photos/ncou... The bananas were a tad too ripe for my taste, but not too mushy I couldn't eat them, so I didn't complain. I asked what kind of syrup it came with and was told "artificial syrup," and was offered desert honey, which had great flavor and went well with the pancakes. I liked that the walnuts were plain and not candied. I will have to try other varieties, as I am not looking forward to eating very soft slices of banana here again. The grilled cheese sandwich was exquisite! yelp.com/biz_photos/ncou... Five kinds of cheeses (jack, cheddar, Swiss, American, and cream), jalapenos, and bacon, with tomatoes omitted. Ciabatta was toasted and had great textures (crunch/crusty on the outside and soft underneath). The slices of jalapeno gave this sandwich just enough heat and tang-- I wish I was back at Ncounter having another sandwich just writing about it! The potato chips were good enough to add crunch, but I could've done without. Gives me yet another reason to return- to try other sides! Such great comfort food, I kept two thirds of the sandwich to take home and enjoy later. Mom tried a small portion and ended up eating most of the leftovers! That says a lot-- the sandwich kept well AND Mom enjoyed it, and it's hard to impress her with anything, especially with leftovers!! The iced mocha was just OK. A little watered down. Hope I have better luck with other beverages next time, for there will be a next time... Mom has already requested more of the "Melt Down" for takeout. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grilled Cheese &#34;Melt Down,&#34; with ciabatta bread instead of 12 multi-grain.
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Banana walnut pancakes minus powdered sugar and &#34;artificial syrup.&#34;
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Iced cafe mocha, either $4, or $4.50...

p9-ma1e-iGTDQ-0pszYbGw.text: Order the Eggs  Benedict  !! I've lived by Mill Ave for the past 4 years and I am an avid egg Benedict lover. I make hollandaise a lot at home and I order eggs Benedict at every single breakfast place I go to and over the past 4 years, even in other states, I've never found anything that quite compares to NCounter's Eggs Benedict. I am so thrilled that they decided to open two other locations in Phoenix this year because we need more Ncounter in our lives. Don't forget to order through postmates or another food app. It also helps to call in your order for pick up since the line and wait time can be a lot. Their location is small but only because the crowd is so huge in comparison. I swear by this place and spend most of my money on NCounter. You won't regret it!

ksOSnvv-pxQeMfpDcB8dKw.text: This was our 2nd stop of the Tempe Brunch Crawl. It was extremely busy, and there was nowhere to sit inside. It's cafeteria style, so you go up to the counter to order, and they give you a number to take. We ordered the special that they had for the Crawl, and it was a delightful breakfast burrito, with a tasty mulemosa. Gotta love that ginger beer! They made a good effort with the portion size. I will have to go back and see what else they have to offer. So far, so good.

SPZj9qnQ-tPj1F5ff6Jwog.text: This is a great little spot for easy dining. Our entrees were great. The cinnamon roll was missing that gooey sweet flavor and icing...wouldn't get again but would try another pastry.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast Tacos, Breakfast Burrito, Cinnamon Roll

4-FYV7Lh61DJAqE-Z8viQg.text: The daily jam used to be good when it was Encounter but the food quality has gone down horribly. The only reason I'm giving them two stars is the menu is the same but by no means does it compare. I got the Peppered Parmesan chicken salad and the chicken used to be nicely diced up on top now the salad's just slopped together. My tomatoes had mold on them the only positive was they give you a large helping of cashews on top!! I got the chicken poblano soup and it was cold and way too thick like they tried to scrape what ever was left in the pot to fill a cup! So sad that Encounter sold out and became a chain!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mold on tomatoes from peppered parmesan chicken salad

x2C9SuLgzglctCjYMiM-CQ.text: This was a fantastic breakfast experience.  My girlfriend and I are in Tempe visiting from Southern California for the Innings Festival.    We had finished a hike up "A" Mountain and Daily Jam is right on the way back to our hotel.    The staff greeted us warmly and took our order, we sat down and waited.   I ordered the French Toast with Bananas foster a side of eggs and side of grilled sausage.  My girlfriend ordered the sliced pear omelette and the potatoes along with a Mezcal Mary.  My French toast was great.  Nice crust with a soft cooked middle and the bananas were perfectly ripe.  The eggs were scrambled well and tasted like eggs as opposed to other restaurants where they almost taste like some egg product.   The grilled sausage was cooked perfectly and had a nice snap when you bit into it.   I also had my girlfriends potatoes as she's keto/low carb.  They were well crisped and had a perfect texture.    I am very happy with this visit and would highly recommend anyone give Daily Jam a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bananas foster French toast, scrambled eggs and sausage.
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu

dwL12iUbfFJIskzVnGIj0w.text: This place is awesome! Good food! Very friendly staff, and the parking isn't horrible. It's on Mill Ave and the asthetics are very fresh and clean.

B1Xc8B9D4kBdPC9arI9ThA.text: We found ourselves in Tempe looking for lunch or a late breakfast and Ncounter popped up on a search.  You order at the counter and they bring you the food.  It was very good.  My wife had The Pear Omelet and loved it.  I saw they had a Croque Monsieur, which I rarely pass up, and I also loved my meal.  We would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Croque Monsieur
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Pear
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sweets

cAl1Pbe9I692caIvU-Fh9g.text: My friend showed me around the area and we chose this place for brunch. I ordered the nattie bomb, wow so amazing! I loved the grain bread that it came on and the pasta salad was great, I think it had pesto in it. The sundried tomato mayo complimented the sandwich well. Huge portions. Great place, would definitely recommend any of the sandwiches.

bHnfpag2fUNM5shdkSUQBg.text: Quick, kinda trying-to-be-cool breakfast and lunch place. I had the killer breakfast sandwich- I thought the Gorgonzola cheese sounded fun but honestly it didn't taste very good and I would not order it again. Potatoes were meh. I enjoyed the bite I tried of the natie bomb lunch sandwich more.  Cool fact about this place is they have cartel coffee, espresso and cold brew. I love cartel cold brew. The brewed passion tea was also delicious.  Mimosa was made with fresh oj and was great size. Screwdriver is also huge and gets two hair-of-the-dog thumbs up.  You order at the front and pick a table. If you want more drinks you have to go back up to the bar get make another purchase.  In summary the 3 stars I devoted to Ncounter are awarded for the beverage game, which was strong. Not my favorite brunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Natie bomb lunch sandwich
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Killer breakfast sandwich

XKhMN8QV0_ada-wkMb-ArA.text: I live for a great breakfast, and this spot didn't disappoint! Great menu... the Hot Juan omelette came with crispy grilled potatoes, both were hot, fresh, & tasty. However, the highlight was their Red Velvet Waffles, hot & fluffy with cream cheese icing and a side of maple syrup... I'm hooked!

PU_yneK_Sat5luiWwW2gDw.text: We were staying nearby and were looking for a nice place to grab brunch. This place came up on a few lists and had very good reviews so we headed over to give it a try.  In hind sight we clearly should have read up more on this place. We were looking forward to being served a nice brunch. This place, however, is the type you order at the counter. That is not necessarily a bad thing, but it is not what I want for brunch.  Given the reviews I feared a long line. We lucked out though and the line was quite short. It was still busy so the only open tables were outside. While the seats were mostly shaded it was still far too hot to enjoy it.  I ordered the Hot Juan. Our food came out fairly quickly after that. The Hot Juan is an omelette with chorizo, green pepper, onion, jalapenos, cheese and salsa. The omelette was good sized. There is enough to fill you up without overdoing it. The flavors were solid. The vegetable flavors came through well, but I would have liked more flavor from the chorizo.  The omelette comes with a side of fried potatoes. They were crispy and did the job.  For me this is a good option for a casual breakfast or lunch. It is not a good option for me if I want to sit down and enjoy brunch.

fRsYziutJGEiIBuSDDZ6Nw.text: The outside staff were great and so friendly. I ordered the veg omelette which comes with grilled potatoes. Enjoyed eating the potatoes but the omelette wasn't cooked probably and mushrooms were frozen. I was sad cuz the omelette had a big portion and its the main part of the plate. The omelette was hideous, watery and looked unpleasant. The chef lowered his standards on the plate and provided shittiest omelette ever! #Humble_Perspective!

JI8uEwtoC8nMFVz9o8hDJg.text: If you want someplace nice to have breakfast, this is the place to go. Even though it was constantly packed, there never seemed to be a lack of tables to sit at. Ordering was fairly fast, as was the time it took for the food to come out. Speaking of which, their burritos tasted incredible and left you feeling very full. I would 100% come back again

O84pdbz6AouLz8Oz2Ll_wA.text: Liked the amazing ability of Ncounter to handle a Saturday rush of triathletes before the 140.6 race in November. Ncounter was one of say 20 restaurants honoring a $25 off coupon, so Ncounter had loads of customers at say 8:30 AM on a Saturday. They had adequate cheerful staff and lots of interesting choices, including vegetarian options. They took good care of my 91 year old mother in law, who is blind and showed up in a wheel chair. Veggie omelette was a winner, as were blueberry pancakes, and steel cut oats with berries. Things ran like clockwork. Sorry to say not many places could operate so smoothly with such an influx of customers. Thankfully, everything was prompt, as ordered, and quite tasty. Orange juice tasted fresh squeezed. Cost was say $30 for 3 before tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

4Gio6Za2gkwCI0o9oMz7nQ.text: My coworkers and I decided to order from this place and bring it back to work to eat. I ordered chilaquiles which was advertised on the menu to be lightly fried tortillas and offered to add chorizo or chicken for two dollars more, so $11. When I received my food it was two eggs, unfried corn tortillas and a side of spring mix salad which was warmed from sitting in the same container. No chicken in sight. Salad should never ever be served with Mexican eggs and tortilla!!! Very disappointed and the flavor was not good. Will not be ordering from them again.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

2c9U7ue8nKc0HyAPY3Hz6A.text: Checked out the Scottsdale location this morning.  Same great food!  Husband had Morning Glory omelet  And I the Red Velvet Waffles which is my favorite!  Have been looking forward to them for a week!  I really like the flavor, lightness, and flavor.  I'll be dropping by more frequently as I have Dr in the area, so it's perfectly located for me.  I didn't pay close attention to whether the patio is dog friendly at this location actually I didn't even notice if they have a patio today lol !

C-IEK7VfGOTGGde2fdLPhw.text: I really liked this place when it was encounter.  Since the take over, the food is not consistent.  The menu is the same and I typically get the Chipotle Egg Burrito.  One day had no avocado, another time was almost all bacon and no eggs, and another time potatoes were all burnt.  I also really like their chopped salad- the other day it had like 10 pieces of lettuce.  I think this place is 5 stars capable if the kitchen can produce the menu items consistently- seems to be no standard.

gpMqIyNpjBeriams1vkANw.text: Long line late Sunday morning but it moves quickly.  Great brunch.  Very good prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Classic Eggs Benedict with Bloody Mary &amp; Velvet Waffles

Mc5k7D4LuzBvG3Eyq3dLlA.text: Ncounter is the hip and happening place to be at lunchtime on Mill Ave.   I had the chance to try this place a few weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised by the vast options on their menu and the quality of food. Everything on the menu looked enticing, but I ended up going with the bacon, lettuce, tomato and avocado sandwich with a side salad. I placed my order and took my number to the table to wait for my yummy lunch to arrive. Once it finally did (it did take a while but they were slammed due to popular demand) my tastebuds jumped for joy with the flavors of a regular blt mixed with the egg salad (who would have thought?!?). The mixed green salad was nothing special, but it didn't need to be. Next time I won't be so healthy and I'll go with chips or something fried! Other menu items I'll be back to try will be their breakfasts...oh my goodness they sounded good.   The environment at Ncounter is very busy, but it isn't overwhelming. Despite it being crowded they have a good system so that the ordering line goes quickly, there are clean tables and seats available for everyone, and the process is comfortable for all who walk in the door. The staff is very friendly and all seemed to be working hard to make everything run like clockwork.   Ncounter is a top notch lunch or breakfast spot for anyone who wants a solid meal (with both inside he box and outside the box flavors) at a reasonable price. If you are hungry on Mill Ave give them a whirl!

TNOee5iwT4s1HHxQ1_xRKA.text: Had a weekend getaway to Phoenix and found this fabulous breakfast gem. Small college location focused on college kids as their primary customer. The food was great. Unique breakfast combos, quality food and reasonably priced. We had The Don Juan omelette which had jalapenos and salsa, short stack of fluffy pancakes, banana waffles and avocado toast.  All were good portions and extremely tasty. A fun little breakfast location only blocks away from  the ASU campus.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Avocado toast with bacon
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Don Juan omelet with potatoes
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Banana waffles

XDUjkbu3fBbw3CMEN4tIQA.text: My group of four went to NCounter for brunch on Saturday. I had the Bono sandwich, which also comes with a side salad. It was extremely delicious. The others had French toast and omelettes, and they liked their meals very much.  The service and ambiance are great. The only downside is that it can feel a bit cramped inside.

gXNfXxyVpZQWiOUHXvIAMg.text: It's good - good atmosphere, good food and drink, good prices. It gets very crowded on the weekends, so it does take some time from ordering at the counter, until your food gets brought out to your table.  It's nice and clean (it's on the upscale/trendy side for a breakfast spot), plenty of seating, indoors and out, and it's on Mill so it's right in the middle of the action. I would recommend it to friends.

ljONZA_kqTgozPCcGFq7zQ.text: I've eaten here a couple of times and love this place! Fresh food, quick service, clean and cool casual atmosphere. I would recommend the "killer" sandwich and the egg white omelette with avocado. And it's at the light rail stop. :)

oCO7qiMHZhQmB8taa-u_xg.text: I've been a loyal fan of this place's sister location (TC Egginton's) for many years so I can't help but be a little in love. I'm not so much of a fan on the location itself as it's a little inconvenient for me so I don't get out often. The menu is where it's at for me. The food is creative and done well.

Pqvtj86nMKjIp5VqgDZ0MQ.text: Delicious place to grab salads or sandwiches on mill ave! The kale salad and chopped salad are amazing. Service is quick and place is clean. Highly recommend you go if you want a lighter and healthier option than most of the mill ave restaurant choices.

3nmH51_B0TfeeQ8bA4EyeA.text: It was OK.  My boyfriend enjoyed his sandwich and soup, so at least there's that. I had the strawberries & cream french toast...it was pretty cold. I'd give it a second shot for the lunch fare. The location is nice and the decor was cute. The food was just nothing to write home about.

4Qu50dDuTbWOgfhDnzlVjg.text: I really like that Mill has another option for the working crowd nearby. With our office down the street, I was growing pretty tired of the uber college pub-deli-pizza routine, in fact I drive away from this areas most days. But NCounter is a nice addition: cool space and a much needed revival on this corner. The remodel was done beautifully and the place gets so much more traffic now than it ever did with a crepe and coffee shop. Kudos to opening something comfortable enough to sit down in but quick enough for take out.  The food has been decent in my experience. Having ordered several meatless entrees from both the breakfast and lunch menus, my consensus is that the quality and creativity is pretty much what I'd expect from any Mill Ave establishment. Not knock-your-socks-off, but much better than drive thru. The presence of some healthy options is appealing. The egg white omelette was ok, but relatively flavorless even with tomato, peppers (still raw), avocado and cilantro. I usually get the Portobello sandwhich veganized with no cheese or mayo, but they've messed up my order a few times for take out, meaning I don't realize the cheese is on there until I've walked back to the office. I do wish the counter staff would pay a little more attention when customers order, but they aren't rude.  Can't say I'm a regular, but it's good to have a decent nearby option that's not burgers and fries. I do love scheduling "meetings" here just to get out of the office.

e6AIMDM7ZI4MVJXcqYlEag.text: Busy restaurant but the long line to order went thru really fast. Everything I saw come out looked amazing and the smells very even better! Loved gluten free waffles and yogurt with fresh fruit and granola. Looking forward to next time!!

N3LTmcI1SAau1pgK4dnQVg.text: Delicious breakfast food! I love how they have sriracha!!! That's essential for breakfast foods in my opinion! They also have fresh OJ. Will get that next time. Their pumpkin spice latte was ok.

o1kbpDM2n5A5EZmyNNHpqQ.text: Pretty delicious and fresh. Modern atmosphere and delicious breakfast. I love the iced mocha and the tasty eggs with avocados,  english muffins, and spinach. They provide siracha sauce too! Mmmm  The only problem I had was that ordering area was two crowded and disorganized. It was hard to squeeze past people after I ordered.

df2uUZdlycaba8j070cmsw.text: Glorified Denny's is all this place is. This place used to be good but their food quality seems to have diminished. The portobello sandwich should be the spinach mayo sandwich on day old bread. Spinach and mayo being the cheapest ingredients, they def overload it and then skimp on the mushroom & artichoke. Won't be going back for anything except maybe coffee.

LHH_6BNuJUw29hPr1V-EZQ.text: Breakfast!!!    It was crazy busy the morning me and another Yelper went to NCounter.  Long line so I was told to order at the bar, still a long wait, actually I think it was longer...therefore just stay in the line.    I could've eaten the french toast AND Ncounter's Farmer's Market bene (2 eggs poached, spinach, tomato, avocado, hollandaise sauce and potatoes). Delicious!  The Farmer's Market bene that is!  I will have to go back for the french toast.  I also had ordered a mimosa.  More alcohol please next time.

NPE-ysSUWj5P2hwK7Xbjzg.text: I came here with a friend visiting from out of town in March (group of about 6).  I got the Natie Bomb which is basically a twist on a traditional turkey bacon sandwich.  The sandwich and side salad were beyond my expectations for this place (which was hard to do since I already had high hopes).   The place was a little corky and unique.  It was pretty busy so we had to sit outside.  Living in AZ, most know this can kill an experience.  NCounter had fans and misters outside so it was actually really nice.  The only downside is it took a little long for the food considering it was all pretty much sandwiches we ordered, but it was worth the wait.  I would recommend this place in a HEART BEAT!  Keep in mind when going, it is only open until 3:00 pm.

pL_NCm9NZZ5Zo8b0dz2Pww.text: the bananas foster was delicious!!! yummmm And if you don't want something sweet the Hot Juan Omlete and  the Loaded Omlete was absolutely delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yummmmmmmmmmmmm!

UiWrnf5R5bWJgRd8EliYQQ.text: A word of advice to those eating in the Tempe area: avoid restaurants filled with trendy vibes, trendy college students, and 40-somethings dressing 20-something to relive their trendy years. Do I sound petty? Perhaps. But I stand by that statement and Ncounter is probably the best proof I can display to fulfill my words.  Aesthetically, Ncounter appears to be your standard wannabee "coffee center of intellect." Sepia toned pictures of windmills straight out of the Wizard of Oz, run-of-the-mill bright wood tables, a "bar," and a hand full of the self-proclaimed elite trend monkeys I just love so much to hate. What a bore.   Now being my first, and hopefully last, visit to Ncounter both myself and the person I came with were slightly taken back by the new menu. Standing a few feet away from the actual ordering area we spent at least five or so minutes pondering upon what to eat. Everything sounded so appealing and utterly delicious! Every breakfast classic from eggs benedict (shortened to "bene's" ugh...) to your standard omelette had enough variations available to please nearly any palette. Already in the mood for an omelette, I gravitated towards an item entitled the "Hot Juan." Chorizo, salsa, jalapenos, cheese, peppers, and onions; sounds wonderful does it not? My breakfast mate decided upon a somewhat similar option, "Huevos n' Chorizo." Essentially the same dish only the eggs are served sunny side rather than in omelette form. We also ordered a side of sourdough toast and a coffee to share. **The coffee here is self serve, something I have not before seen in a restaurant. A great idea I wish more establishments would catch on to.**  Before I get into the actual food itself I want to discuss the vibe and service of Ncounter. The place is infested with what could possibly be the rudest, most self-absorbed, trendy, soul wretched, basic, and nasty clientele and staff on Earth. Everyone from the man behind the ordering counter to the bus boys to the gathering of Pitchfork Media fans (some of them were actually wearing the logo on their clothes...) exuded a vile aura of judgement. Sneering and sneakily nodding at the apparently entertaining crowd around them, each and every individual resembled a cartoon character created to fill the world with angst and elitism. I could not help but feel like an onlooker of a real life Breakfast Club. Clashing cliques of staff and customers. Is this a restaurant or high school? Also really did not appreciate my server essentially tossing my plate of food on the table and scurrying away without a word.   Okay so you get the point, the place is hipster hell. Or maybe I'm just being dramatic. I imagine everyone will have different opinion on the matter. Fortunately, I actually do have something both undeniable AND negative to spew about Ncounter. The food resembled that of a musty and fly ridden diner I once ate at in a nightmare I had years ago. In fact, it was so insultingly putrid and revolting I refuse to actually go in depth. So instead here is a short list of single words that describe the slop I was served: 1. Cold 2. Meatless 3. Pace (yes, like the salsa brand) 4. Floppy 5. Speechless   Ncounter serves no purpose for a foodie, which is weird because I seem to have developed a love-hate relationship with the dump over the course of writing this review. I absolutely LOVE and ADORE the fact that Ncounter is essentially the restaurant equivalent to an Old-Western brothel. The over-hyped food and foul attitude of the place keeps trendy people out of my sight much like cheap whiskey and prostitutes herded the mongrel masses of times past into a playpen of their own filthy ways. I absolutely HATE everything else about it.   In case you didn't pick this up on your own, the ever increasing anger in the tone of my review really just represents EXACTLY how my experience played out... Also I feel ashamed I actually devoted so much emotion and time into writing about Ncounter. God, even the name is terrible isn't?

2U5x3OnWCOH2OQEMC2Xi5Q.text: Thank you Yelp for leading us to this little gem of a place on Mill Ave. From the quality of the food, the friendliness of the staff, to the ambiance, this place is fantastic! Will definitely be back!

Od-Uabyq1cLQxJgOc6d4wQ.text: I'm a frequent visitor, here. At this point, I don't know if my body could even function without their Strawberry-Banana smoothie at least two times a week. It tastes like it was blended with angel powder. The unicorn of smoothies.

OvhVtIMtdK2x35ou4zvs6Q.text: Loaded omelet (with nom nom potatoes) and strawberry banana smoothie - delicious.    Order at the counter and then sit outside or inside.  Clean establishment.

5bWckP68bsiaZxpsd4tDFA.text: Great food, service, & atmosphere! I love their Farmers Market Benedict, with avocado and breakfast potatoes, yum! They have a pet friendly patio but it is fast casual so you have to order at the counter, luckily they have a bar outside you can order food from too!

y1EgtUuKi-ymCk41KJYk6g.text: This is my fav breakfast place on Mill avenue. High quality fresh food.

IpgLp6XivmJ40IHx5xkyVg.text: Honestly this place is sooo good. You order at the counter and then sit and wait for your food to be brought to you. I got the strawberry and whip waffles, plain pancakes, and the breakfast sandwich with the cream cheese and olive spread (I forgot the name of it) and I think I can eat those things every morning for the rest of my life. The potatoes that come with the breakfast sandwiches are AMAZING. The waffles are the best waffles I've ever had. They're light and fluffy. The pancakes were really good too. The staff is very friendly as well which is always a plus.

RfOPMb2ai1HygUv7UpblIw.text: 5 stars because this is the best omelette I have ever eaten! I had the Pear, which is full of bacon, pears, almonds, and a mad amount of cheese! Comes with a side- all for $9. Ncounter lives up to its already amazing reviews. Keep it up guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. I had the rye toast as my side, and grabbed an iced latte as well.

iGcAkEetfp-wtSlhvMrpPQ.text: So good! Came here for brunch/lunch with a large group. Patio seating was nice! Split the kale salad which was really good (chicken, cranberries, edamame, tomatoes and sliced almonds with a light lemon dressing) and the pecos sandwich (chicken cheese and peppers) both were so good! Good for groups and some people ordered breakfast and really liked it. Would definitely Go back here and next time get a mimosa!

ZzdZNyfyBySvPbjvEEa9hQ.text: Best breakfast place in Tempe! The location right next to the Mill ave. light rail station makes it easily accessible to anyone coming from either the west or east valley. Make use of the light rail if you can park a couple stops away as parking is limited and almost always metered since it's downtown Tempe. There's always a good sized crowd no matter which day you go. The food options are plenty as they have something for everyone and is inexpensive as well. I often go for their omelette (Loaded is a favorite) with potatoes on the side. Their sandwiches are delicious as well. Nom nom nom.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Loaded omelette with potatoes!

v4RB8Ov-X7hxcKwNX1DyiA.text: Easily one of my favorite breakfast places in Tempe! It comes across as high-end, but casual at the same time. Whether you're a sweets for breakfast person, or are more a fan of the savory omelet, eggs benedict, biscuits and gravy side of the aisle, Ncounter does it all very well. They also offer a variety of well-done breakfast cocktails like mimosa, greyhounds, and bloody marys. So far I have not been disappointed by anything I've tried here.  The omelets I've had here have been incredibly fresh, all the ingredients certainly chopped/cooked on the spot. They have so many options when it comes to additions that I'm certain anyone can find something they'll like. Ncounter can get pretty creative, I personally appreciate the Greek and pear omelets, as well as the variety of eggs benedict combinations.  I've also tried the french toast and it was very fluffy, perfectly fried. Also, the french toast was huge portion-wise. I'm not sure how they do it, if they just have giant loaves of homemade bread or what but it works.  Ncounter is upscale on the inside, but carries a laid-back vibe. You order at the counter, are given a number, and its up to you to find a table to have your food delivered to. This can be one of the only downsides (though a good problem for them to have) is that finding a table on a weekend can be pretty challenging. They do have misters on the patio but in the heat of summer they only help so much.   Overall, Ncounter is great place for breakfast/brunch on the weekend, especially with their extensive cocktail selection if you're into that. For what you get, it's not much more expensive than any other decent breakfast place in town however I don't see it being the best place for families/kids. Breakfast is going to run you $10 per person, $15ish if you get a mimosa or something like that but I can sincerely say the quality is well worth it, you won't be disappointed. Get there early enough to hunt down a decent table and you're golden. I wouldn't recommend the patio after 10/11 in the summer.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Loaded omelet

NhwF65kg8k_iGy0Rgk4mMQ.text: The food was pretty good. I had a breakfast burrito and my girlfriend had a Benedict. The only problem I had was the front counter customer service. It's almost as if being nice was a strain on their well being. Also management should probably tell them to smile more cause frowning at your guests makes them feel unwelcome. They also should explain that greeting and helping people when they approach the counter would be helpful so I know this place actually wants my business. If not that's okay there's plenty other breakfast places like first watch and snooze who can overcharge for breakfast but at least give amazing customer service. Hope this helps. Also whoever brews their coffee should take a lesson in how much water to actually add. If I'm paying $3 for a coffee it should be enjoyable not taste like dirty water. Hope this helps management to fix the problems and hope this helps other people make a good decision when getting breakfast. The blonde lady who works at the front counter really needs a review on customer service. If she's too good to help anybody then she doesn't really need the job, does she?

wvjQa-RL2FLFfOgf-cE9Fg.text: I had the eggs Benedict, which may have been the best I've ever had!! I'm not normally a huge fan of potatoes, but there's are the best, I am addicted! I also had the sunrise smoothie, and it tastes a lot like a soft sherbet ice cream, so if you're into that-- go for it.   Overall, I loved the experience! My only suggestion would be to make it less difficult to find napkins :( I had to ask a bartender for some because there were none anywhere where customers could get them.

Q0-ZBCUVEy381qA_Qa1wJg.text: Just had a portobelloni sandwich aka mushroom sandwich with blueberry blast smoothy . The sandwich was amazing (since I am a mushroom fan) and the smoothy was good but a little stingy (I expected a smother flavor since it had yogurt in it. My combination of the two wasn't a great one. Nevertheless, individually each item was amazing.  The restaurant location and capacity are above average . The patio seatings are good.My order took 10 minutes to be ready. They would certainly use improvement on the calling for order method. Staff was both helpful and friendly. Overall great place for breakfast and I would definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. All mine , evil laugh

Uk4J6dIHk_l961BPw5bJ6g.text: They make a damn good grilled cheese!  How can you hate bacon, tomato, jalapeno and I don't know how many different  cheeses? It could have been grilled a bit more to make the bread more crunchy.   They have a nice patio area, a coffee/smoothie bar, baked goods, and the breakfast coming to the other tables looked YUMMY!

-VZ-9wJ0rEQ7wZKVFJzVRw.text: Love this place. Informal style you order at a register and they deliver it to your table - so you're getting high quality brunch but saving a few bucks. Everything is great. I loved my omelette. Bloody Mary's are great here too.

FkIOc0MG4e2qSsp3k3nIMA.text: We have been waiting for our food for over 90 mins! The table next to us turned 2 times. While the food looks good, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone unless you are ok wasting half a day to get a waffle.

V-am-NmenO4piSFs9Y-Tdg.text: "The Killer" sandwich well crafted. The Thyme was a nice touch.   Chipoltle egg burrito left much to be desired.  The flavors, I assume would all mesh well, if they were all detectable, which they werent. Well concieved as an idea, poorly executed in the kitchen.   The potatoes werent great either. Obviously re heated enough to sap the smaller pieces of all moisture leaving them hard. But I didnt have to salt them, which is unusually pleasant.   The chocolate chip cookie brittle.   The style of dining (counter service with expo and bused tables) left me focused on the food. I call this the reverse Dennys plan. Good food, meager service.    In short, $30 bfast for 2 when the majority of the dishes are not well executed was dissapointing. We will try again, but not soon.

Trg0lrqIzozJY20AZQNNdw.text: Wanted to find a good breakfast place along the light rail. FOUND IT! A fast causal breakfast with a fine dining feel. Nice happy employees, clean and sunny environment. I got the eggs Benedict (hard to make perfect but it was good) $8.5 my daughter had the pancakes with blueberries and REAL CREAM. Best pancakes and value. $6.5 Hubby had waffles with strawberries and real cream $6.5 Then we tried the hulk smoothie. The smoothie was mostly just ice so wasn't impressed by that 5$ So fair prices for a nice breakfast experience.

Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Waffles with strawberry and real cream
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict with potatoes, YUM!

USd9WKkxPE4709oyBQ6mUA.text: Ok, 3rd visit and no omelet today.  I had a breakfast sandwich. .  Just ok.  I still like the food and it was soooooooo busy this am.  Lots of activity!  I am on a mission now to visit here til I have tried the whole menu!!!!  3 down many many more to go.

popvr-JvT1VxNgUN4VL8fw.text: We used to like this place when mimosas and bloody mary's were $5, now they are $8 and $9 respectivly and served in plastic glasses, yikes!! The garnish on the bloody was a lime, no celery, olive or asparagus ! There is a frozen rose for $9. as well. Really? The cheap drinks were the reason we were willing to put up with the counter ordering system, which is dumb because there are 10 servers milling around, why not just take orders? It's not formal enough to take out of town guests, but not cheap either. We enjoyed the food last time, but didn't stay this time because of the hefty drink prices in plastic cups. The bar and service staff was very friendly and inviting, so if you don't want to get your drink on, go here!!!!

kn-HlNw_1Tezrw5JfroMSg.text: This place is delicious. It's located super close to the university so lots of college students come here. It's generally super crowded but the lines go through fairly quickly and the food comes out quickly as well. I'm vegetarian so I always grab the Farmer's Benedict with no meat and I absolutely love it. One of my favorite breakfast places in Arizona, especially Tempe. Highly recommended!

O079sqdmVnfD1pOBVhozXA.text: The chocolate chip pancakes were delicious!  I've had the "farmers market" with eggs cooked over hard, avocado, tomato, spinach, hollandaise & potatoes etc., before and it is excellent too. A 1/2 and 1/2 combination of these two meals would be perfect!!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

rPjnXQPwszVlAFieuQnstg.text: While the brunch market is starting to become quite saturated, Ncounter definitely has a very strong leg up on the others. I came there at 11:30 A.M. on a Sunday (so certainly in the middle of the brunch rush). Despite that, I received service that was superior, genuine and speedy. More importantly, the food that I ordered (morning glory omelette with a side of fruit) was delectable (I don't get omelettes too often because they tend to be bland, but this is easily the best omelette that I have had), generously seasoned and loaded with fresh avocado, tomato and onion. In addition, the fruit was certainly more than just an afterthought with a thoughtful mix of grapes, melons and pineapple (and no cheap fillers either). While it may be difficult to make a brunch decision with all of the available options, Ncounter has plenty of options for anyone that is guaranteed to be very enjoyable

bSMXBBWtsWv8mHGRMXZ8wg.text: Stopped in for breakfast.... Yikes! Fast pace order line...OK. Find a table...OK. Put your number/locator thingy on the table... OK. Waited for 42 mins....not ok! The servers or runners where doing just that ...running around trying to locate where whoever was sitting. Drinks showed up around the 15 min mark. It was just orange juice. Food...well .....the eggs were cold but the toast was warm ..a total sat under a heat lamp move till it was recognized as "oh ,why isn't this order out yet" should have been followed by a redo and manager  walk out explanation.  Dunkin Doughnuts next time !

FKjuR-VecRYt57gFefZeIQ.text: Wow. Just exactly what you want in a breakfast place.  Downtown  Quick  Easy  Good People Watching

UtBCFjxsGXYSSEfofvxhfA.text: I landed into Phoenix Sky Harbor at 7am and told my friend I needed 2 things: breakfast and grapefruit juice. She took us here immediately.  We ordered an array of breakfast foods: breakfast tacos, red velvet waffles, BYO sandwich, grapefruit juice and a green smoothie. The grapefruit juice was just what I needed.. the breakfast tacos were vegetarian but still delicious and didn't give you a groggy feeling after. The red velvet waffles were delicious and not too sweet. The BYO sandwich and the side of potatoes were so bomb that we ended up ordering another side of potatoes. The restaurant was clean the girl cashier who took our order was super sweet! I'll come here for breakfast again!

zweA5Ii7I3N9UR8zjHD8nw.text: Rebranded from nCounter.  I think the concept has taken a massive step back from where they were.  The previous different take on ManCakes was great.  But going to the hoity toity French cafe vibe really doesn't fit for them as they have not trotted out the same customer service.  But here's the thing with that cafe style culture...there is no coffee menu on the wall, there is here.  But when you go to a cafe like that they can churn out amazing cappucinos and lattes with one barista.   The food was decent.  I do like the croque madame, but overall it was just ok when you combine the speed at which they took orders (slow).

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

kPwmv-lhAARt--XN-r-xKA.text: A friend ordered the chipotle egg burrito and I tried a little bit of it. I thought that it tasted good, but what I really liked was the classic egg Benedict. I really like how they were able to cook the egg Benedict so well. I just wish I had asked for it to be cooked over-medium. The middle of the eggs were runny just as they should be. The hollandaise sauce was good too. The potato bits left a little to be desired. They seemed to be hollow on the inside. I prefer my potatoes bits to be slightly crispy on the outside with a fluffy, mealy interior.   When I arrived, the restaurant was busy. As I sat there, the restaurant became packed. I'm glad they were able to get my food out without me having to wait too long.   They had an area for condiments and drinks on the side. I was surprised by how many condiments they offered. Overall, the classic egg Benedict was tasty, but the potato bits left something to be desired.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chipotle egg burrito
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Classic egg Benedict

9TvKLlwnZExRFBDxUm-A-A.text: We witness a really awkward encounter at what was formerly NCounter...now the Daily Jam. The family sitting next to us, had a daughter that hadn't finished her meal. When the server came by, the dad mentioned that the food wasn't sitting well with his daughter's stomach. The server kindly offered to bring her something else and said she would stop by when the daughter was out of the restroom to get her order. Later, the manager stopped by...the manager was completely hostile towards the family. She questioned why the daughter "ate all of the food" and wanted more food and why she wanted to eat more if her stomach hurts. It was completely inappropriate and rude to the teen and her dad. They ultimately said never mind and that they would leave. Also, the girl hasn't eaten much of the dish and the server offered to bring a new dish! It was a loud confrontation that left us, one table over, feeling uncomfortable.   Also the food was blah, very mediocre. Chai tea was good. Skip this place. There are bunch of better places for brunch!

eUiQVSSe82hGsurtwUNE5A.text: Cute but very crowded spot for brunch! Order at the counter and they deliver at your table. The place is on the smaller side and definitely was PACKED on a Saturday morning. Didn't help that int was the middle of summer and outside seating was not appealing. However despite the seating situation, found a spot outside in the shade (and way more quiet). Had an omelet with bacon, tomato and cheese. And despite the food not looking fancy or anything, it was pretty good. Had a mimosa with that. Overall I liked the food. Next time avoid summer time and go earlier or later when its less crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

SSjAdEG014w1lx41UDZnrQ.text: Came here for brunch and was not disappointed! The staff were all incredibly friendly and despite how busy it was, they did a great job managing the chaos and getting food out in a timely manner. Something interesting about this restaurant is that your order at a counter and then they bring your food to you, which is not what I was expecting at a brunch place but it worked! I had the Farmer's Market Benedict and absolutely loved the hollandaise sauce and the potatoes on the side were really good - perfectly crispy on the outside. They also serve Press brand coffee, which is a great local favorite. I'm definitely looking forward to the next time I can stop in! If you can be lucky enough to snag a table inside on a hot day, it's a great brunch stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Farmer&#39;s Market Benedict

8lOHiTyHCCazqL0ho67sYQ.text: Really solid breakfast place! The service was very speedy and there are a lot of options to choose from. I got the farmers Benedict and it tasted great especially with the potato side dish that had a lot of flavor. I would definitely recommend getting some sort of waffles because we saw a lot of people with them and they looked fantastic! Will definitely be back again to try their waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Farmer&#39;s Benedict

VO49f-Gg0B0N0qG--QUujg.text: We came here for the first time today.  We saw your TV spot on the morning news show national waffle day.  The blonde behind the counter told us that we got a free topping on our waffles today. But when we chose the French toast instead of the wall for she said we have to pay $1.50 for the extra topping. I thought that was really weird I'm not sure I would do that to a first time guest but if you're focused on the rules, The delight of having new people visit your establishment,  I guess... we paid $32 for breakfast for the two of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Denver omelette with a side of potatoes
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bananas foster on French toast

JSPo2in35uGGh7ccK790nA.text: Great place for breakfast! College students galore! Food was amazing!  Just a little pricey, get there early or there could be a wait.

L5YJzU3A643g8QiEJ9vKQA.text: I stopped in for coffee after hiking "A" Mountain and was excited when I saw they served PRESSED coffee which is one of my local favorites. It was kinda busy but expected on a Sunday morning. The line was long but I was able to order coffee from the bar.  The coffee was expensive like $4 for an 8oz cup but I love Pressed coffee so didn't mind. I ordered my drink and was surprised when I was handed a cup to go get coffee from the self serve dispenser. I should have known something was wrong then smh   I proceeded to get my coffee which I desperately needed due to my morning hike and of course it was EMPTY! I went to notify a staff members when I very rudely brushed off and told someone should be handling it.  At this point I was to ask for my WHOLE $3.94 back lol. My friend had ordered a smoothie and was waiting so I decided to just be patient. A couple of minutes later someone came out with coffee.  As soon as I tasted the coffee I knew it WAS NOT Pressed coffee. It was disgusting....tasted like dish liquid.  At that point I decided that I would just walk to Starbucks once she got her smoothie.   We found a table as we waited and 10 minutes later she still hadn't got her smoothie.  After checking with the cashier she was told for the 1st time that smoothies were picked up from the bar.  Her smoothie was sitting there, melted:-(  This was my first and LAST TIME COMING coming to encounter!!  UPDATE!!!  I recently went back to NCounter and am happy to say my experience was 100% better this time around. My husband and I stopped in for lunch to a long line.  It was moving pretty fast so we didn't wait long...just long enough to browse the menu.  We opted for a Strawberry Banana Smoothie and the Pecos sandwich w/ a side of pasta salad.    I kid u not...the cashier was handing me my change when I heard our name called from the coffee bar. My smoothie was ready in less than 1 minute.  I've had many SB smoothies in my day and I must say this one wasn't bad. They use orange juice as the base (I prefer Almond Milk) but it was pretty tasty, a little tart from the OJ.   The Pecos Sandwich was perfect! Buttery toasted bread, thick slices of turkey and fresh veggies. We had great seats on the patio and relaxed while eating our lunch.    NCounter has won back my business....I'm a happy customer!

Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

aQXl4l_1EQjkSMFFQ85diw.text: Came here on Easter after church with a friend!!   I absolutely love brunching!! This place is a cute brunch spot & the mimosas are pretty good!! The service is alright. Food is okay.. I got the french toast & my friend got the benedicts! I'll definitely be back to try other items so I can update the review!!

wulcXYbgCunBgKLREPKeQA.text: Quaint breakfast joint. Was within walking distance of the hotel. Located on corner of third and Mill. Outdoor patio, indoor tables with view of outside. Double doors were wide open, beautiful day. Walk up to cashier to place the order. Was met by two very friendly and smiling young ladies. Ordered a spicy omelette. You sit down and they bring it to you. It was huge! More importantly, it was delicious. Great breakfast place.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. San Juan omelette.

797u8CcEDEPAIHjHVgMz8Q.text: Very disappointing. My friends and I went to the Daily Jam for Sunday Brunch and it was so crowded and my Eggs Benedict came out cold. Although the restaurant was packed, we were able to find a table but the table was dirty with crumbs. The restaurant is very loud and is not a place for large groups or if you want to have a conversation. The Daily Jam has a large menu and drinks; and the ordering line moves quickly. On Sundays street parking is free, otherwise, I recommend parking in one of the garages. There are so many other great restaurants on Mill, I would advise going elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

ie73n_yGytWm2HnX_j5DgQ.text: Nice little spot close to Arizona State. There is a college crowd here. You walk in and go to the counter to place your order. The young girl taking my order was really nice and helpful. I had no idea what to order and she was patient. It took a bit of time for our order to come out, but the food was good. I ordered the shrimp chowder and pesto chicken sandwich. Others ordered pancakes, waffles, bacon and potatoes. All of the food was really good and the atmosphere was great. It is a nice place to grab breakfast or lunch. Check them out.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken sandwich and potatoes
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pancakes
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp chowder

ABSVmjrqxUrQkNS3pgNmYg.text: My wife and I stoped here for a late lunch. The food was great. We will definitely be back.

0yzB_2-AdoApuksQzbHEyQ.text: I'll admit it, I have never had egg salad but I am so quick to tell you that I don't like it. While my girls were running the Wonder Woman 5k on a Sunday morning, my partner and I decided we needed some breakfast so walked down to Daily Jam. The restaurant was a little crowded but you walk past the bar and up the counter to order instead of having to wait for a table.   The line was short and we placed out orders quickly. I really wanted a BLT, but it has egg salad on it. I decided to give it a shot. We ordered 2 ultimate BLTs (I think that is the name), a side of potatoes and a drink- to go.  Service was quick, we got our food in less than 10 minutes. I don't recall seeing that the sandwiches come with potato chips on the menu but it's possible it was there and I just missed it. Just in case it's not there, take note. You don't need an additional side. Anywho, the only downfall was that the pick up spot for to go food is on the opposite side of the registers. Since we got a drink, we exited the line like normal but then had to walk back through the sea of people that had now formed in order to wait for our food. The waiting spot is pretty tight. Luckily there is a door to exit onto the patio because at that point, you aren't walking back through the restaurant to go out the front.  We walked out food back to Tempe Beach Park and set up to wait for the girls to finish the run. A couple people stopped by our table and asked us where we got our food because it smelled really good...and it was. Turns out I like egg salad.

dOw2IAlCdhiMydgZx-WtSg.text: It was jut ok. I've been here twice already and it just hasn't hit the mark. The food is just lacking some flavor and not executed well. When my food was first brought out my toast was straight up burnt. But a friendly employee fixed it very quick. And also my vanilla cappuccino was very good!

RB1dH1hYBRqdD1hJzcXSIg.text: This place is very busy. You order your food at the counter, you get your number or in our case a letter and grab your table. They will bring your food to you and you grab your own beverage from the cooler or dispenser. There are outdoor seating available. Menu offers from cold/grilled sandwiches, soups, pancakes, waffles and other baked goods and beverages. A very nice place for breakfast and lunch.   I ordered their Red Velvet Waffle. You have a choice of toppings like fruit, nuts, or chocolate chips. I had chocolate chips for my toppings. I was very satisfied with my choice, the chocolate chips was melting on top of the waffle and it was just a nice creamy texture. It was a nice compliment to the Red Velvet Waffle. I didn't even use the syrup because the chocolate chips was enough sweetness for me. I really enjoyed my breakfast choice this morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Stack of pancakes with peanut butter, banana and walnuts. This thing is huge!
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Red Velvet Waffle topped with Chocolate Chips! I loved it!
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

MxrJYYDnNz4I_66mp54g0w.text: Strange, I already posted a review for this place, but they are making me do it again. Nothing stands out here. The service was great, but the food has nothing that stood out. But again we only ordered sandwiches and that's not their specialty. Apparently eggs are. I asked for no mayo. I got mayo. Again, no mayo. (One of the mangers already wrote me and said they would have corrected it), but we were in a hurry, and I like my food correct the first time. Pretty much ruined the sandwich for me. So I scraped the bread, and ate the parts that were mayo free. The lettuce was quality, none of the iceberg stuff, and my partner said her tuna had cranberries and other good bits in it. I like that. Next time we'll try the eggs.

BtjLGZQeaSQX9lT89EZv0g.text: We are in town for the Innings Festival and stopped by for breakfast after hiking the "A" Mountain.   We found a window seat and perused the menu prior to going to the counter to place our order. The menu had great choices which included both staples and creative variations. I ordered a coffee and a Mescal Mary and my boyfriend ordered a soda. For breakfast, he got the Bananas Foster French toast and a few sides. I ordered the Pear Omelet.   The coffee station was self serve and delicious. The Mary came out quickly. Pretty spicy, but garnished with a piece of bacon.   They deliver the food to your table and when it came out, our eyes had a pre-game feast before our bellies. Everything looked AMAZING. Once we tasted it, our palettes confirmed the deliciousness.   My boyfriend was delighted with his French toast and sides and my omelet was a perfect balance of sweet and savory. Every element was independently delicious and perfectly cooked and married well on the plate.   We will definitely go back again before we make the journey home!

CNgJcEVikr8y-I1j_1sQmA.text: Visiting from Michigan.  Recommended by a friend who was in Tempe last year.  My wife and I had veg omelettes that were delicious.  Friendly and clean.

ARgzkNqPSqS3QyMSekkx3w.text: Tried Ncounter for the first time today for lunch. While they have breakfast and lunch items I wasn't sure what I wanted to eat but decided a sandwich. I really enjoyed the ceddar dip sandwich w/a side of chips. While they were pretty busy for a Friday lunch we didn't have to wait to long for our order. I am looking forward to coming back and trying many more things on the menu.

OvznUFAvd_Pcfaw2ImhVog.text: I went back to NCounter today at the request of management to give them another chance after my incident last week.  I meet with Daniel and he comped me another lunch.  I got the Chop Salad and it was awesome.  It had the normal salad stuff, but also included couscous, corn, cranberries, and feta cheese.  To top it off it came with a pesto dressing that was superb.  I work on Mill and appreciate a place to eat that's consistently good and has staying power.  NCounter is my new favorite!  I highly recommend it, everything I've tried has been delicious.  If the rating was just based on food alone I would have given them 5 stars.  For me, the atmosphere makes it a 4 star rating.  It's very eclectic and modern inside and perfect for this type of restaurant, however I prefer a little less noise so it's easier to talk to my lunch companions.  Thank you to the management of NCounter for restoring my faith in their customer service.

vFi8TQGvxhT3Bm262d-Thw.text: Very good menu and food. I got the simply perfect eggs (over medium) toast and sausage with taters with a strawberry smoothie.  Very good.  Got here just in time before it got crazy busy.  Others got the farmers market sandwich and enjoyed that.  Renee got the bona sandwich and loved that. The only downside, but was promptly fixed, Kevin got the simply perfect as well. He had a hair on his plate but they replaced his plate.  So it was fixed and was delish.  If you are in Tempe and want some good breakfast, Ncounter is a great place.

YcHesORcepZfC1INNXziKw.text: I had a great first experience at N Counter and I will be back.  I'm always looking for a great breakfast spot and the location right on mill is extremely convenient. Their menu is amazing - it was so difficult for me to decide what I wanted, and I'm usually not indecisive when it comes to food decisions. The line was HUGE when we walked in the door - we almost decided to go somewhere else because we figured it would take forever. Wrong! We were probably in line for around 5 minutes; it was moving very quickly. After we ordered, our food came out very fast too. I was impressed. They obviously have their 'flow' down pat and were properly staffed for such a busy morning.   I had the eggs n' chorizo, it was fantastic. The pear omelette caught my eye and I will definitely be trying it next time. A breakfast place that's in a decent price range that serves mimosas, bellinis, and bloody mary's? Count me IN! I will definitely be indulging the next time I stumble in after a rough night.   Nothing much to say about the service. The girl at the counter was quick and efficient and our food came quickly too. You serve your own drinks and any accoutrements you might need (napkins, silverware, hot sauce, ketchup, sugar, etc) are on the counter next to the soda station for you to take at your convenience.   Bottom line for me....the food was amazing, lots of awesome choices and innovative ingredient pairings, and the price was definitely right - I'll be back!

BV0r0KDKMgFwsnSIdyOVOw.text: I went for brunch for two times, and really enjoyed their food and seating.  Omelets are so good. If the weather is not so hot, you can just sit outside chilling with your friends by the street side. Now whenever i feel like a brunch, Ncounter just pops up in my head. Love it!

LdGWsAgVYOTTeEDTrQijYw.text: Great breakfast/brunch joint. It's clean, quick & efficient, and serves above average food. I usually go for their yogurt & granola or original chop salad...so good! Hubby gets a range of things and has never been disappointed. It gets packed for a reason, especially on weekends!

6KQRfBlHSzIyAO2of_2_Cg.text: While I love having a fancy dish at Essence, it's nice to finally have an option for an all-American style breakfast in Tempe that isn't IHOP.  Though often crowded on the weekends, the servers really do a great job of clearing off tables quickly, and checking in to make sure all is well with your dishes. I have been there over 10 times, and have never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a table to open up.  I think the only confusing aspect of the restaurant is how your food is ordered. A few times I have been waiting in line to order at the main registers, when servers at the secondary registers (next to the drink bar) have asked people behind me for their orders. It just feels weird to be standing ahead of someone in line, only to hear them get their order in before you. A couple times, it left me feeling as though NCounter wasn't well organized and a bit put off that my food wait time was increased even though I was ahead in line. That's the reason I have knocked off one star from my rating.  I just learned, though, that you can also order food online. My husband went to pickup an online order and showed up 5-6 minutes early to just be safe and the food was already packed up and waiting. I did wonder how long it had been sitting there before being picked up. Perhaps NCounter would do better if these online orders were 2 minutes late instead of 10 minutes early. Just a suggestion.  The food, though, is fantastic! My favorite items to order include:  * Eggs, Toast, and Grilled Potatoes ($5.50)--simple and tasty, make sure to ask for some extra jam! * Classic Eggs Benedict ($8)--Delicious! * French Toast ($5.50) * The Pear Omelette ($8)--you can't beat this brie and bacon combination.

Oom7qyTSxBP6Waky5crsow.text: The Mediterranean omelette is my personal favorite menu item. This place is delicious; however they close inconveniently early and it's always crowded.

3npms_gIVMod1HnA1nXfVg.text: Great atmosphere and awesome food. The place is worth the money and I definitely recommend the waffles or one of the skillets. Clean place and friendly staff.

QlFOpM9BbRmpLYcE2cv6LA.text: Great omelette, friendly & pretty staff, good espresso, solid music.. and the worst home fries I've ever had. cut up a potato into little slices, lightly heat it up in a pan so it's a little soggy and not crispy, don't add any spices or garlic or anything... nope.

I4uOntKUcwro4zmQzp0byA.text: We ordered the Eggs Benedict and The Killer. The Benedict was cooked to perfection, and the Killer had great bold flavor. Definitely recommend this place.

L7QxK_Ogj4FvRqJI6XQP-A.text: Do you want an amazing meal AND feel like you're stepping onto a CW soundstage? Then this place is for you. Chock full of flavor, fresh food & lots of beautiful people. The bananas foster French toast is just - just - words just cannot do it justice.  I also shared their croque monsieur and would recommend that to anyone with a mouth.  Side note, I feel like the hours this place is open corresponds nicely to the hours I'm comfortable hanging out on Mill Ave (that's another story all together).  I will most definitely be back.

RhO_wVbpfLy3vA73FRM8oA.text: Fresh ingredients, reasonable prices, a friendly staff and a good vibe. When I need breakfast or a good sandwich, that's the place for me in Tempe.

kFXwyF1ROwi1XtjakHSKJA.text: Sweet heavens there's a good breakfast place on Mill now!  NCounter is fast, fun, and tasty. Great portions, good variety, well-executed meals. I've been three times this week, and I've noticed a few minor missteps, but it's their first week and they're off and running.  Loved the bananas foster french toast (though the bananas were a little cool, as was the bacon that came with), not sure if they use real maple syrup, since it was coated in awesome... wouldn't mind clarification on that.  A bit annoyed that they only have Minute Maid lemonade, and a few other things seem to be more quick-and-dirty versions than home-grown versions (the potatoes for instance, which are tasty, but don't strike me as homemade like Liberty Market's or Matt's Big Breakfast.)  Fantastic toast and jam, and good eggs. I tried their chicken sandwich on Foccacia today and it was delightful. Good portion, delicious, and perfectly cooked.  The atmosphere is fun, the cupcakes are dangerously dense and delicious, the seating is flexible, and the service was incredibly friendly and darn fast.   I wish a few things were a bit higher quality, but that's because I've been spoiled to death by Matt's & Liberty's take-no-prisoners approach. NCounter is a great fit, they've done great things with the space, and seriously: three times this week, the office has trekked on down there.

VwKERAqSEjeIPxGE1alCCA.text: Had the eggs benedict and they were average.  The place was hopping though so they must be doing something right!

QJPvDrOd1Cc9YIGd7T9nqw.text: Thank you to Yelp again - we found this great spot so close to the hotel we could walk.  The line was out the door but moved quickly.  The cashier was nice and answered all my questions. Everyone was happy - bloody marys, specialty coffees, great breakfast items.  We will return the next time we are in Tempe.

9MY-ictFSLzB76t6zGPRhg.text: Great food! Only downside is that it is always busy! It can be challenging to get a table, but worth the wait if you have the time.

WH4oBmmjD7fki7KB5hXRxw.text: I've only been to Ncounter once, but I had a pleasant experience and will definitely go back.  My first impression was that I loved how airy and cute and modern the decor is. And it has plenty of seating, which is always good.   I ordered the Farmer's Market eggs, which are a take on Eggs Benedict, and freshly squeezed OJ. The only hiccup with service was that I didn't realize that they don't bring the OJ out to you w/ the rest of the food and they didn't explain that you actually grab it from a little fridge cart near the counter - but that wasn't a huge deal.  The food came out fairly quickly and my dish was super yummy. Eggs perfectly cooked, a nice hollandaise sauce, decent potatoes... and I love anything w/ spinach and avocado. I'm not exaggerating when I say that I was "this close" to licking my plate clean.   My co-worker ordered one of their sandwiches and said it was good, and specifically commented how good the bacon was.   I can't wait to go back and try some of their pastries and coffee.
