The bacon was OUTSTANDING!  And I wish I would have shoved the toast aside to get a picture of the potatoes that came with his breakfast.  They were fried or roasted to a nice golden brown and really went well with the egg yolks.    My mocha was delicious as well.  Did I see they use Press coffee?  That totally makes sense.  I loved it.  With two breakfasts and the mocha, the total was $21.62 before tip.    I did happen to notice all the very fit people in the restaurant who looked like they just biked around Tempe Town Lake, or climbed that hill to the east of the restaurant.  I did none of those things.  Maybe next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. 2 egg breakfast with bacon.  Outstanding bacon!  Tastes like it&#39;s from The Pork Shop.
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Greek omelet with rye toast.  Very nice!
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mocha.

BDA4AVPQJqsYLbfKsM17Wg.text: My coworkers and I always come here to grab a  quick smoothie from their bar. All their employees are super nice and friendly! My favorite smoothie off their menu is the PB&J smoothie. I haven't been able to try their breakfast or lunch yet but I will soon.

7MbW4MOxOnXNTZbsV-xm3A.text: Ncounter is freaking delicious! I got the CLASSIC EGG'S BENEDICT and dang was it good. So, so good. The place is a bit different. Go to the back and order and there isn't a lot of room for a line to form. It was a bit tight in line on a busy Saturday morning. But!!!! the line moved pretty quick and the staff was super nice. Even when the GF tried to order something the cashier said she would ring it in differently to save us money. SCORE!  Make your order, get the little table number thing and then wait for your delicious food.  If I had to change anything I'd say I want a bigger portion for hungry hippos like myself.

Zq6UsW9S5OElgycgBxZyvw.text: Line to order has five people, and two cashiers. Very tight space, and confusing to find end of line, and which way to queue.  Noise is deafening. I make eye contact with one cashier and she doesn't motion me over. I assume she is in training with the other cashier, and keep waiting.   Eventually I walk up and she asks how she can help me!  I said there's a whole line of folks who would love to be helped.  She says, "Well, I said I could help who's next!" as she inserts an eye roll and huffy sigh.  I explained it is loud, so we can't hear you speak, and placed my order.    Fortunately my experience improved from there. Soft drink selection was good, although self-service area is very tight.  Took my number to the patio and my pear and bacon omelet appeared shortly.   It was lovely, and although the sliced almonds added a strange texture, the flavors blended well.  The fruit was ripe and sweet.  Server brought silverware and a tiny napkin in a logo paper bag, cute!  He was very efficient and brought hot sauce and cleared tables quickly.   It began to rain so I moved inside and took a table.  I could then observe clearly how the line worked when there were 15 people in  it.  Much clearer.  Glad I missed the rush!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pear Omelet

uKNGYdnTFYSzi7lx6mbsow.text: Best breakfast around. Gotta try the chipotle breakfast burrito and farmers Benedict!

JBCsTOVv6coKOjorZD8_vg.text: I was going to be doing ambassador work for a rideshare company during the PF Changs race and hunger struck me. I decided to get breakfast here before I ventured over to the mill ave bridge.  Man was this place packed.  But I after receiving my breakfast, Farmers Market Benedict, I learned why it was crowded.   My Farmers Market Benedict breakfast consisted of 2 poached eggs, spinach, tomato, avocado, and hollandaise sauce over and English muffin.  It came with a side of potatoes.     English muffin slightly toasted.  The eggs were perfectly poached.  Slightly cooked whites, barely set.  Yolk the consistency of pudding. Yummy yolky eggy pudding. If yolks that are not that pudding consistency, and you shouldn't call it poached.  Again, these eggs were perfect.  The spinach and tomato were as they should be, spinach slightly cooked, and tomato raw.  The avocado, hollandaise sauce, and side of potatoes added the finishing touches to this fantastic breakfast.   Seriously, just thinking about those eggs alone makes me want to go back this weekend.

9LZuzWMcSU4zeyfldjMIFg.text: Really disappointed in my $10 breakfast sandwich. Bread wasn't toasted, cheese only on one side (means it totally fell apart!), and sausage casing was so tough you couldn't bite through it.   I didn't even touch the potatoes because they weren't fresh. Really, could have gone to McDonalds and been more satisfied.   Traveling for work, so I'll just keep trying different places.

Y5aDQ_nvDTPaYEYK-dbgbA.text: Very much enjoyed my Bananas Foster French Toast while sitting out on the shaded patio.  Plenty of hot, self serve coffee.  The place was a little hectic because of the marathon going on outside.  I proudly ate my carbs in their honor.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bananas Foster French Toast

svZs9OGn2FlZznY3SAi62w.text: Delicious!! Loved every bit of the food here! Will definitely return when in town!   Employees were helpful & friendly, parking was easy & food was fab!

guSfjLlRq3ivv4ahvkP2Dg.text: We had high hopes for our meal, reviews were good, restaurant was full. The person who took out order was irritated to start, not sure why... I guess because they were busy. Then we waited for 45 minutes for our food. I asked a couple of times and was told they were slammed. The guy's next to us got their food in 15 minutes. When ours finally came (2 fried eggs and potatoes) it had two long dark haired in it... Not either of our hair. Ugh...I was super hungry.   I have it back and we asked for a refund. He did come over and refunded us both which was nice but never an acknowledgement of any poor service..Anything. sorry... Never again

Ew2DWbNKQPVNWEUXa3PFRA.text: I had been wanting to try this place unfortunately was disappointed. We  literally waited an entire hour for our food. When it finally arrived my eggs were cold. The "spicy" bloody mary was way too sweet for my taste. I don't need to go back.

f3Owt8XpgU7ydVw4eI2iOg.text: Right across the street from work so this was a breakfast option.  Pretty extensive menu for breakfast. I got the classic egg's benedict. Can't go wrong with this. Pretty filling. I was expecting fresh potatoes, but hey, the fried cubed ones work as well.  The co-workers enjoyed their omelettes as well.

vkgzt0Gq-Y0HlEMkl2wTmA.text: We used to enjoy this restaurant but lately the service seems to really have declined. We had a really awful visit one morning, not even receiving a portion of the meals paid for. I made multiple attempts over the next few weeks by email/fb/phone to try and get in touch with someone to be refunded for the food we paid for but never received. Eventually I got the GM on the phone, she was kind enough and did refund our card. She also offered to send a gift card as an apology. That was two weeks ago and we never received anything. It's too bad, but we don't have any plans to go back now - there are too many other good options nearby.

mIqjsB-h332GAKRauybHdw.text: Delicious sandwich. Waldorf salad was good too. Very busy but lively atmosphere. Food came quickly even though it was packed the afternoon we came.

h2tQ-OxXgBC2mGv2akRFhg.text: The food here is honestly delicious. I got the loaded omelette with a side of fruit instead of potatoes.  I would just recommend not trying to get too fancy with your order. Yesterday I came and I tried to swap out the potatoes for an egg and the toast for an egg. they messed up the order. and today my friend tried to replace cream cheese in his omelette with avocado with hollandaise sauce on the side. They forgot the avocado, left cream cheese out and hollandaise sauce on the side, like asked. And thy overlooked his omelette. He says 3 stars, but i loved my food.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

Prp6ZMeAasjTeru2wrHZVg.text: Um.  Delicious... Food is fast,  service friendly and efficient.  Food is the best yet on this trip.  Huge portions at good prices.

n0PXWXGDZLTIjQnPwDg4Yg.text: We came here because it's pet friendly ( outside patio only). Knocked down a star because no dog menu and didn't bring my doggy bowl of water when requested. Ordered unseasoned potatoes and scrambled eggs for the pup! Their chopped salad was really good. If I had to come back, I'd come for the salad. Breakfast wasn't bad..waffles with fruit and eggs Benedict (nothing special to remember) but the salad I'll remember. My Bloody Mary costed 9 bucks. It was ok. When I want a Bloody Mary, I expect all the olives and celery and bells n whistles. Other than that, it's a good simple breakfast place.  Service was ok. Don't expect a sit down and server checking up on you. You go in, order, take a number, and they bring your food. Guy at front who took my order was nice, the server who brought our meals out was cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

V3U1uQQmG2aF6xghm9Lg0g.text: Not a bad place for brunch! Suits well for college students because you seat yourself and order at the front then they bring the food out to you! I got the chipotle burrito, pear omelette, and strawberry waffles. All pretty good but nothing extravagant about it.   Parking around University is not that great so I wouldn't recommend it to the normal foodie. Like I said, it's more for college students just roaming around campus and stuff

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

9wDxcqZoMb5KAUutnfa3xw.text: Enjoy this place so much that we went back again.  The egg omelettes are great and the waffle I had was superb, with nice topping choices.  Wished there was a place like this in Minnetonka or nearby!  We lack good breakfast places.

GIyYyRXBMiyirNbbeNBtyQ.text: 2nd time here. Food is really good except that the employees, servers and order takers are extremely poor at keeping customers happy. I waited for 45 minutes for my breakfast sandwich and when I politely asked how much longer.  I was told they were very busy,  with a sarcastic tone. Then I had to watch them talk behind the register and point,  while the servers ran food to tables around us,  briskly. Avoiding us all together.  Mistakes happen,  but acting like nothing happened and avoiding us and it's our fault is inexcusable. Poor Service.

TDNel1a-n6DckouXfE6GAQ.text: Awesome little place I got to check out over the weekend.   Let's just say I had a rough night the night before so I just ordered a hot tea haha. BUT...my friends ordered some breakfast/brunch and the food looked delicious.   It has a great little atmosphere and they even serve Frose!!   Next time I'm in town I'll definitely stop by again.

G_KLHqmV_Yx3wvCDOvWk_w.text: My breakfast was decent but I had to eat at a table with bird shit on it. 3 employees walked passed and didn't bother to wipe my table off. Won't be coming back

hq7KbEXgFpLV_ghucAauDA.text: Place order at counter. Get your own drinks.  They bring food to you.  Seems weird for plates items but food was decent though and nice variety of menu.  Could use a bit more attention to cleaning off tables.

9voBS8tNx2rXSPIlPe5nDA.text: The Greek Omelette was amazing! And great cold brew! Nice patio. I'll def be back for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Red velvet waffles

R2SuVz_FdEEa3sri76LWQw.text: I have enjoyed N'Counter since it opened and was curious about Daily Jam, which appears to be the same creative menu. I was really disappointed in the breakfast burrito and should have sent it back. It was a bunch of potatoes wrapped in a  tortilla with the equivalent of 1 scrambled egg and a bit of cheese. It was missing the avocado and was not served with salsa,, which it definitely needed with all of those potatoes. I'd suggest that Daily Jam drop the overpriced $9 burrito and stick to the other options that I know they prepare much better.

15hIZujRqGB7ZnAphRYDdQ.text: The ncounter omelette is really good, I just wish it wasn't drowned in hollandaise sauce. The staff is friendly and the ambiance is chill!

lMPQtArA0x0trwQHSNgXow.text: Came here since we were in Tempe down the street from Mill.  It has a trendy atmosphere; clean, cement floors, wooden tables, bare but with large, interesting art pieces. Inside was spacious and clean. Service was friendly. You order at a counter, seat yourself, and they'll bring your food out when it's ready.  We both ordered the Classic Eggs Benedict. Both meals were wonderful. Thick slices of ham, eggs cooked perfectly, and the hollandaise sauce was perfectly seasoned. Fried potatoes came with the eggs and they tasted so good they didn't need any seasoning or ketchup, etc...  Our experience was great! We'd definitely come back when we're nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Our classic eggs benedicts. Very good!

xHvv-dzEnEyyf9cs_tC9Fw.text: Nice out on the patio for brunch. Dog friendly as well.  Super cuteee!!! Great atmosphere, great staff   The peanut butter cookie was phenomenal!  I loved my portobello sammich with the salad on the side. I should have asked for the dressing on the side. They put so much dressing on it that I couldn't taste the salad.   great presentation by the way,  of course I took a picture of it. Haha :)  I am so coming back!!! Weeeee

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

8xvh8p7WsBM5ZdDKTTOE8w.text: I ate here last Sunday and we placed Our order and were served in a timely manner. My friend ordered the huevos ranchero.rdered the farmers market eggs Benedict with a side of Canadian bacon. After trying different eggs Benedict at different restaurants across different cities, I was sad to say this wasn't the best I've tried. The hollandaise sauce was overpowering and very thick. The avocado was past its peak of ripeness and the tomato lacked succulence. I did however enjoy my cup of vanilla latte. I had the chance to try the huevos ranchero and it was mediocre at best. I would come here again but wouldn't order what I go ever again. I did like the atmosphere and loved the outdoor seating.  I also loved the way and ease of ordering. The servers were quick to give us our food and even if it was crowded their service was top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Huevos ranchero

jar1jDTusIwpkwPlwf8klQ.text: great people, great food, great time. mimosas on deck, chocolate chip waffles on deck, potatoes and bacon and french toast on deck; ncounter on deck

lcoRJgUUP7o6d-FLlcSuig.text: We came for a late brunch on Saturday and the food was delicious! We ordered the classic benny, ultimate BLT, and pecos grilled chicken sandwich, and each person loved their food. I tried a bite of everything and it was all very tasty. I'm glad we came here on a whim and will probably be back.

dkYP8waLBFqnZExgjPsapw.text: GREAT food, GREAT atmosphere, decent prices, subpar service. Every time I've been here (about 5 times or so) I've loved the food, but the service is always pretty bad. Never a smile or a "have a good one" or even a greeting. Seems they do the minimum of taking your order and that's it.. It's a shame because this place could be amazing if they just put a little effort into customer service. It would totally earn 5 stars.  If you're simply lookin for amazing breakfast food then no doubt come here.

XJ0bQDJfQ93HKKc_ewkglg.text: From the time we ordered to the time the food was placed at our table was 30 mins! Then when our food arrived it was cold! All 5 of us had cold food. It was terrible! You can tell the potatoes weren't even cooked long enough, they were soggy and cold. I've eaten here many times, this was the least busy and the worst experience! Maybe it's not busy because they are starting to make so many errors! I'd recommend a dozen other restaurants over here any day now!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Uncooked and cold soggy potatoes

Rp7dMYe6BCr1RFfRRha_nQ.text: Ncounter is a great choice for a quick breakfast.  It's cheap (about $7-$8 per entree), but the food doesn't taste cheap. Like a lot of other Yelpers, I love the Banana's Foster French Toast. I also really like the Peanut Butter Banana Chocolate Muffin.  My wife wasn't as thrilled with her Eggs Benedict, and we thought it was a bit odd that, after we got our food, no one came by to check on us.  We like the fact that their patio is dog-friendly, and that they have water bowls for the pups.  If you're in the area, or just want a quick bite to eat for breakfast, give this place a chance.    Enjoy!

SHRuvOekaT0pz8ymH7OHLA.text: We went there the last two days since we participated in both days of the Rock N Roll Marathon and found it to very inconsistent. 1st day my food and my daughters food was hot and good even though they forgot the sauce for my burrito, but my wife's food was warm at best. Today I went back with my daughter and again they forgot my sauce for the burrito and my daughters pancakes were RAW in the middle! How does that happen? Then I noticed that they microwave the food before it's taken out to make it seem fresh and hot. Very deceptive and disappointing.

exXT4eY_Gs9L4UaPRxMbqw.text: Love, love, love Ncounter! This is the perfect place for a quick breakfast or lunch. I've enjoyed the Chipotle Egg Burrito and the Red Velvet Waffles-TO DIE FOR! I highly recommend Ncounter!

xsXmjA6Dsia_YYj4XDHItQ.text: Your experience at NCounter begins by paying the bill, giving the place a fast-food feel, which is fine until the bill comes in at thirty dollars for bacon, eggs, and coffee for two. (Hint: Don't make people decide on their tip before they see your service. Making waiters work for tips is bad enough without front-loading the decision on a customer who hasn't had their coffee yet.)  Food quality is average for a diner, about Denny's-ish. Coffee was bland and below-average strength. It won't pick you up if you're not a morning person.   Bathrooms are clean and oddly stylish.   Lastly, if you have crowd-anxiety, avoid this place on the weekends. I went on Sunday for breakfast and shared the school-cafeteria-like dining room with at least a hundred people.    I really can't recommend it, overall. Noisy, crowded, and overpriced for what you get and the experience they provide.

gtab5DYp_U0Wxz0ucHXeRQ.text: Been coming here for years, and I rave about the portobello sandwich like it's my grandmas recipe. Seriously, even though I am a breakfast food aficionado, portobello sandwich or bust. I love the location and that outdoor seating is perfect under the trees. The staff is nothing but friendly, and I've always received my food in a timely manner. I've not hit the bar too many times (which is honestly so rare for me) but they just have great iced tea.

Wygj6IzFymy9ek5__LwIfg.text: The food was tasty and the space was clean. Coffee was decent. I got the breakfast sandwich, tasted great. Only complaint is it is slightly on the steeper side for the portion, but that is expected with a downtown location. I would return.

-9Ah5jGcjfXBI2QeEcPCOA.text: A decent breakfast place in downtown Tempe. Not my absolute favorite, but pretty tasty and a good spot on Mill.

2D6v5_xikmGZDoZ5Ujz_qw.text: I had lunch here about a year ago and finally got around to trying breakfast this weekend. When I arrived, the line looked really long, but it went surprisingly fast. I ordered the Hot Juan--an omelette with chorizo, cheese, and salsa, and my boyfriend ordered the blueberry pancakes with a side of sausage. My boyfriend also ordered a milk and was disappointed to find they don't actually serve you a glass of milk, but instead, they have those little Shamrock bottles. I went with the iced tea, and while the jasmine green tea was delicious, the passion tea tastes like Robutussin.  Our meal took about 20 minutes to come out. I think they might have lost our order because I notice people who sat after us got their orders first. Anywho, my omelette was good, but it was a bit too heavy on the cheese and salsa and didn't have enough chorizo. The side of potatoes that came with the omelette were amazing! I would definitely get those again. The blueberry pancakes and sausage were delicious, and even though I am a more savory breakfast person, I might order that next time.  The one thing I really disliked about breakfast is they had loud club type music playing the whole time. I know it's on Mill, but you would think they would make a different choice in music. And then in the midst of all the club music, some sad Bruno Mars song came on...it was weird.  I would have given this place 3 stars based on breakfast alone, but when I had lunch here, it was perfect! I highly recommend the Original Dagwood- turkey sandwich with havarti. The vibe was also a lot more relaxed at lunch (aka I didn't feel like I was at a club).

lSWkaXL1F69fNZUp7MHx1g.text: This place makes me happy and has a little spot in my tummy. Located in downtown Tempe at the heart of it all Mill Ave this place is usually packed. I'm not going to go into all the reasons I enjoy this place there are too many but I will highlight a few things (1) You can order online and come pick it up (2) They have a great outdoor patio. My recommendations   Breakfast- grilled wheat germ granola Sandwich Hot- Portobellini Sandwich Cold- smokehouse avocado stack Salad- Original Chop (My FAVORITE SALAD) the presentation is colorful and beautiful, taste is scrumptious, and pesto dressing is amazing   Only downfall is it closes at 3pm too early for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chopped Salad dressing amazing.

zep2_iSs8x2X0sF0sGOZZg.text: This place is a little too DIY for me. I placed my order at the counter, passing pre-prepared cups of orange juice and baskets of napkins. This should have been my one and only clue... But it was early and I was thinking with my "hangry brain. "  I ordered a latte and it was delivered to me without sugar options or stirs. So I got up to find the missing pieces to my beverage.   My Eggs Benedict was delivered to me with silverware wrapped in a napkin, thank goodness for that much. Unfortunately, I'm a two-napkin (min) eater, so I needed a few more. This waitress was sweet and offered to fetch me some.  Now I know I wrote in my tip that the latte was decent, it was in fact very good. It was so strong that six packets of sugar later, it was slightly sweet.   For a place that was loud and packed, I got my breakfast faster than expected. The kitchen is definitely doing something right. There is also outdoor seating if you don't want to sit inside the noisy mess hall.  Ncounter has this incredible opportunity to be more "green" if they chose to offer coffee mugs as well as paper cups. It's surprisingly cost-saving and since only the staff carries the dishes across the restaurant, low in risk of breakage.  Also, all of these napkins and utensil-bags could be compostable. And sugar packets switched out for sugar dispensers. Imagine if Ncounter was a zero waste/zero landfill establishment...  I only mention all of this because of the excellent job in branding this restaurant possesses. It's modern and open and clearly focused on efficiencies. There is even an Ncounter-branded bike locked up outside. All of this points to an earth-conscious brand, so I was a little disappointed to see the flagrant wastefulness inside.  Overall, I might be back for the Eggs Benedict.

a04CeEqDFgO5yJPsd_WSTA.text: I come to Ncounter a lot, I'm such a fan of this cute urban place on mill ace. After yet another amazing meal, I decided to tell and share with others this fantastic Tempe Find. My personal favorite thing is the chipotle egg burrito. It is delicious and nutritious. But don't think you have to try the burrito, they have a range of others including waffles, pancakes & french toast all loaded with fresh fruit and other fun toppings, they also have non breakfast as well like tasty salads, sandwiches, soups and a huge selection of hand crafted beverages. Not is even the best part, they have dog friendly patio :) so if you haven't been here you need to make it your next stop!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chipotle Egg Burrito w/ potatoes :)

HAk2StR_Mdya3nEAgQe7mw.text: We had to drop our roommate off at the airport so we just yelped places around.  So glad I came across this gem.  You order first then seat yourselves, didn't seem overcrowded which was awesome because seats popped open.  We got the omelette and chipotle bacon burrito.    Omelette- I'm super pickey with eggs.. this was SO good! Everything from the eggs to cheese to veggies were perfect.  I got wheat bread which sometimes can be grainy and dry, it was super moist and tasted great with the omelette, couldnt be happier.    Chipotle bacon burrito- Awesome burrito the chipotle sauce complimented the dish so well and the tortilla was so soft.    A bit on the oily side but its ok, its breakfast!   Definately want to come back to try the eggs benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Omelette
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

TUmxsuGI40i0UxIG1-7zXw.text: There are sweet spots for the timing of Ncounter meals, like any Breakfast/Blunch place. The busy times are jam-packed, while the slow times are still pretty full. Try for 1-3 pm if you can. It isn't as much of a problem as it used to be, as the staff has grown to accommodate the large crowds very well.  Croque Monsieur SVP, although I can never finish the whole thing. The eggs here are...awesome, simply. Never have I seen so many perfectly cooked eggs in so many styles.  The best part for me: grapefruit sangria.

19UqT3jbJAoB9tpn9uGmjA.text: Came here with a friend for brunch.  I loved "the hulk" green juice, Croque Monseiur Eggs Benedict and Hot Juan (runny egg yolks, breakfast potatoes and chorizo are a glorious combo).  It's a nice brunch spot with indoor and outdoor seating on Mill Ave.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hot Juan
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Croque Monseiur

CJ0h-2VGKhDPro5rGxYVCA.text: I love the basted eggs. Perfectly cooked every time. Great place to grab brunch and a drink before heading to an ASU game. It's a bit crowded on the weekends but the line moves quick and so does the food.

Np12l4RTR8fByBl2aPXqFA.text: Food really good. Went for breakfast and everything really good and prepared as requested. Nice selection and friendly staff. Will go again when in Phoenix

CUceRa2lr95g9Kzi4P2mhQ.text: Place was very busy. Good was delish.  Service was very good.  We loved our pear omelette and chorizo sautee! The employees were working hard. We'll comeback for sure.

XRYsfXRMVFraz7cRB0cb9Q.text: This place is super yummy, the ingredients are so fresh and delicious and several menu items are interesting. I also loved the following random things: nuts are combined in to many dishes, the kid's menu was reasonably priced, and everyone working was pretty friendly. We were in town for about ten days and I easily had us visit five times. I definitely recommend!

ZbCYnnjilm-VImQOGqPaRw.text: My first time trying this place was yesterday for lunch, and I ordered the veggie omelette. I specifically asked the guy taking my order if there was any dairy in the omelette and he said yes, there was milk in the egg mixture. But he then said that they could make it special for me, and crack the eggs fresh (I'm extremely lactose intolerant). When it was delivered to my table, I again asked them if they were sure there wasn't dairy in it, and they said it was fine. I ate it with a side of fruit, and I have to say it wasn't bad, actually pretty tasty. When I got home though... that's when all heck broke loose. Extreme bloating, stomach cramps that made me feel like I was dying, and oh the diarrhea. My guess is that they forgot to make it "fresh" for me. So disappointing. I won't be coming back here.

OY8rZ9a_MKur_IhRTGOoxQ.text: We decided to ride the light rail from end to end for something to do. We were going to get off at Mill and grab a bite at Whichwich but they were closed. Their loss. Ended up going here and it was great.  It was busy and filled with ASU students and hikers of A mountain. I got the original chopped salad. See pic. It was outstanding. If you've read any of my reviews you know it takes a lot to impress me and they did. My husband had the loaded omelette and also enjoyed that. See pic. We will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cool decorations for Christmas.
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Original chopped salad.
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

t67qjQ5v0V4sOACGp0cRXw.text: I came here because I needed coffee, and needed to be in this area.  However, I would have been better off walking the 2 blocks and just getting Starbucks, which has its flaws, but hands-down better than this.  The ordering is weird, you can order at the counter (which is not the coffee bar) or sometimes at the coffee bar.   But the espresso shots - not sure what to say about it, I think my office K-cups tasted better than my $4 latte.   but the people eating there for breakfast seemed to be enjoying themselves....

AgchyglE3uFDazHdIhB27w.text: Good food and service when empty but on a crowded Saturday morning...the system breaks down. We waited in line for awhile and when it came to be our turn, we watched as the girl at the register talked babble with her colleagues, the other kid at the register took phone orders, another staff member stood there aimlessly, and another one texted. It was unacceptable to have NO staff members at a register to receive orders from the throngs of people in line in the actual establishment. Then after our order of two items (smoothie and muffin) was finally taken, one was never delivered.

K8gnzDITM9Gdr0VGdyJOFQ.text: Very busy place, which is a great sign! My hubby had the Bananas Foster French Toast which he loved and I had the Simple breakfast with scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon and toast. I loved the potatoes and they also provided butter and jelly on my plate without having to ask! I loved that. We will visit again soon.

IhjllW_Mw_BdX_MeDjf60Q.text: I have been a long-time fan and customer of this restaurant but the experience I had on March 18, 2018 was terrible.  Granted it was the mid-morning breakfast rush on a Saturday but the staff made the situation worse by continuing to take orders and have the kitchen pump out food when there was no place to sit and no prospects of anyone leaving soon.  Some of our food was handed to us as we stood waiting on a table to open up, other food was delivered to our table 30 minutes later and finally, after 45 minutes our two veggie omelets were delivered after repeated trips to the kitchen, interrupting the texting servers and asking them where our order was.  I attempted to contact a manager to show him/her our burned omelets but could not get anyone's attention.  Finally left out of frustration without eating the burned omelets.  Not planning a return visit.  Horrible experience and more embarrassing because we had brought out-to-town guests with us.

VHbxercodtlx7_vIIuyYFA.text: My Husband and I went this morning and everything was perfect!I like the Concept it's simple you order your food first and then you sit down and they will bring your food when it's ready! i gave a 5 star review because they deserve it!  the food is delicious and you can taste the freshness of their ingredients.the kitchen is Wide open so its easy to see how they operate and you can truly see that they use fresh ingredients.its was tasty and will definitely go back plus a lot of healthy choices!!

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Morning Glory Amazing
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chipotle burrito delicious!

QjrOpKNuaFVYfShSsuay0w.text: Good selection on the menu,  food is yummy,  and fair priced. Can be quite busy sometimes,  mainly when classes are in session,  but overall good place to get breakfast in downtown Tempe area.

-D7gUFRKRSApEQk8lw5yww.text: I love this place. They deliver on a trendy cool place to eat, very broad selection, and everything's good. I've been going here for close to a year to have brunch and I always walk away feeling well fed, never gross or bloated.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States

trVDTL67hoXJetAzdbGBUg.text: Just got the Waldorf salad as takeout from here. OMG it was SO good. Frankly, I wasn't expecting it to be that great because this place gets an automatic crowd being on the Main Street.  The ingredients were top quality. The chicken was DELICIOUS. That's not a given. I live nearby and never choose this place because I am always looking for "off the beaten path," but now I will definitely be back!

nGP_1Ap9GGrU6WpS_X9q4g.text: Never as good as I want it to be. A facade of a boutique local goodness. Eating here is like watching reality television, in that it's very bad and we should all stop doing it  Consistently average food in a cool location with OK service. The only redeeming things about Ncounter (Jesus I hate the name even more now that I type it) are that I can crawl there from my condo and the coffee is self-serve.  The food I regrettably find myself coming back here for is the killer, a breakfast sandwich on ciabatta which is about 60% gorgonzola cheese and the rest dark personal shame and bacon.  In short, if you are trying to wake up tomorrow and do a little bit better than you did today, please skip Ncounter. This review was mostly to talk myself out of ever coming back here. Thank you for reading, God bless

XMWXiQiWdyICKbNEilV-Gg.text: I had the bananas forester. It was pretty tasty but it came out a little cold (not fresh off the stove), and it had a really weird slimy texture. The syrup was not normal syrup and I could not get over how snot-like the syrup was, in texture and appearance. Anyhow, I eventually got over it enough to eat it and it was pretty good. Not excellent, but 4 stars.  The service was pretty quick and I thought it was a nice atmosphere.

_My5lqzxmsVX0WBpMnUzXg.text: This place is so good! I love coming here for a late breakfast (great walk of shame parade constantly streaming in Friday through Sunday). Last time a kid from ASU had one arm tattooed to say God's and the other said Gift. Those sort of patrons and people watching makes this an automatic 5 star review.   My go-to is the farmers benedict. The potatoes are amazing, and I love that there are endless bottles of hot sauce on deck. The service is quick and even when it's packed to the brim you will find a spot to sit.

BmyhxGAXQYbo2w2PirrvRQ.text: Ncounter was an amazing breakfast spot! My friend and I went there during a weekday that we both had off and even though it was a little busy, the food came out at a somewhat quick speed, but good food does take time, so once we tasted our food, it was well worth the wait!

F7vz4KXHz8zlVDN1eMdVVw.text: Awesome breakfast joint, one of favorites in the valley. I drive from Gilbert to go here. Great prices and GREAT food.

uT7BQ5mHCK4rtD0c4fLM8Q.text: the good: the blackberry green tea is delicious, the bread and the bleu cheese was awesome. the bad: there was only about 4oz of "thinly sliced sirloin" with equals ROAST BEEF,  for an $11 dollar combo (ELEVEN DOLLAR COMBO)  I require more meat, and actual sirloin..also the amount of packaging involved was shameful. The cups and togo container were the ones that are non sustainable. this is mill ave people..along with a GIANT fucking bag that looked like it would be more for a shoe store, or some retail shit. Still all in all a great lunch, so close to four stars, but the staff were just bullshitting with each other and the cooks, when I see this, and my food takes about ten mins for a fucking sandwich I get mad.

c5R2g-vYrd0Z5n8x9_j24A.text: Went yesterday for the first time, and I had a really nice breakfast.    Had the Farmer's Market, pretty much a play on egg's benedict but with avocado and spinach, so like egg's florentine with avocado? yeah?  The potatey's weren't piping hot, which doesn't bother me at all...I'd actually prefer them not to be.  It reminded me of my dad though, something he'd be all pissy about and want to send back to warm up....So if you're bringing a friend like that there, beware.  The potatoes were really good though, they weren't all greasy and diner tasting, they were as healthy as potatoes can get maybe? The farmer's market was awesome though, not greasy, really light, lots of flavor, and a pretty presentation.  The hollandiase sauce was the perfect consistently, not too thick, and definitely not too thin, and not drenched all over the place. The english muffin was the perfect texture..I hate when it's a hard muffin and you can't cut it, that's the worst. And lots of avocado... thank you!  People can be so stingy with the avocado....feelin' you guys! The farmer's market paired with my bellini, a cutie patio, my friends and the shins playing?  I'd say we did pretty good.  Speaking of my bellini, it was really refreshing, and mostly champagne...feelin' you again Ncounter/ bartender!  When it was dropped off she actually said, "lots of champagne in this one"...I was definitely not mad about that.  And what I thought was fruit inside of it, was actually a peach o ring, like that!  And I ate it at the end, definitely a champagne ring, new fav?   My friends got the eggs benedict, the fruit and granola, some of their toast with their signature (not vignature...vig regulars what's up?) cinnamon apple jam? I think that's what type of jam it was..whatever type of jam, it was delish.    My friends also really liked their food and the overall ambiance of a place seemingly reminiscent to LGO but over in the Tempe area.   Speaking of LGO...Ncounter's food I think is better than LGO's.  There are very few things at LGO that have blown my mind, it's just nice to go there, because it's super cute, a nice neighborhood, something for everyone, picnic tables...you know why we all like it.  Realistically I love going to LGO, because it's always a lovely time with my friends.  BUT I think Ncounter offered an awesome brunch with my friends, and the food was better.    Ncounter will definitely be a new regs place for us... in fact I'll be back today? The salads that went by looked amazing.      Last thing that needs to be said....GET THE PUMPKIN COOKIE.  Holy fricken mother, I think we all died and went to heaven eating that cookie.  I am not even kidding... if those were around me everyday...easily the fast track to morbid obesity.  This being said, you should defs give Ncounter a try.

1TUL-cw1PLY9r7dMOhyNvA.text: Wonderful wonderful!! Finally a place in downtown Tempe where I can get breakfast. I am an early riser ( 7:30 am on weekends!) and nothing is ever open that early. NCounter answered my prayers. I ordered the eggs Benedict with Canadian bacon. So delicious! It's really easy to make the hollandaise sauce too tart. So not the case here. It was very filling and I had the potatoes on the side. My boyfriend got the Pear omelette and it was sweet and salty, the perfect combination. For a drink I ordered an iced chai tea. Perfect! I have tasted iced chais that have tasted like soap before so I was pleasantly surprised when this didn't taste like it. Did you know they also serve breakfast cocktails?? That's right for only $5 bucks you can get a mimosa, Bellini, or bloody Mary. Most places charge like $7. It's within walking distance from my house and steps away from the light rail. Whether you are a meat eater or non meat eater there is bound to be an item that will satisfy your palette.

photos.caption: Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Painting in the gals bathroom
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Traditional breakfast
Photo of Daily Jam - Tempe, AZ, United States. Egg white omelet

_OEOWK-7PBBCn28Lsk8Vvg.text: Went for breakfast last weekend - arrived about 10 to a packed restaurant but managed to find a couple of seats at the bar. Ordered some pancakes, the house Ncounter omelet and a couple of drinks from the coffee bar.   We were told by the bartender to go fetch our own silverware and water. Our food arrived prior to our drinks and my omelet was REALLY cold - like I mean the broccoli was still slightly frozen - too bad considering it's their house specialty - the hashbrowns were also undercooked and the cream cheese glob was just overkill on the omelet.  Our coffees finally showed up, bu they must have run short on milk since there was a two inch gap at the top of my cup.  Fortunately, the pancakes were pretty darn good.   Needless to say, we won't be making the drive from Phoenix again any time soon...

-UGdFBbPdkNsF_WB3pQbbQ.text: We were so excited to try this place out, but the place in general was mediocre and overpriced. The girl behind the counter was pretty impatient and rude even though we weren't particularly slow and it wasn't even busy.  I ended up getting 2 pieces of pretty average french toast with strawberries that looked and tasted like they came from a can or a jar (blech), and two tiny sausages for over $10. Nothing special, and the lack of fresh fruit really just ruined it. My roommate had an omelette and while our food wasn't bad and the atmosphere was nice, it just wasn't quite worth it.

OXHb3p2Cx1KKqR4O0wu1vQ.text: Sweet baby Jesus I love this place. I understand it gets really packed and the servers and bartenders have a lot on their plate, but they're always on top of it and friendly. I've been here many times, and was convinced by my two favors bartenders, Peter and Tim, (Colton's pretty cool too) to write a review. Ncounter has the best omelette and their potatoes are ridiculously tasty. I've brought both my parents here and they loved it. They make great drinks and great food. I see some of these reviews that have negative feedback and I feel that it had just been a bad day for the restaurant. But honestly who doesn't have bad days?! I love Ncounter and it will forever be my favorite place. Ever.

38Ksw6ozlJpuvDxEIIBSAQ.text: A friend and I were looking for a place that boasted delicious food and drinks for brunch last Sunday, and we decided to try out NCounter. We arrived at 9:30 a.m. before any rush, which is ALWAYS a huge plus. I felt lucky. The ladies at the counter were perky for a Sunday morning, which is more than I could say for myself...COFFEE PLEASE!   After deliberating with my friend about which two dishes to choose out of the dozens that sounded fantastic, I ordered The Pear-- complete with bosc pear, havarti cheese, sliced almonds and bacon. My friend ordered the huevos and chorizo! These meals were tres bien and aye aye aye awesome, respectively. The Pear had crispy bacon served up in the cheesy goodness, which was balanced out by the crisp pears and almonds. I enjoyed the array of tastes present. I topped mine off with a Bloody Mary, which was served in a tall glass with just the right amount of spice. Hurray!  The huevos and chorizo was the right amount of mess. The combination of chorizo, onions, grilled potatoes, salsa, cheese with flour tortilla can never steer me wrong after any night, especially a long one. Our waters were consistently refilled for us by wandering good-looking waiters. The aesthetics and atmosphere looked and felt good to me. There is also the right amount of people-watching one can do here, from the hungover sorority types, to the bicycling hipsters, and cheery family members and friends greeting one another. I was entertained.  However, the queue steadily grew towards the door while we enjoyed our conversation and brekkie. So, while I love it, I will never go there during the rush hours. I totally understand some of the frustration about wait times. SO! That said, overall experience was fantastic and I'll get my slow butt up early for breakfast again and again! :)

URK2xgzCwf2gMM7TxCHdjg.text: Pretty good place. I order my food online from Ncounter.com and pick it up 15 minutes later. A bit pricey (if you eat like I do) and the food isn't exactly healthy (seriously, everything on the menu is smothered in butter or a sugar dressing) but it tastes good and it is really one of the only breakfast places around Mill. Their pancakes and waffles are great, though I try to just stick with the eggs and bacon.

MroukmeAwk63mewnzIFxkA.text: Nice spot, cool decorating.  I had a chicken sandwich on focaccia bread and I felt like the bread was really too thin, it couldnt hold up.  Great flavors though, and still worth checking out for sure.  A nice addition to Mill ave.

XzUZet7y3xqpqtNfPQ-CRQ.text: Usually when I find something I like at a restaurant, it's the only thing I'll ever order. At NCounter I have to try something different every time, and have yet to be disappointed. My only complaints are that they are on the slow side, yet they always seem to have a ton of asu students working. Would be 5 stars if the wait was less than 15 minutes for a to go sandwich!

L4pbPvVdan1IRmQzvJ0rZg.text: i like the home fries here!  they know how to make a proper eggs benedict!

XNLKlKF9l7VKfFcJUc44WQ.text: We went for breakfast, and it was amazing!  The environment was cozy, modern, and friendly.  We ordered at the counter, and the food was brought to our table in about 10-15 minutes.  The food was totally amazing!!!  Perfect portion sizes, perfect prices, perfect taste!  I will definitely be going back!

n17qgcsGf4hConElnZWDYQ.text: I was in Tempe for Ironman AZ (spectating my awesome IronMOM) and stopped here twice.  The place opened at 4am for the event, so we were able to stop in for coffee and a scone after we dropped off our racers.  They were ready for the crowd and although the line was long, it moved quickly and the staff was friendly.  The coffee was good and the scone was tasty. After loop one on the bike we decided we needed something more substantial than a scone (spectating is hard work!) and returned to NCounter for lunch.  It was packed.  But again, although there was a line, it moved quickly and the staff was friendly.  A table opened just before we got to the cashier and I grabbed it.  We both had the vegetarian omelet with a side of toast.  I don't know what the jam was but it was tasty!  I think it may have been an apple cinnamon?  Very Fall flavorful.  The omelet was big and full of good veggies and cheese.  Everything was fresh and it wasn't at all greasy.  It came out nice and hot.  I would have eaten here again had I stayed longer.  Good job NCounter!

f2BilKEd_OovKaXhXj6pfQ.text: I've never been to the actual building, but a girl brought half a dozen of these to my BIL when he was visiting. Some of the most BEAUTIFUL cupcakes I've ever seen; but also some of the most disgusting. Too dry and the frosting was way too sugary. If they hadn't been a gift none of us would have touched them.

WnX-zNlw7faA-i-twoeDLA.text: Stopped in here this past week to grab breakfast. Had a delicious chai latte and decided to get lunch instead. Had a great sandwich with cream cheese and jalapenos! Get vibe and atmosphere to! Super modern.

RfwJ5Mog_m9PI_Ygom9eDQ.text: I've been here twice for both breakfast and lunch and the food was luscious. I want to try everything on the menu. Best thing to happen to Mill Ave. in years.

gBq4k9V8bntB6gAV7FDEYQ.text: Got some coffee on a very busy day. Line out the door. I was looking for some honey to put in my joe and they didn't have any out front in the lobby. Roland (employee) asked what I was looking for and said they had some in the back but I said I was ok. Without me knowing he went in the back, got a to-go container of coffee and tracked me down on the street to give it to me. Will definitely give them my business next time in town. Roland is the man!

3KkBS2Hwg1uyuWnWGiJRPg.text: This was my first visit to Ncounter but it won't be my last "encounter" with the place.  The food was good, the service was excellent and the atmosphere was pleasant for such a busy place.  There was plenty of seating, too.  This will be a great place for those headed to a game to stop in for a bite to eat either on the way there or on their way back because the lightrail is right across the street.  I have also tried this owner's other restaurant, T.C. Eggington's in Mesa and really like it too.

ZFavy7tDszy5tgGlp5nh6Q.text: Loved this restaurant , good food.  Very nice location and fun food!  Walk to Tempe Beach Park , to the Mill, Metro line.
